reviews.review: Wow. We spontaneously decided to visit the Tegenungan waterfall after visiting Bali Safari and Marine Park. It was our last day here, so despite not having our swim wear, we still decided to go to visit the falls. We had to pay 5000 per person to enter the waterfalls area. Some guy tried to sell us his tickets in front of the ticket office, claiming that he didn't use them, but the staff stopped him. We decided to purchase the tickets from the office instead because we don't know what the guy's intention was. We later found out that they don't take or check your ticket, so the guy probably entered the waterfall and just wanted to sell them. But they were just 5000 per person! You have to walk down some big steps to arrive at the waterfalls. It was easier to walk down those stairs wearing running shoes, but it would be more convenient to wear flip flops if you're gonna get wet. There were many people at the waterfalls and we totally regret not having our swimwear. It was beautiful. After visiting the waterfalls, we went to sit down in one of those cafes to have a coconut while enjoying the view of the falls.

Great!. We visited today and made the climb down to the bottom! We throughly enjoyed it! It costs 10000IDR per person to enter the village but I think that's to help with rubbish costs! The waterfall itself was clean and absolutely stunning!! Would recommend to anyone

Awesome waterfalls. I think we visited on the hottest day ever, we made sure that we had water! Looks amazing from the top - stairs were a tad steep and not recommended for all.The place was nice - a bit packed given the heat that day but was nice. Could do with a bit of a clean up. Nice place to take photos.

Amazing Waterfall, a little dirty though. As far as waterfalls go, this was an awesome one. A lot of photo ops and the ability to go into the wade pool below the waterfall as well as view the waterfall from the top. We got some really good pictures and got to cool off since the humidity is super crazy in Bali. It is a super steep walk back so be prepared for that. We saw a few people have to stop a couple times because it was very strenuous on them. As far as the actual wade pool it was a little dirty due to the rain and we were warned by hotel staff and our driver that some times it's not ideal to even go in the water so be aware of that too. Definitely a nice place to visit, but I think if we ever visited again we would find another waterfall that may be less frequented and ruined by so many tourists and trash.

disgusted. I'm not one to write reviews & this is not anything new, Bali has a SERIOUS problem with rubbish, especially in their once beautiful, spiritual waterways.I enter the water & am immediately drawn back by how much trash is falling from the falls. I see a dirty diaper float past me. Look, this water can't be safe to swim in. It's contaminated with feces, urine, rubbish.

Beautiful waterfall. We did not walk to the base of the falls, but enjoyed the view and shuttle spray from the lookout. There's a small restaurant and if I had known I would have planned enough time into our visit to have a drink there and enjoy the view.
Steep walk so not suitable for all. Beautiful place however take care of it people - there is so much rubbish around and needs to be loved more.

Ms. It was a beautiful sight to see. But I couldn't believe we had to pay a small entrance fee just to see the waterfall. I was only able to see it from up above. Its a long walk down to the waterfall but once you get down there Im sure you'll enjoy the water. People were in the water, swimming to the waterfall and just enjoying the view. They do have vendors and small little food stands. Its very hot in August so do stay hydrated.

Waterfall - tick. We like seeing waterfalls around the world, so asked our Voyagin tour guide if he can bring us to one whilst on our full day tour of Ubud & Tanah Lot. He took us here. It didn't look like the cleanest water to be swimming in but that didn't stop the tourists & locals. I read reviews where people have seen rubbish & used sanitary pads floating in the water whilst swimming there. Errr....gross. We came here just to see it, not to swim though. The waterfalls don't take much of an effort to get to. From the street it is maybe a 5min walk down a steep set of stone stairs. We could go right up close to the bottom of the falls & feel the mist of the water crashing at the bottom. Pretty impressive & powerful! It was so humid when we went. Sweat non-stop. And walking back up the stairs was a bit tiring even for us young folk. So drink lots of water.
best waterfall in bali. loved the walk and then a lovely swim to cool us down after and the a little explore round the place so cool :) :0

Beautiful spot.... better if your fit... 😀. We didn't venture down to the falls (the poor old legs might not have held up) but opted for a table at the little warung overlooking the falls. Fixed menu but very enjoyable. Beautiful views of the falls (see photo)

Beautiful Waterfall...... This place was awesome. We took 45 - 60 minutes drive to get here from Kuta area. It is located near Sukawati (Pasar Seni Sukawati). The entrance fee is IDR 10.000 / person (locals or foreigners). There are several shops and toilets (IDR 3000/person).If you want to go here, make sure you are fit because you must take the stairs to go down to the waterfall. I don't know for sure how many steps but it was a bit steep. It took 10-15 minutes to get there.After you arrive in the waterfall, you can go up to the waterfall but you have to cross the small wooden bridge and take another stairs (not so many). Don't forget to pay another IDR 10.000 / person to go to the top.Anyway, you can swim and play around in the waterfall. Just be careful because it was a bit slippery.Overall, this place is one of the great outdoor activities in Bali.Visit in October 2016.

Love it! . Only a 20minute scenic scooter ride form the heart from Ubud. These waterfalls are awesome. So refreshing and a great place to escape the heat! I went with some friends and we loved it. You can hire a sun bed otherwise you gotta sit on soft rocks. There is markets and fresh coconuts and other cold beverages. You don't have to pay to go into the waterfalls so don't be fooled :)

Beautiful waterfall and nature around . Beautiful waterfall and Nature around...Take a while to walk all the way down to the waterfall, but once you get there you'll forget the tiredness.And don't forget to at least bring small bottle of water. As you'll definitely need it on your way back. To many steps up..

Lovely waterfall. It cost 10K to get down to the river. I wish we had brought our swim wear and towels. There seems to be no wear for changing. There were quite a few people in the water and around. The water was not perfectly clear, however it looked good fun to be under the waterfall and behind. You can climb up the other side to see the drop if you don't mind a few log bridges and more stepsThere are a lot of fairly large concrete steps down to the river- what goes down must come up. Personally, we took our time coming up ( we are pensioners) and had no problem. We had, for 25K, a coconut in the cafe on the right after the steps- it was straight from the fridge, opened in front of us- with two straws we had more than enough to drink ( we eventually took it back to our car)- well worth the walk back up the steps for!
Lots of steps!. There were a lot of steps to get there and coming back was all up hill but it was worth it. It gets very busy with swimmers so go early if you want peace or to take photos.

Very impressive falls. This is without a doubt an impressive, thundering waterfall, spoilt perhaps by the sheer number of people there and the litter they leave behind. But then again, we were tourists too so who are we to complain! Loads of eating and drinking places if you're in need of refreshment, and plenty of viewpoints of the falls on the way down to the bottom - also lots of foliage if photographers fancy the challenge of getting a shot without too many bathers in it - good luck!

Very refreshing to stand by the fall, but the water color is a letdown. Easy to get to, but steep stairs leading to the waterfall.Once at the fall, the feeling of the mist from the fall is awesome. Take a dip under the fall If you don't mind the brownish water.The warungs overlooking the falls have awesome views, but the best seats are usually occupied !

nice water fall. Reach around 2pm.. a lot of tourist it's a bit of risk as you need to be mentaly prepare to go down and up the step..because it's is very tired and totally muscle leg pain! But if u r fit not to worry..but everything was fine only the step.. the water fall was the best experience as it's so natural ...you can swim the cold waterfall and also there is a small shop whereby and a toilet down near the waterfall when you fresh up and chill before and after the step and also a few food clothing shop upper area where be fore you start to go down.. am happy but pain..

A must visit place in Ubud. The approach to the falls may not be the greatest; but once you are right at the falls, it is worth the walk. Was a tad too crowded when we went there but hey, if you decide to have fun, then there is nothing that stops you. One can go right under the falls. Do try and walk behind the falls and sitting behind the rocks. It's the best feeling ever as the water splashes on you with force and the feeling is equivalent to a massage. The sound of water splashing is soothing to the ears and its a bound to make you reach a state of bliss. The best part is -- one need not necessarily know swimming to enjoy all the above.It's not advisable for people with knee issues or older members of the family who may not be physically fit as there are about 150 steps to the falls most of which are quite steep. There is no wheelchair options etc. Good thing is there are paid restrooms en route which is no very common otherwise.

Overcrowded, but woah. It takes you a fair amount of steep steps to get there (the way back is even more fun) but the waterfall is majestic and the area around it is covered in green nature. The view from the top walking down is amazing, since there are a bit too many people at the bottom. You pay 10.000 RP to visit, but if you wanna go a level up they ask for another 10.000. A bit weird, but worth the money.
Beautiful. Beautiful water fall, great pictures oppotunities. Worth a visit. You have the opportunity to wade in the water close to the waterfall.
Just ok. Nothing much special, the color of the water is kinda off. Too much crowd as well. Don't expect too much from this waterfalls.

Quite easy to find, nice but overcrowded. Paid 15.000 for entrance pp, quite easy to get to the bottom, only few spots could use some railings. I think you have to pay extra to get to the middle part but not sure. We went only to the top and bottom. Very crowded, unfortunatelly.

AMAZING Tegenungan Waterfall and Amazing Cafe - Bumbu Asli.... Tegenungan Waterfall was spectacular, the beauty, the power, the sound was breathtaking....Its a long walk down, a lot of stairs (which was harder coming back up mind you!) and a few narrow paths but definitely worth the effort. The water was clear when we were there with a few swimmers enjoying the beautiful lagoon at the base of the falls.A beautiful stop on your day out in Bali...But a definite must visit is the little Cafe Restaurant at the top (just passed the stairs leading down to the falls) called BUMBU ASLI. It would have to be the best Strawberry Panna Cotta I have ever tried (and I love Panna Cotta). The prices were so cheap, the quality was fantastic, the owner / Chef was so friendly and the view... well breathtaking!

Pleasant waterfalls . Went to this waterfalls. It cost 10k to enter and go past. Parking was free. Just warning you now that be prepared to do a bit of climbing back up once you have finished. The waterfall itself is beautiful can be too crowded sometimes there is a pleasant shower / mist around. Great area to take photographs and not just of the waterfall.

Overrated. Not a very epic waterfall.Also locals put a table everywhere and ask for money. If you want to enter area you pay. When you go down you pay and when you want to go to top you pay again. Water is not clean and jungle path is full of trashes.They ask for money but dont bother to look after it.If you have time you can visit it but on short time no need to spend here

FILTHY!!!!! USED SANITARY TOWELS. Find a different waterfall to go to. You pay 10,000 per person to enter and 10,000 to go higher up the waterfall. What the hell are you paying for? They could at least clean the place! It's a con. The waterfall is nice but the area is filthy. Litter, garbage, rubbish everywhere! We saw 2 sanitary towels, 1 used one floating in the water!!! DISGUSTING!

Waterfall. We came here on our last stop of a tour around the area. We got in and it was full of shopping stalls and we paid a ticket price - not exactly sure what this was for. And we looked down into the waterfall and there were so many people down there and it looked quite dirty. We ended up not walking down (it's probably about a 25 minute walk down steps). Seemed a bit spoiled by tourists/ pollution. It could just have been the time of the year we came and will maybe try again on another trip to Bali in the future.

Nice waterfall, very busy and water is dirty!. It was quite hard to find at first but when we got there we could tell from the amount of busses and scooters standing around that we were at the right place.Stairs are steep and very hard to climb in the midday sun. I know it's tempting to go into the water for a refresher, but for me this was to much. Water was so dirty and polluted that I got the worst stomach pain afterwards. I wish I would have known in advance and I did not even dipped my head into the water. Take a shower afterwards!Nice to take pictures though!
Beautiful. A great place to sit and relax and take photos. gets very very busy though...so not as relaxing as it could be!

Nice scenery . It is actually a nice place , unfortunately we went there after rain , so the waterfall cloudy ,
Plus , you have to restore some energy after having fun , because u need to climb up the cliff ..

Nice spot. Hello,
I was there with my wife we Had The chance to have a good weather so we swam in The waterfall. It was clean And fun to swim down The big waterfall.
Have fun guys!

Excellent attraction while in Ubud area!. Excellent attraction while in Ubud area! Beautiful waterfall, you can swim in the water if you want. Bring your swimming clothes, towels and flip flops if you are coming here. Great place to take photos and enjoy the scenery. Lots of steps that you need to walk down to get the waterfall so becareful with your steps. Good place to do some FX exchange close by at the shop close by with good rates.
Beautiful Waterfall. The waterfall are really nice. If you have enough time add it to your trip.There's a nice market and the entrance is free.

Amazing views. We enjoyed our visit to the Tegenungan Waterfall. We had small children so didn't walk down into the valley to have a closer look. Quite a few people were swimming in the river. We enjoyed our view whilst sitting in a small cafe. There were a lot of shops and stalls selling souvenirs etc Pretty place!!
Beautiful Waterfall. Swimming at the bottom was a wonderful experience, even if the water was not so clean, and the trek back up the hill quickly put paid to any cooling benefit of the swim...

Easy to reach. Short walk (130? steps, but sweat is good for your skin) and nice view. Very friendly atmosphere, any- and everybody enjoyed him/herself.Relatively touristic but the mix of cultures made it harmonic.Water is not really cold:-)

Pretty, but make sure to go there early!. This is not the most beautiful waterfall around, but it is very close to Ubud and therefore easy to visit. Just make sure to visit early in the day as the steps from and to the waterfall can be pretty tough to climb during the warmer parts of the day! Another plus of visiting early is that there will be less tourists around. We were there around 2PM and during our visit the place was swamped with tourists.Do try to combine a visit to Tegenungan with, for example, one of the nearby coffee plantations to taste some of the different tea as well as the famous kopi luwak (Cat-Poo-Chino!).

Go to the top!. This is a beautiful waterfall close to ubud, which makes it quite crowded. I would suggest paying the donation and climbing to the very top. There it is very peaceful and you can dip your feet in the water. So beautiful and calm!

We came, we saw, we left. We were there on a "low water level" day. The waterfall was still pretty, but there was a decent muddy trek to go see it. We just took pictures from the touristy area above the valley. It was on our way to other sites, so it was fine. I would not go out of my way to see it unless you really want to wade in the water.

Beautiful waterfall. Waterfall was lovely, went for a splash in the pool. Not too crowded, great views from the top. Lost one star because the heavy rain had meant that we had to leave early as the dam on top of the waterfall overflowed and a brown muddy river of water poured over the top and flooded the area. My suggestion would be maybe don't go when it has rained heavily the same day.

Great spot for a dip and photo. 10,000 Rp entrance and parking fee it's not a long walk but steep and the kids loved the waterfall but took some encouragement on the walk back up for an ice cream great spot for a photo in front of a waterfall
Gorgeous Waterfall. Stunning scenery, incredibly tranquil setting; and the most amazing swim - be sure to pack your swimsuit !

Nice waterfall on the way to ubud from kuta. Nice place to take a dip during your way to Ubud from South Bali.Entrance fee is IDR 10,000 per person, then you have to walk steps down for about 200-300 meters from the parking area.There you have a big pond with the waterfall which you can dip in.. Water looks clean, however do be careful because the landing is rocks and could be quite slippery... It is also possible to go up to the top of the waterfall, however do bring some money coz you have to pay another ticket to go there ( another IDR 10,000 per pax)A bit sad that the locals didn't really develop the area to be neat. Most of the developments are restaurants and Cafe which brought down the natural feelings of the area.However the waterfalls surrounding is still quite clean.Recommended if you come here with strong members.. Not recommended for old people due to the steep steps...
Waterfall and swimming. Bring your swim suit and a towel and take a refreshing swim after the long walk down. Be prepared for lots of stairs.

Beautiful. Absolutely worth the 10k rp to enter. Beautiful. Hike up to the top (for an additional 10k) and wander along the river for a calm and peaceful place to swim.Note: there is an entrance at the top of the waterfall which means only paying 10k.Plenty of places to buy souvenirs, grab food or a drink there.Free parking

Lovely waterfall, good views.. You have to buy a ticket which is cheap.There are a lot of steps down, big steps, so consider that if you have young children or older people.Really nice view, can get some good pictures, quite rocky going into the water so watch your step.There will be a guy selling drinks and really cheap Bintangs so go for one.

Not suitable with Kids. It's not suitable with kifs road is not good ... a lot of stairs until u reach to water falls , swimming is allowed .. I think it is better to have a coffee in the coffee shop beside the parking and enjoy the good view.

Beautiful & worth the walk. Many step to climb down and then back up but well worth it. As we were walking down we saw monkeys crossing the river and sitting in on the rocks in the middle of the river.Once we got to the bottom, we couldn't resist taking a dip in the water. Exhilarating view and a very pretty waterfall. Be aware that if you want to change into swimwear or use the toilets there is a small charge at the base of the hill.

don't resist a dip in the water !. It is not an easy ride to walk down the steps to reach the waterfalls but it is so worth it. I would advise anyone going there to do some precautions: do not leave your clothes on the rocks around the waterfalls as this does not protect them at all from water and once you return from your swim, your clothes will be also very wet. To fix this you can pay around 10 000 rupees to the kisok on the way and get a locker with a key. The view from above was also very nice, and swimming is safe and easy. very enjoyable

Beautiful and Fun. The Waterfall is beautiful! Go early to avoid crowds. Take extra cash, you need to pay extra to get to the top!No charge for parking. The stairs are a little high but not the way some say. I'm not very fit and made it easily.

Very powerful and refreshing shower!!!. Well worth the visit, about 10km from Ubud centre. Quite a few steep steps to the base but worth the trek! Wasn't too crowded on the day .... had a refreshing downfall lol! Great place for selfis!!!

Very busy loads of steps. It has Some pretty spectaculair views but I think Bali has more pretier places to visit. We are traveling with our 16 month old Son and thats no problem but do note there are loads of steps and you cant use Your stroller.

Stunning. The waterfalls are in a canyon and there's a set of steps winding down to them. There are several places to buy refreshments on the road at the top and a small bar at the bottom. The canyon and waterfalls are stunning, and you're allowed to get in the water and swim or wade out to the falls and the cave underneath them, so bring a swimming costume. The walk back up is steady but it isn't as challenging as people seem to suggest and is certainly worth it to visit such a pretty and picturesque place.

Busy but worth a visit! . Only half an hours drive from Ubud along a scenic route this waterfall is definitely worth a visit! We hired a bike and headed down by ourselves. Entry was only 10k RP each so great value. You can have a swim in the water with plenty of opportunity to take pictures. If you wish to walk to the top of the waterfall this costs a little extra. We decided not pay for this as we were having fun swimming in the pool below. Unfortunately it was very busy which took something away from the experience but still a great spot.

Waterfall is ok but there so many tourists.. The waterfall it self is really beautiful to see. The entrance price is 10k and after that you first need to cross several shops before you enter the park. A long staircase with 300 steps down is ahead of you but you can see already the waterfall which is beautiful! Only all that tourist with GoPro's and selfie sticks with iPhones.... way to much.If you can set that apart from your experience it's great and you should really do it. We thought it was to crowdy there.

What a thrill!. My two kids (7 and 9) and I visited the waterfall around 3pm and it was not too crowded. The steps down to the bottom of the waterfall are steep, but not long. Once down there we found a place to stow our bags (I wish I had left my stuff in the car for safe keeping) and jumped into the water. The spray of the water and the sound of it crashing into the pool at the bottom is intense, but wonderful. Fortunately my two kids are great swimmers, so they were fine, but I'd keep extra close to any kids who are not totally competent in the water. The water current is strong and the rocky bottom can make walking in the water unsteady. We had an absolute blast playing in the water and slowly but surely getting closer and closer to the waterfall as we became comfortable. But, I kept reminding my kids to respect the water- it is incredibly powerful and it is apparent that one over-confident move could lead to an accident. This is one tourist attraction in which you get to actively engage with the site, rather than just look at something, and we all loved it!
Cheap entry. Well worth seeing our driver took us there , food and drinks were cheap enough , view was nice water a bit brown advised by our driver not to swim in it , but many were.

Very refreshing, picturesque waterfalls. We arrived around 11am and yes it was a little busy but not overcrowded. Very powerful waterfall you can get in and swim about it. Lots of shops and cafes to buy water etc nearby. You have to go down a load of steep steps to get to it, but it's well worth it. 10k entry fee and they charge you an extra 10k if you want to get to the top too.
Worth seeinf. The waterfall is worth seeing but incredibly crowded. There's also a fair amount of rubbish floating around which slightly ruins the ambience...

Too many steps but nice place. A very especial place...There are too many high steps that when you return is a hell...
Anyway, the place worthwhile

Very nice. Nice trip and walk to the waterfall and opportunity to swim. Drinks and food available.
Only after rainfall the water is a little "sandy"

Nice scenery. Nice views and feeling relax by the waterfall noise...
10 000IDR fee to access the waterfall and another 10 000IDR fee to access the mid way and top waterfall...
Second part was far less crowed which allows you to relax.
To do on nice sunny day...

Beautiful; earlier the better. Be prepared to walk up and down a lot of stairs in the hot and humid air. It is easy getting down, and the waterfall is amazing and refreshing. The walk up is filled with large steep steps, that goes a ways up the cliffside. I recommend a good plunge in, before the dreadful walk up. I also recommend buying water, and the hand fans for sale. The earlier in the day you go, there are fewer tourists, and the air is not as hot.

Be Prepared to Do SQUATS on the Way Up. The view is amazing, many food and souvenir vendors before making the trip down the many stairs to the bottom. Also close to the end of the trail you'll find more vendors and some bathrooms that you can use for a small fee. Depending on the day, it can be a lot of people. I happen to be there on a Sunday and during a Hindu holiday so my driver let me know there were more people than usual, still had plenty of room to leave my clothes along the shore and enjoy the water. Warning-be prepared to literally do squats on the way up. Yes the stairs are that high/far apart.
Amazing!!!. Today we swam in a stunning huge and roaring waterfall! What more is there to love?! It was amazing!!!
Early much better. It is 25minutes driving from Ubud to get here. The hidden waterfall, nice to swim, entrance is 20k well worth. Be careful when get closed to the falls, it is bit slippery.!

Was still good to see. Be aware you need a good level of fitness to reach the waterfall. With over 160 steps (my niece counted) to negotiate it can be challenging. Some of the steps are breaking up and with no handrails on the top section you need to proceed with caution.Reaching the waterfall the water is not clear and upon entering a little rough under foot.
waterfall. the closest waterfall to Ubud is in Tegenungan...you can have a bath in the water down the waterfall after paying a small fee and there's a warung in the area..

Stunning. Stunning views from the top, stunning views from the bottom. The descent down the (somewhat large and uneven) stairs, and the climb back up are hard work (especially in the humid weather), and you're likely to find large crowds down in the water, but it's such a wonderful sight to behold you probably won't mind. Be sure to grab a cold drink in a shop before you make your way down the stairs.

Its a waterfall. Unless you want to swim its a nice spot for a drink, some souvenirs and a look. I will post a photo so you can see it if you dont want to go. The water isnt clear by any means so not sure where it comes from. Hey its giving the locals an income so I am happy about that.
Spectacular! MUST VISIT. There is an entry fee -I do not recall what it was but it was well worth it!. Lots of steps to walk down to the stunning waterfall! Wear flip flops!

A must go Waterfalls. If you already went to other waterfalls, then no need to go to Tegenungan Waterfall, as it is not one of the best. However, for me I enjoyed it a lot as it was my 1st time to such a beautiful thing.There is no entry fees, however you should bring some money to use the showers and toilets.There is no lockers, so don't take anything with you. better to leave it at your car.

Ordinary sight - properly showcased. Having been spoilt by the sight of Niagara and the Iguazu falls I found it pretty ordinary.May be people go there because it is part of ones tour itinerary and this the precise reason we went there.It has been showcased properly and the place teems with hawkers displaying all kind of fares that one may not need at all.

Not up to other waterfalls in the World.. A walk through the markets, to look over the side to view a dirty swimming hole that even our guide said locals do not swim in. My husbands comment was "they need to look at NZ's Hunua Falls"

Getting Better. Our awesome drive Hadi had mentioned to us after visiting Ubub's monkey forrest that this would be a great place to visit on the way home.We were told that the locals are now developing this place into something "touristy" as before it was just a dirt road and not much else. Now there are a couple of eating places at the top as well as the bottom of the long steep stairs. It looks that there is no other way up or down, and it is a long walk in the heat. Make sure you are up to it. We passed many people sat down after giving up before getting down.There are now a few vendor stalls along the way with all the normal Bali fair, just in case you want another Bintang singlet. And there are toilets at the top as well. There was a minimal charge to get in. This was charged by the locals and was used to refurbish the place. The first thing they could do is clean up the rubbish at the bottom of the hill, but being Bali cleanliness has never been a high priority.Be aware the water is cool and refreshing at the bottom but it is all small smooth rocks making it a little unsteady to walk about with any sort of grace.

Pretty, but.... Targeting an is very close to Ubud Central and so is normally packed. It makes it hard to get in and enjoy the spring under the falls but it is a nice view all the same. Do have lunch in one of the restaurants overlooking the falls.Unfortunately it had rained heavily the night before, which causes mud to be released into the falls and Browns the water. This changes the whole aesthetic so be mindful.
Nothing much but just a waterfall. There are nothing much to do there except to look at the waterfall. It is not quite suitable for family with oldies or young children.
Over populated like most of Bali . If you want to go here, surely visit in the morning hours. As well I recommend the hidden canyon for a much more into the wild/waterfall experience.

I jumped!. Jumping is not advised, but the brave and crazy people do.
This is a great place to visit (even if you dont jump) for the able bodied. There are a lot of steps to access and exit, and the water is strong. However with this comes great views and a fun afternoon out.
Nice waterfall. We took some photos from above. If you have enough power you can walk about 300 stairs down and have a swim.

Rubbish. I planned a lot of our itinerary for our honeymoon myself so needless to say I was sorry I dragged my tired husband out of bed to go here.We left central ubud at 700 and got to the waterfall at 730. Only 10k per person to get in and since it was so early there was only 1 other person there.... We went early because I had heard it gets crowded.the waterfall itself is very pretty but I've seen better and the waterfall is very touristy - I could see how unappealing it would be midday. I can see how beautiful it probably was in the past. we came ready in our bathing suits for a swim but the water was dirty (maybe because of the recent rain?) and there was so much trash! Water bottles, plastic bags, even a baby diaper! We left disappointed. So far this has been my only itinerary regret. I would not waste your time....
Overcrowded. Entrance fee: 10.000 IDR/personEasily accessible by flip flops and not a lot of stairs. Other much prettier and less crowded waterfalls near Ubud to see.

Yes, go chase waterfalls. Start with this one. It's the closest to Denpasar apparently. We arrived well past midday and it was packed! And it got more crowded even after we left. Entrance was only 20k. Motorbike parking was 2k. Be prepared to climb down and up the steps. It was a thrilling experience to stand right under the waterfall.

Think twice. Think twice!! If you plan to skip this place or if you are planning for your trip.It was a really awesome waterfall.We went real early in the morning and we are the only person there.The excitement will keep your mind away from the steps that you need to walk down( anyway... no problem walking downwards, right?). After spending almost an hour there, we need to walk up back to where we came from. A tiring walk especially after playing in the water but it really worth it.Trust me!
worth a visit. We went early on days trip around the area and the waterfall was lovely. It was already quite busy but not overcrowded. Makes a nice stop on a days tour to cool down and enjoy.

Not really remote or quiet but a nice place to go from Ubud. This waterfall is easily accessible from the road (steps to go down and then climb back but no need to walk in the jungle). there were people there but we didn't feel that it was too much. Obviously, don't expect to be alone! It is the first time that I saw people going under the water falling from the waterfall and that it actually seemed safe. The weather was really warm and it was good to go in the water and then we had a coconut juice in a restaurant up the hill with view on the waterfall. We had a great afternoon, going there with a scooter from Ubud (the road is nice).

Be prepared for some climb!. It was a long way down to get to the waterfall, with some very steep steps. Was tiring walking down and then up again. The waterfall was not terribly spectacular as it is not the biggest in Bali.
Simply Stunning. The walk is not as bad as you think its going to be - only 10mins down and 15mins to get back up depending on how fit you are. Don't forget your bikini!

Worth seeing. Waterfall itself is not outstanding, but beautifully located - like in the middle of a jungle. Unfortunately, there were many young, noisy people concentrated too much on making the "picture of the year" to put on their facebook, instagram or whatever. Anyway, if you're passing nearby, I would definitely recommend to stop here for a while.

Interesting but worth a visit. As other people mentioned there is a lot of construction around but the views of the water fall are quite amazing. When we were in the water some locals were pushing a dead dog out of the water and there was a lot of rubbish floating around. The water was very brown but none of this really detered us and we enjoyed cooling off here. Worth a visit if you're in the area or on your way to see other things

Refreshing with abit of a hike to come back. Nice experience, however it had alot of tourist and lots of litter... We walked down to the waterfalls and enjoyed sometime at the bottom, you are also able to climb to the top of the waterfall from the side. The climb back to the main area is pretty steep so be prepared...

Beautiful, relatively close. I went at about 7 or 8am with some friends, and we were the first people there. We went swimming even though it was cold out because it was so early in the morning, and there was a cute sign that said "don't worry be sexy". Perfect for photo ops. I'm sure it gets much more crowded during the day, water was also very cold but swimmable.

Tegenungan waterfall happy hour around bali. Tegenungan waterfall is so famouse and nice place in ubud,make enjoy your vacation in bali to visit in tegenungan waterfall,this location not so farr from ubud center...this location so verry clean,handsome people have restorant for lunch and cold drink

Not nice. There is really too much traffic. Dirt and rubbish whereever you go. This pollution is not nice to see and then these hysteric screaming people all over the place. One of the worst waterfalls we have ever seen. In camparison to Nung Nung waterfalls this is really a bad joke.

Disappointing. Some friends spoke very highly of this waterfall but when I went I was sorely disappointed. Foolishly we went after a day of rain which I suspect was the reason why the water was brown. As a result no one was swimming. Lots of people were basically just stood around gawping at girls posing in bikinis for instagram. Theres a lot of building work going on around the waterfall and a market selling tat at the entrance.
Beautiful watetfall. Lonely watetfall with easy access to walk down as it has steps you won't even get your feet wet. The view is amazing

Refreshing. The place was quite busy in an August afternoon when I visited. Hard to find parking. Longish, steep walk down to the waterfall, but pretty well-structured staircase. Probably better to visit early in the day.

Beautiful - can swim here. Visited for approx 1 hour. Can be very busy between 12-2 when the tour buses arrive. Great views from the top. We walked down it too about 10 minutes. Coming back up took 20minutes ish as its quite steep. The water is a nice temperature and you can swim here.
Breath taking. The climb to and from the waterfall was worth it and it was a hard one. This was nature at it's best. Beautiful!

Largest waterfall in Ubud. The waterfall view is amazing, before reaching the waterfall, you go through small traditional market and ice, before the stairs you can enjoy the view from the waterfall restaurant, amazing view, five story down is the waterfall where you can reward yourself for reaching by a nice swim.

Refreshing in the middle of Bali Hot Weather. We've been told by a tour guide in Hidden Canyon Beji Guwang to go to this place. I really appreciated his advice. We didn't know that we can swim, but once from the enter (entry only Rp10k or USD0.80, for domestic and international tourists) you saw lot of people swimming then we decided to go back to our car to change our clothes to swimming attire. Lot of rest room with only paying Rp2,000 or Rp3,000 (USD0.20) if you want to change your clothes and they were clean.It was about 100+ steps to go down, and for me going down is fine but going up is quite tiresome since the step is not that low step but quite high (around 40cm apart, I believe normal step should be about 20 cm high apart). However it was worth it after showering and getting massage from the waterfall. If you bring the waterproof camera it will be better to take some pictures in the middle of the water falls.There were lots of tourists sunbathing in the area. We just left our stuffs nearby and I thought it was safe, anyway the tourists who just lying next to our stuffs can guard it.We went to middle and top of the falls as well but we had to pay extra Rp10k each, but it was worth it to see the views.If you go to Ubud, go this place.

Awesome place to visit. Beautiful nature. We can swim there on the waterfall which is feels like swimming on a big rain :D we can also go up and swim on the river. But we should pay more to go up which is not good because we pay already for entrance. So we paid twice. But it's all worth it and fun place to be with the sound of nature and took photos with friends.
Beaytyful. Nice landscape in betwin rice teraces view just 10 minute a way from ubud than many local restaurant infront of water fall

A MUST if you're in Ubud!. You have to visit the waterfall while in Ubud. I did on my last day and was so glad I didn't miss it. The entry fee is around 10 R for the first level and another 10 or 20 R for the middle level. I stayed on the first level. The current is very strong in the water so it is almost impossible to stand under the fall (it also hurts haha) but I would recommend doing it for at least 5 second. Also, if you swim on the side of it you will feel absolutely reenergized from the amount of energy it has. Met 2 girls there who felt the same way!
Amazing. One of the best view in bali wonderfull place you must go there we like it so much try to swim there

Nice if you come early enough. The waterfall is beautiful but come earlier in order to avoid crowds. There are 3 levels of the waterfall. We came at 8:30 in hope to be first however there is a hotel next to the waterfall, therefore anyways there were people already. You can swim inside but the bottom is pretty rocky and uncomfortable to walk in to.

Average . It costs 10K rupiah to enter and another 10K rupiah if you want to go up to the second level. We think this a local set up as the entrance makes no mention of second or third tier tickets so ask before you enter!!! The waterfall is average (us being from Canada and all) but it's refreshing to be able to swim underneath it. The walk to the waterfall and back isn't tiring but be weary there are 102 steps to climb on the way back!It's fairly busy in the afternoon and evening time so we'd recommend you visit before 10AM.

average experience. very rocky on the water bed, due to the current being very strong you can easily hurt your feet or legs on the rocks - but you soon get used to how to hold yourself - so not too bad. Water was brown - not blue like you see in the pictures

Must go . We went to this waterfall at 8 in the morning. Seems like we are the only people here. Enjoyed it to the max though the water is so cold.
Walked down for about 10 mins but on the way up really tiring.
But this is a must visit place. Trust me... no regret!

Nice waterfal. It´s a refreshing experience if you are willing to get in some murky water. I did go in. There was a restaurant at the top that sold showers for 50c AUD. So I had a shower. There is a lot of walking and stairs, and if you have shoes to take in the water it would also make things easier!
Waterfll. Sukawati for a bit of shopping, then walking down a million steps to the waterfall... and back up of course, before relaxing over lunch at the waterfall. Beautiful.

A refreshing dip!. A lovely waterfall with the opportunity to swim as well. Be prepared with your towel etc as you will have to pay for one otherwise. No free changing facilities - even the toilets on the walk down have to be paid for. Not suitable for young children or for those with walking disabilities as it is a steep walk with many steps down.

Beautful, but a bit crowded.... It's very easy to get to the waterfalls, by car or by scooter.Before going down there, there are many tourist shops and restaurants where you you can get decent food, and great views of the waterfall itself!A whole bunch of stairs later, a beautiful and crowded waterfall.Nevertheless, it didn't stop us from enjoying our time there. Water was clean and so fresh, and it really makes you feel you're in an exotic place.Just don't go there in wet season! I heard stories about people drowning by being surprised by flash floods due to strong rain showers.(Tip for the shops: Bargain by first systematically dividing the prices by at least 2)

Worth the visit . Visited here after a trip to Sukawati markets which is only 5 minutes away.Small entry fee to get in and now being developed with numerous warungs across the ridge .Tegenungan was pretty busy on the day we visited with many tourists aĺl around. I hadnt realised that gettibg to thd waterfall itself can be a little challenging with many steep stairs to negotiate and not alot of railings to hang onto so one needs to take care .The waterfall itself is quite large but worth the walk out into the water to refresh.The force from the falls is quite string and the tide will move you along.A rrip across to the other side will give you access to the top and there are drinks for sale here too.The bigger challenge for me was negotiating the stairs to the top , best to take out at your own pace and i wouldnt recommend the journey for those with bad ankles or knees...my thighs were sore for days after .
Best in Bali . Been to five waterfalls in Bali and this one was the best for....Easy access, water temperature, safety. Fee is 10k rupiah. Will revisit.
Nice waterfall. Attractive waterfall. Minimal entrance fees, even in dry, runs very well, and looks impressive, must be great inWeymouth season
Nature can be so beautiful. And this is one of the beautiful places in Ubud. Fresh water, just a 'must to have been there'. Great!
Really serene view. It's a must visit. The view is breathtaking and very calming. I live in Dubai the desert so I was drunk simply on the green.

Refreshing. A little bit crowded (expected) but still really nice to swim under the waterfall.
Definitely pay the 20,000 rupiah and walk to the top of the waterfall.
Less crowded and really relaxing.

Beautiful. We have never had the chance to swim under a waterfall and we really enjoyed this experience. There are a lot of stairs to get to and from the waterfall. There are a lot of rocks at the bottom and in the water. Wear shoes that you can where in the water. We really enjoyed this experience
nice water fal. you can go and get a soak under the water fall, not a huge water fall but big enough, you can buy local handicrafts every where very reasonable price.

Beautiful but crowded. Very beautiful waterfall. You can go into the small lake and take a shower. But very very crowded... Busloads of tourists. This doensn't make the place less beautiful but it does make being there less attractive.

It's good to see but nothing spectacular. Nice to see the waterfall (many steps down and up if you want to see it close) but not too spectacular. You'll pay 10.000 idr at entrance but not sure if this is for parking, the waterfall or none of both.

You won't know until you try. One of the most amazing feelings ever, swimming in the waterfall is a wonderful and unique sensation, i recommend it to everyone, its a bit hard to get there but definitely worth it.

It's fine. But not the greatest.... This was the first waterfall we visited while in Bali, and had we visited Ubud last, we wouldn't have come here.The place is super crowded with people, and the waterfall is just not that impressive. The place was completely overtaken by sellers at the entrance and there is even a service of renting beds to lay in the sun or a shed to change clothes. Also, if you want to go to the mid and top levels of the waterfall you have to pay extra on the way up the water (not much extra, just 10.000IDR a person). That was the best decision we made. The top is pretty and it's rather empty as most people rather stay on the bottom, soaking up on water...Especially considering the waterfalls we visited after, it was quite underwhelming. Pretty nonetheless, and if you are not able to travel more upnorth, it is a good waterfall to experience.

Worth a look if you're in the area. Nice smallish waterfall, if you have swimming in a lake with a waterfall on your bucket list, this could be a good place to start!The walk down to the waterfall is fine. Coming up gets the heart pumping a little!
Wonderful waterfalls. Something you must see if you are in the region is these waterfalls and their surroundings. It is wonderful.

Waterfall. Beautiful, get there early before its overcrowded. Don't forget your swimmers! Not a long way down even though it looks it, hard coming up in the heat so the earlier he better. You can get a drink at the top.

Beautiful but busy. Was really great to see this place, was very beautiful but was very busy with tourists when we went. There is a small charge before you walk down to the river and another charge to walk to the top of the waterfall. Its nice to go in the water and under the waterfall. Great photo spot

A Beautiful Gem in the heart of Ubud. Its close from any where, and you must steps into a dozens of stairs to go down, but not very far like the other waterfall in Bali, the stairs and parking space are pretty well prepared, and the view of the waterfall are beautiful, sometimes it just very crowded on weekends...

Stunning view but dont go to water. This waterfall kind of destroy my romantic and foolish idea of crystalic clear water falling down. Be prepared on lot of very tall stairs which is not so easy to climb. Sign in front of waterfall - dont be afraid to be sexy but not naked - is pretty funny. But brown dirty water is not very attractive for swimming or playing under waterfall. It makes you more thinking about vacination :) But to be honest, view was stunning

Very crowded touristic spot. I went to this place two times. My first experience was with during my tour with agent. We arrived there around 2 pm and is was full of people!!! I made 0 photos and didnt get the point of the popularity of this waterfall... : many steps to get to it, humid, crowds, nothing to do..After a week I decided to give this place the second chance and went there at 7AM... and WOW this is really proper time to enjoy it! Beautiful waterfall where you can swim, take amazing photos, climb and enjoy the view on the sun chair in front of it with coconut!!FYI : entrance fee 10.000 ird (1 $), great to combine it with visiting another waterfall Kanto Lampo (20 minutes ride)

Waterfall . Its a nice waterfall . Have bikini with you . You can take nice photos inside the water under waterfall .me and friend stayed there for 1 hour and took some photos. But be ready for going up, many stairs to pass ...

Nice view and refreshing bath.. The "don't worry, be sexy" sign in front of the waterfall attracts many people and some junk is laying around waiting to be picked up. The waterfall itself is nice but not that spectacular.The entrance fee is 10k/pax but they want to have another 10k/pax to let you up to the waterfall source.It's worth a visit and swim around a little, but expect lots of people with their awesome selfie sticks.
Beautiful. Just be prepared to pay for everything including toilet use and lots of people. It's a nice experience regardless.

One of the best Waterfall in Bali.. There are many destination tourism in Bali,one of them!! in this place [Tegenungen Waterfall ].From Ubud only 15 minute take time and from Denpasar city need time 40 minutes.In this place we can see beautifull scenery and also we can to take swim,By descending some stairs we will arive at waterfall best sot area.

Great place to cool off!. If you don't mind walking down the many steps, this is a great place to have a swim by the waterfall. Otherwise a great photo opportunity. There is a small charge and a market has set up just before the steps. A good place to get an ice cream!

Very beautiful, but steep stairs to get down there!. We visited here with our driver, it was very beautiful to view from the top, there was a few warungs to eat at and souvenir shops. There was also toilets there (with a cost). The steps down to the water fall were very steep, and no hand rail. We had a young baby which we were carrying in our arms so I didnt end up going down, but my husband did...It cost 10000 to cross the river and go to the top of the waterfall. He said it was lovely down the bottom of the falls - people were swimming or sunbaking.

Bring the swimming wear. Beautiful waterfall with a stunning view on top of it. Very refreshing to swim at the base of it. Don't worry be sexy, but not naked is the motto of the board at the feet of the waterfall.
Worth seeking out!. Off the beaten track a little, but well worth the visit. Good trek down the mountain to get to, but worth it for the views

Beautiful and worth a visit. . Beautiful waterfalls with a pebble beach area at the bottom where you can swim and enjoy the views. There's complete jungle in one direction with the waterfalls in the other. Very busy with tourists and a long walk down steps to enjoy the close proximity but absolutely worth it. As a UK citizen, I was blown away with the hard work elderly ladies (60+) were doing in heat of around 38 degrees. Carrying sand and stone on their heads up and down the steep steps to build better walking areas for the public. Although it was heart wrenching, it's a part of the Bali culture and you will often see women grafting harder than the men. We need to thank our lucky stars we live in a much more privileged country.

Amazing View. I hired a taxi for two hours and asked it to wait while exploring the falls. They are stunning, there are many steps to get down but the view is beautiful the whole way and you must go for a swim at the bottom! We went in the morning before it got busy, and on a day when there had been no rain for a few days which meant the water was clear. A must visit, and not far from Ubud. Two Hours return was plenty of time for us to see the falls, enjoy a coconut and have a little look at the markets there.

Wow beautiful . Hired a driver for the day and first stop was the waterfall and this was a good place to start as it wasn't too busy and only a few people were there. Really beautiful but I imagine it gets pretty crowded so aim to arrive early!! On the way back up I sat on the steps for a rest and about 20 monkeys came out of the bushes - amazing!!

dissapointed. was very beautiful , but i was disapointed . I expected places (grass etc) to sit , but there is only rocks , the fall was very strong and you were either basically underneath it or on the rocks - no lake area to relax and swim . The stairs are very steep with nothing to hold on to for most of the way . I am terrified of heights so found this very challenging !

Good falls. Worth a visit, these falls are quite nice to see. I did not walk to the bottom, but the view from the top is quite good. There are several small shops selling foods, souvenirs etc. at reasonable prices.

Road trip to Ubud. The waterfall is a must see but make sure you watch your step as the path down is a bit tricky. A good view from the top ! A lot of tourists whilst we were there but no one in the water. Great photo opportunity and you can get a beer and a feed from the local warung and trinkets from the novelty shops.

Not really clean, still fun day though. Went to this waterfall on Sunday around 3pm when the weather was great and sunny. Took around 30 mins from Ubud center we were entering the waterfall through the other entrance with IDR 10k entrance fee for adult with a very friendly man informed us how to get down and small explanation about the waterfall. Got to stepped all the way down through the stairs was not really far. Down the falls was crowded, and not really clean, need to put more rubbish bin around. The waterfall itself was beautiful surrounded by green forest the view was stunning. Overall was such a great experience.

Well worth the trip - especially on a hot day. Pretty impressive falls, right up there with Gitgit Falls in northern Bali. The falls get pretty busy with locals and tourists alike so don't expect to get the place to yourself. Well worth a look - make sure you bring your swimmers :)
nice view of fall. Good view and if you love to track then go down at waterfall base too. lovely view and good picture location

Hidden Waterfall. This waterfall is easily reached from goa gajah in ubud. just around 30 minutes ride. there are 2 places to see this waterfall, from above and from below. the stairs are nicely designed to make you reach the waterfall easily. the entrance fee is around 20k for local adult. to reach this place just follow google maps and when you near the place, the sign leading to the waterfall will be in sight
Dangerous current. I almost drowned.. Be careful on the left side there is a deep dropoff and a strong undertow. I was pulled under and almost drowned.
Beautiful, best to go early in the morning. We went in the morning around 9am, took our scooter, and were virtually there by ourselves. When it gets to about lunch time so many people are there

Very Touristy... but beautiful.. We did some cliff jumping here - be aware, don't jump without experience or knowing if it's deep enough. We all hit the bottom multiple times when we jumped and if you jump in the wrong place, you'll be in trouble. It was a little too touristy for us - tons of tourists & people trying to sell you their cloths. ( We were there before busy season). Water was pretty dirty. After swimming & jumping my boyfriend got pretty sick and threw up that evening. He does not have a weak stomach, so we were very surprised.

Worth a visit! . So beautiful to actually see in real life! Costs 10,000 in total to go to the bottom of the waterfall! If you wish to go to the middle or top you have to pay extra charges on top. I would take swimwear so you can take a dip in the water! Before you head down to the waterfall there are a few shops you can visit, toilets, ice cream shops, souvenir places! Lots of steps down to the waterfall so take some good footwear.

My first waterfall. All the articles about this waterfall was describing how virgin it is and that its unknown and only few people go there, unlike all articles it was crowded and with 10k ticket, it was very nice actually but i thought it would be just me and my wife and also no cliff jumping cause of shallow water but swimming only was great and its a must visit.
so Nature. nice view so relaxing..... don't forget your swimming suite, sunblock, and waterproof camera. You'll see beautiful nature
It was amazing and I recommend to all who loves adventures . Amazing and wonderful.trust me u will love it.it might be slightly hard to climb but it will be a great experience
Meh. The waterfall is not that special. The water is brown and the area is not that clean. I wonder what they do with the 20k entrance fee, because it was pretty crowded as well

Tegenungan waterfall. . Tegenungan is one of the many tourist places and destination in Bali, it is popular with waterfall. Tegenungan waterfall lies at Tegenungan Village, approx. 5 kilometers, south east Ubud. Bali has a selection of waterfalls that are fun to visit. For many people the idea of hiking through the jungle to a hidden waterfall and taking a cooling swim is the image of paradise. These places definitely exist and here are some useful tips of how to find them and what to expect.

A great afternoon out from Ubud. We rented a scooter and drove the 30 minutes from Ubud, which was quite straight forward. There seems to be two ways to access the waterfall and we took the less touristy route (not on purpose, it was the entrance we had chosen from Google maps). It was 10,000 IDR (about 60p) to enter and there are quite a few steps to go up and down but it was great. The route we went takes you to three stages: top of the waterfall, middle and bottom. The top was incredible, peering over the top and understanding just how high the drop was. As it had been raining loads the water was really strong and was gushing over the edge. The water was also very brown as apparently it washes all the dirt etc down from the mountains after heavy rain. We then made our way down to the middle to get a different perspective, and you could feel the spray coming off the waterfall. Usually you can swim at the bottom but because the water was dirty following the rain we were unable to swim. It was still a really enjoyable visit.
Nice waterfall, very crowded. Its a pretty waterfall, but its also very crowded. So you have to wait to swim and wait to take a nice photo.
Overrated tourist trap. This place is just a waterfall and not a particularly big one. It is full of tourists, dont make a special journey.

Beautiful seanery in the middle of the Ubud jungle. Visited this place during our honeymoon in Ubud. The waterfall is amazing and you can take beautiful pictures from above. You can also walk down to 5he waterfall and have a swim if you like! Kiosks are also available there for refreshments. Cost is only 10k IDR which is less than 1 euro
Nice waterfall. Very nice waterfall but too many people at there. A lot staircase .. Be prepared and you can have a nice dip there. Bring extra clothes!

Beautiful and scenic. We made a stop at the waterfall as part of an excursion in Ubud, we did not have time to climb the steps down to the waterfall as we were moving on. But even from the top the views were stunning! You have to pay Rp. 10,000. But well worth it. There are also many stalls to buy goods and cool drinks from. Definitely recommended.
Wow!. Excellent waterfall - worth a visit if you are ok with little adventure (you have to get down several steps to reach).

Nice, but beware the stairs. Lovely and scenic. The water is deliciously cool. Entry is 10,000Rp and you can park at the top. The waterfall is lovely, but if you are hoping to sunbake or picnic on grass, you will be disappointed. The waterfall area is comprised of black volcanic river stones-so bring good footwear. The water is murky looking because of the sheer force of the water (which exerts a strong pull). There is a enclave you can swim to and enjoy the waterfall from almost behind the curtain of water. Home-made bamboo loungers are available for hire and there is a makeshift bar. The are also beautifully clean toilets (3,000Rp) available at the bottom of the stairs and a nice seating area to purchase and enjoy drinks. Some little shops at top of steps offer free toilet use with a purchase. Be warned, however, the 180 or so steps down are a little treacherous as the steps are uneven and quite high in places (not for people with bad knees) and, in most places, without rails.

Friends . Nice place for waterfall lovers. If you want to swim it is also possible. But ii is only for tourists. Entrance was today 10000 IDR. There are two further options to go up but only to take pictures. For each further step you have to pay again 10000 IDR.

Worth a visit. It was a rainy day when we got there, and as you enter the area, there are stalls for food, souvenirs and other convenience items.To view the waterfalls, you can stay at the upper deck and enjoy it from afar. Or you can go down several hillside stairs and see it up close. Swimming is allowed. Bring light clothes or swimwear (if you want to swim) and flipflops. I wouldn't recommend going down for those who have difficulty climbing stairs or are handicapped.
Nice warerfall. We had very good time in Tegenungan Waterfall. Not so crowded for the peak season and super refreshing !

Spectacular waterfall.. Very pleased we came here, I loved getting up close to the waterfall. Very beautiful. Just be aware that it is a long way down to reach the waterfall and it can get ready hot and sweaty on your way back up. So be sure to bring water and stay hydrated.ps. there's an entrance fee

Beautiful . A must see. We made the trek from Legian and glad we did. The 145 were hard work. But I looked at it that I got my 30 mins exercise for the day .The waterfall is beautiful. You can swim. There is a couple of shops at the top for a cold drink or ice cream
Beautiful place . Nice place to visit, the water and scenery is beautiful . Lots of stairs and tourists, I would suggest going as early as possible.

Must EXPERIENCE. This place is great for photos and to experience the beauty in this waterfall by swimming or climbing on top of it. Definitely need some energy to climb the many stairs down and back up after the enjoyment. But worth it!

Refreshing after a hot excursion . This was a part of the day excursion trip and was the last on the list . Had to pay a ticket of $1 at the entrance . Quite a number of tourists were seen dipping in and getting tanned at the site . There are a number of restaurants where you can buy stuff to eat or drink . You have to go down a safe slope to the waterfall and then climb up the same way on return .
Amazing site. I came here as part of my day tour in Ubud and Kintamani, right after the Monkey Forest. The site of the waterfall was just amazing :-) This is something you wouldn't want to miss.

Very touristic but nice waterfall. Visited this waterfall in the afternoon, crowded with tourists. Less than 30 min ride on a scooter from Ubud and although touristic nice to see. You have to pay 10.000 each as a entrance but that's how they make their living. It's a fair climb down to swim in the waterfall (bit dirty water but still cool if it's your first waterfall), then there is a photo platform in the middle of the waterfall, and finally you can climb to the top for a great view. As it's a tourist hotspot, expect a lot of locals selling goods, foods, and other stuff. If you're traveling on a scooter and wants to visit some nice spot around Bali, I would recommend to see this place in 1 hour.
Give this place a go. A little bit crowded but worth a visit if only for the chance to swim under a waterfall. One for the Bucket List

good place for hiking and relaxation. it was a nice visit, but it only got better when we went to the top of the waterfall...it was so quiet and nice up there. Many people where just sitting there, meditating, while others where reading a book.
Awesome. We had a nice moment there, the place is beautiful and we've been able to swim. We went there at 7 pm so it was not crowded but I don't know what it's like during the day.

Awesome!. This waterfall only takes 90 minutes from Denpasar,unlike many other waterfall which located pretty far at North of Bali. It only takes 30 minutes if you stay near Ubud. Located exactly at Kemenuh Village. Cost only IDR 10.000. In my own opinion this place is recommended. You can swim, and jump from the top (only after they're sure the depth is enough for you to jump). You need to walk down the stairs (but when you get back up is quite tiring actually) before you can enjoy the waterfall. The place is clean, and the water is clear.
Scenic. A beautiful waterfall with really cooling fresh water. It is clean and well preserved natural location. Didnt get the reason why you have to pay just go get on top.
Amazing. We were informed by the hotel staff to visit this place and yes, fortunately we made it. The waterfall is beautiful and the view was superb. Great place to be visited in Bali

Nice waterfall....but.. This popular waterfall is like so many of the attractions, over commercialised with stalls and vendors abound. The walk down to the waterfall takes about 10 minutes and it's well worth taking advantage from the view points dotted with stalls at the commencement of the walk down which is reasonably steep with lots of steps!

A nice way to start the day. There are two different points of entry to the falls the tickets we had wee 10000idr each and that gave us access to all 3 points of the falls. But the climb down to the bottom and back is a long walk.We got there at 9 a.m. and it was still quiet just a few in the water pool by 11 a.m. it was packedThe water is not the cleanest i have seen but its ok just dont swallow any .The second level is really only a photo opportunity and the top is where the water runs down to the start of the waterfall. Our ticket gave us access to all 3 points but the only part you can really coold down is the bottom Parking was free not many hawkers and about 25 mins from ubud by scooter
pretty but heavily touristy!!. This place was full of tourists!! wasn't as exciting when it just seemed like a tourist trap. Not my favourite part of Bali for sure!

Come early in the morning.. I don't want to be mean to the locals whose livelihood probably depend on this waterfall, but Tegenungan is really touristy. There're stalls here selling light food and snacks (reasonably-priced) and knick-knacks for those who want their fix of trinkets and souvenirs. For those seeking 'secret' waterfalls, this is definitely not the place. I came in the afternoon and it was swelling with visitors, both local and international tourists alike. There's significant climbing down of steps down to the waterfall and no railings. Nonetheless it's still a good place for a cool dip in the warm afternoon if you don't mind the crowds. An admission charge of Rp 10,000 applies.

Skip. Low water level, random ticket-racketeers. . The water level was too low to jump, which was about half of the attraction for us. As seems to be the norm as you go north, there were random racketeers trying to charge entry fees to different parts of the falls. One at the village, and one to climb on top of the falls. They are cheap, but these kinds of scams are a pet peeve of mine. Otherwise it was OK, but quite crowded. Not worth a trip.

A good waterfall to go to. Lot of walking, but when you get there, you will say that it is worth the effort. A very good waterfall - one can go close to it. Rain forced us to come back but it was an experience to cherish...

Something different in Bali. This waterfall is compared with other famous waterfalls not very special besides that it is in Bali.Have a look to it, it's something different in Bali.Get prepared to climb down and up a lot of stairs. If you are not so fit enjoy the waterfall from the top, the stairs are quite high and not so easy to climb.We did not go swimming knowing how the river looks like before and after the waterfall but it's up to everybody.Photos show the waterfall from the top and bottom.
Beautiful however very busy!. Very nice waterfall to see however extremely busy and water is quite rough so difficult to swim in. Long trek down to waterfall, nice views from the top.
Fun but touristy. We had a lot of fun in the waterfall but I suggest you wear watershoes as its quite rocky. This place is packed with tourists.

Beautiful :). Beautiful waterfall :) be mindful when you go, been twice and once it was a clear and sunny day so perfect to swim in but the second time was cloudy and after some rain so the water was brown.

Great waterfall but a bit of climb. Great waterfall but we warned it is a bit of a climb down to it (& back up). Which can be quite tough on a hot and humid day. Can swim in the pool by the waterfall.

Fun. On arrival you pay for your entrance to the waterfalls which was very crowded with no where to sit as its all on rocks. After we had a little swim we was going to go to the top for a picture but was told we had to pay again as the top wasn't part of the entrance fee. Fun for an hour or so

It has great ootential. Many many many steep long steps down to the fall which of course means many many many steep long steps back up to where you can park your vehicle. Many tourist were diving off the water fall into the cold waters below. You need to be daring and some what a risk taker to be doing this. It has great scenic potential but still needs many works on the facilities surrounding and going to the falls to make it serene and less rouged for the average traveler.

Overcrowded . Extremely long way down to the waterfall. No safety rails, people walking up and down the steps in every direction. Extremely overcrowded. Some people were swimming in the pool- water was not the cleanest. If you're in the area it's worth a look. I personally would not go out of my way to come see the waterfall.
Beautiful waterfall . Beautiful waterfall, bit of a walk to get down to it. You have to pay entry fee to gain access, there is restaurant and a few shops, but nothing amazing here.

Amazing waterfall. Tegenungan Waterfall is located in Ubud. To access to the waterfall, there are approximately 100 steps. The waterfall is crowded but worth a visit. You can feel the beauty of the nature when you are swimming or chilling beside it. You can also climb higher for a closer view. but be careful and always hold the bamboo handrail beside you, as the rocky floor can be slippery. Also. do take a break when you walking up the steps as i can be very tiring.
Beautiful, but touristic. Lots and lots of tourists! But the waterfall itself is pretty. Also, a long walk down to reach the waterfall.
Waterfalls. Was lovely to see, lots of steps down to the waterfalls, very steep with very few safety rails. A popular tourist attraction and plenty of area to swim.

Nice Waterfalls, very crowded.. The waterfalls were very nice and the water was refreshing. It was also possible to climb up to the second level to sit near the falls. The only downside was that it is a very touristy spot so there were many many people there. It was quite crowded. it would be a good idea to go in the morning or evening, when everything is a bit quieter.

You need your swimming costume..... Its is a quite a walk down to get to the waterfall, which is so very beautiful. You can swim there, so take your swim suite with you. Its hot and sweaty to get down there, so you will really appreciate the swim. Great picture opportunities to. Save some of your energy for the walk back though. The stairs can also be slippery and one needs to be careful. There are all sorts of vendors selling drinks and ice cream which are appreciated after the walk.

Waterfalls 2016. Nice but not what I expected you have to pay to entre (adults) also have to pay to use toilets and then there is sooooo many steps to go down to the waterfall not ideal for young kids and if you want to get a better view you have to pay again

Great!. This was such a fun day!! We went to the waterfall and spent a few hours enjiying the view and taking a swim! It's 10000 to get in which is a minor price to pay for the view! Be careful when swimming close to the waterfall the current is pretty strong... if u have kids just make sure that you hang on tight to them. Defiently a memorable experience!

Okay but very Crowded . We had a stopover at the Tegenungang waterfall. It's a nice place to visit. You have to descend a pretty heavy stairs to go to the waterside. The power of the falling water is exciting but it's way to crowded and pretty littered. The surrounded hills and river aren't that interesting.

Not the most spectacular waterfall by any stretch but worth stopping by if you're in Ubud. I was there on the overcast day where it was raining couple days in a row prior. As such, the water is brownish colour as it's washed down a lot of muds from upstream. Days like this is good for observing and too dangerous to swim.Make sure you have your phones and/or camera in waterproof contraption of some sort because the air is full of water mist from the waterfall. It's slightly harder to go back up for the more unfit type (me included) where you may need to stop once or twice.Tip: There's a nice little area where you can wash off that looks rather nice actually.

Popular. Arriving at this attraction there were plenty of stalls providing facilities for tourists. There is a fairly large walk down to the bottom of the waterfall. Most of which are concrete steps and then the very last section can be slightly muddy making it necessary to take extra care.The area around the base of he waterfall is large pebbles. A dip in the water is a must so don't forget your swimmers. I saw a few coconuts in the water which may have been washed there from upstream so be very careful going directly into the waterfall. If you so desire you can walk up the water fall and look back down. This is mainly mud track so again care is required. All toilet facilities that I saw required payment. I didn't see anyone using the toilet but plenty of people in the water.

Beautiful nature. Tegenungan waterfall is about 30 minutes or less (depending on traffic) from Ubud. It's nothing fancy, but Ii think it is worth the trip. It costs 10000 rupiah which is nothing, to get access to. Be sure to go early morning so you arrive there between 8 and 9 to have the place to your self. It is so beautiful without all the other tourist.

Nice views. It costs a small fee to get in (If I remember right if was 10k/person so about ,80 cents).The walk there don't take too much time and the waterfall is beautiful. You can also swim there if you like. Walk back is much harder when you need to climb the stairs back. Maybe not the best place for elders.

Nice Waterfall. This waterfall is not to far from Ubud centre (about 20 minutes with car). Very nice. You can go all the way down to the waterfall itself hand have a swim. Also de road to the waterfall has a nice view of ricefields.

lovely waterfall, very busy. loved this place, but if I had the choice, I'd go earlier when it was less busy. It's hard going climbing the steps back up in the heat- around 170 steps- not for the faint hearted, but I'm glad we did it. Climbed up the other side of the fall for some nice photos too, definitely recommend.
Beautiful. The walk to the bottom of the waterfall is short and the view when you get there is just beautiful. I would recommend this to others
Nice waterfall - if on the way to somewhere worth a look. Its a waterfall. The steps on the way down are a little steep. Nothing exceptional though compared to other waterfalls

Amazing place but there killing it. The waterfall is really nice and amazing. There are a lot of steps down. They charge you a small entrance fee to see it. The part I really hated was al the little shops that are there and that there still building with the same souvenirs and the people that keep asking if you want ice cream, drinks, sarongs ed. there killing all the lovely places with tourism. Shame on them

Fantastic spot for a dip. This waterfall was fantastic for a quick cool off. Shame about having to walk up the hill again at the end but I guess that's the price you pay to enjoy nature. You can easily swim under the waterfall but there is quite a current so swimming through the waterfall should only be for competent swimmers. It was relatively busy when we were there but didn't seem too overcrowded. Was a great experience and thoroughly enjoyed by everyone in our group.

Long way down. The waterfall is wonderful but its a loooooong way down to it. If you are in a party then some may wish make the climb and others can stay at the top and shop or eat as there are a few options for that.

Nice waterfall. We went to Tegenungan as part of our all day tour of Ubud and south Bali. The waterfall is nice and photogenic, but don't expect too much. We did not bring our swim suits, but some got in the water and got a fantastic picture with the falls. This is not necessarily a must see in Bali.

Very nice waterfall. Nice waterfall with a slight walk down. Few stairs so some may need to take their time. Good if you want to fill in an hour of your holiday! Can swim and buy a bintang at the bottom.

Not as good as expected . Long way down very steep stairs and filled with tourists. The water although apparently clean I think was a lot mucky than people think. You can walk up to the top of the waterfall which is much nicer with less people. There is a bit there that looks like an entry point for domestic waste to enter the stream which eventually makes the waterfall. There is nowhere to store your things either which means there are equal number of people in the water and out guarding bags and belongings making it just crowded everywhere. Should have just stayed at the hotel pool!

ONE OF BALI'S MOST BEAUTIFUL WATERFALLS WHICH IS THE EASIEST TO VISIT. Tegenungan waterfall is located so close to Bali's tourist centers as Ubud, Kuta or Nusa Dua; surrounded by lush vegetation with fairly constant water volume during the year around. So this is the closest and easiest waterfall to visit for most visitors. It is also one of the most beautiful waterfalls. But the water turns dark in rainy season.
