Some meters from the bottom of stairs there are holy water sources with clean water all year around. Local people come here for drinking water and for taking a bath.
a beautiful waterfall and a nice place to. The waterfall is a 10-minute walk from the car park area. It's beautiful and a nice place to swim and cool off. The entrance ticket is 10000 Rupiahs.

Good. While coming from Kintamani, we visited this place. I didn't find this charming but quite ok to visit. people take bath in the waterfall and some do sporting activity like roping down from the top of the fall.

What a waterfall!. We had visited this waterfall on a rainy day however I think it added to the wonderfulness of it. After a fair few steps down (not recommended for those who have mobility issues) the beauty of this natural wonder is apparent. There are plenty of people swimming within the water and socialising. Worth the trip!
Beautiful waterfall!. I'm from Bangladesh where we have millions of waterfalls and trust me when I say the long climb down is worth it.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful waterfall not heavily visited by tourists. Cool fresh water and an opportunity to swim. Lots of steps down and a great workout on the way back up. Saw wild monkeys here, but tourists are protected to some degree by 2 cheeky 'life guards' on duty at the bottom. A pretty, hidden gem :)

An Excillerating Experience for one and all!. If your prepared to put in a little Effort, then you will be rewarded Ten Fold..This is one of those Bali Experiences, that you will remember for a very long time...We arrived at the the site late in the afternoon, with a certain degree of expectation, the decent down into the path leading to the waterfall was a beautiful journey in itself..The. To arrive at the majestic falls, was truely a sight I will never forget...The mist spraying, and carrying across the pool to the shore, providing a welcomed relief from the days heat, was a real great..This is a trek for those wanting to Emerse them selfs into a place where time almost stands still...And this is based in the Hypnotic ruthenium of the falls themselves... You can just literally stand, and be enveloped with this incredible Gift from Mother Nature....This is a trip that will be a talking point for years to come... 10 out of 10...
Unbelieveable!. We absolutely loved this waterfall - it is so beautiful! We climbed the cliff to the side of the top of the waterfall and had some of the most incredible views!

Nice waterfall but lots of tourists and a bit busy. Still worth a visit if close by. Waterfall itself is lovely but quite crowded and not worth going massively out of your way for. If you're on a tour then it's close to other places and worth going along but it's nothing special in all honesty.

Very very crouded. It is quite far from Ubud, and a little hard to reach but not impossible, once you reach have in mind you will have to walk down the stairs for around 10 minutes down, it is very nice but too much people and a lot LOT of garbage.To beat the crowd you can try to go before 10 am, no entrance fee needed although to enter the town where it is you will need to pay 4500 rupiah, nit easy to take nice pictures because of the amount of people, we were lucky because the day we went they were doing a shooting of a tv program so they were keeping people away which made it easy to take pictures of the fall with no one. The way back is a little hard, as there are a lot of stairs but not impossible to do, just take your time. Do not go in a rainy day

worth the visit. entrance fee is Rp.10,000 / person. dont worry if you need additional clothes, they have stalls selling items at reasonable prices. the stairways to the waterfall is to my 'acceptable' distance compared to other waterfalls in bali :)

Go first thing in the morning to avoid crowds!!. I had a great experience at the waterfall. My girlfriend and I hired a driver for the day around Ubud and we said we wanted to do various temples and the waterfall, he suggested going to the waterfall first which wasn't my plan but we went with it and I'm glad we did.We were there around 8.30am and had the whole thing basically to ourselves. It's bloody cold but it's cool to say you've swam under a waterfall and I got some great GoPro shots.The water is quite dirty as it flows from a river so don't drink and try to avoid it going into your eyes (which is hard to do).Bring a change of clothes and change afterwards.As we were leaving (roughly around 9.15am) it was starting to fill up with A LOT of tourists! This isn't the type of place I'd want to arrive to when its busy so take my advice and go extremely early or don't bother.There's a small fee to pay on arrival 10,000 IDR as far as I remember and there's a few steps to the waterfall. I would say less than 100.
Too Busy. Its beautiful but by the time I got there its too busy, lots of people there.Maybe if u want to go here try early morning.

Attractive Waterfall. Air Tejun Tegenungan is a popular natural phenomenon not far from Ubud, Bali. It is a short drive, maybe 20-30 minutes from the centre of Ubud depending on traffic. There is a fairly large parking area but at peak time this is a busy location. It costs just IDR10k for adults to enter, 5k for children. There are allegedly 200 steps down to the waterfall's base so this is not an accessible attraction. Those who might find clambering up and down in the Indonesian heat a challenge might need to factor in more time.The entrance includes several stalls and eateries in common with many tourist attractions in the country. The steps down are quite large so children can find they need a little help. At the bottom it becomes somewhat muddy so a bit of care is needed.The waterfall itself is not very high but is really quite broad. It thunders down quite impressively. The splash reaches the rocks at the edge of the pool below which can be quite a refreshing experience. Swimming in the pool seems to be popular. Some continue their walk to the ledge near the top of the waterfall. There are no safety precautions so it is up to the individual to manage their own risk. The river that flows away from the waterfall is really quite an attractive feature. Worth spending a moment enjoying natural beauty and the distinction between the calm of the river and the fury of the waterfall.

Nice first time swim in a waterfall. We had a good time swimming in the water fall. Very nice view from the top before descending almost 100 steps to the bottom to get in the water. Careful with little kids around the current as it might push them around.

Worth a trip and a dip . Can get crowded, either go early morning or late afternoon. Make sure you walk right to the top of the waterfall and have a look down. Only. Disappointing thing was all the rubbish at the top.

Average waterfall and alot of tourist. Like the title says. The waterfall is nice but not very beautifull or something. This isn't a spot you should definetly visit. When you have a few hours left and you're in the neighbourhood you can pay it a visit. Try to go in the morning, be there between 8 and 9 it's alot more quite.

Potentially GOOD!. Great view, but need proper public facilities like toilet "a proper one" access along the river but somehow all look natural!! don't get me wrong but again really not convinience and even dangerous with the kids. SO enjoy and take care with your children.

Beautiful, but super busy. . Stopped off at the waterfall at the end of a hot day in Ubud. It really was beautiful. Unfortunately it was very busy. We didn't end up swimming because there were too many people. But it was definitely worth seeing.

Great ending of the day. We had the waterfall visit at the end of our private tour which turned up to be a great choice because we were not in a hurry. The water was ok, not dirty as others said. You can even go right under the waterfall od swim around. It was perfect! The entrance fee was also very cheap.

Pleasant waterfall. Pleasant enough. Long,steep walk down lots of people when you get there, mainly young and having a dip in the pool in front of the fall itself. Good views from the restaurant if you don't want to go down and plenty of places for refreshment at the top.

A good spot for something different to do - get there independently - no need to take a tour. If you fancy doing something other than going to the beach but without taking up a whole day or spending a fortune, Tegenugan Falls are a good option. You can go right down to the falls and stand underneath - it is surprisingly cool on a hot Balinese day!Some people rent a bike and cycle there (possibly not much fun given how close cars and motorbikes go to cyclists, which is nervewracking). We bargained with a taxi from Ubud and got him down to 90k rupiah (about AUD$9) one way and then we agreed to a fare of 200k rupiah (about AUD$20) for a return journey with him waiting up to a couple of hours. This worked out at $10 a head and 2 hours was enough.It was quite crowded but not impossibly so, was different to be able to get right under the waterfall and all up was a fun morning.

It's fine!. A pleasant stop during your day trip in this part of Bali. Depending on the moment of your arrival and your definition of having fun, you could go for a swim or just enjoy the scenery, take a few photos and leave.

Worth a visit. Rented a bike and got there on our own via GPS. Once you're in the area, if locals identify you as tourists they'd automatically point you the way to the waterfall as i guess that's the only tourist attraction in the area. Parking and drinks available. Entrance of 10.000RP per person. For us, one of the guides, Johnny followed us (for free but we still gave tips anyway) and guide us through but i think it's pretty easy to navigate down to the waterfall as there are signs. Though some part of the path may be a bit hard to walk through but overall still quite easy and fast to get down to the waterfall. Waterfall was filled with tourists but really beautiful so worth a visit if you're nearby.

Overrated . Nice to see but felt it was rather over rated and just a way to get the tourists in. It's a long way down and yes it's a waterfall but not so impressive. It was very busy and the younger crowd seem to be enjoying it more and we're getting into the water. When we went a bride was having her photos taken there. Several places at the top to stop for a drink and also buy some local handicraft too.

Paradise amazing perfect!. I do not know if there is another better waterfall but what I know is that this waterfall is a must see. Perfect location warm water just 10.000rp entrance and an amazing few . About 70 steps down and later upstairs .but if you can these steps are no problem for that what you will get
Relaxing breanjoy the view. While travelling from Ubud back to Kuta we stopped at the falls. There must have been a lot of rain because the water was very brown. A good break with a cold Bintang

Worth a stop when you're in the area. We weren't that impressed with the venue as it was all a bit run down at the falls. There was once a walkway with a bridge or something. No place to put your stuff either.The water is quite warm which means it isn't mountain water but the runoff from the fields. Who knows what's in there...Many steps to climb but we thought exercise is a bonus...

Could be better. We were there and it was very crouded so you couldn't swim or take a picture. Also they made you pay like 10000 rupi to go there when it is something natural that you must have for free... Also it is very dirty... So i don't know what they do with the money we pay!

A dip into paradise. Like others, this was a bit of a dream experience to swim at a waterfall - especially one as gorgeous as this. You do have to run the gauntlet of people selling things to get to the path and there is a modest entry fee. None of this should be off putting as the sellers are polite enough and didn't really bother us. The path can be a fraction slippery and uneven so you do need to mind your footing. I wouldn't take anyone who is unsteady on their feet. At the bottom of the path were some rocks where I ditched the sun dress and headed in for a sip. A bit like the path, I needed to mind my footing as I got in through the shallows but the joy of swimming in such a gorgeous location, with the spray of the waterfall absolutely made it worth the effort.
Just like a dream. To swim in waterfall was one of my bucket list things to do! Little that i knew that this beautiful waterfall will make my wish come true! It's definitely a little gem of bali!

Brilliant waterfall. Really beautiful to see such a large waterfall up close. You could see rainbows in the sunlight, which only made it more beautiful. Strongly recommend a visit. Also cheap to enter which is a big plus.

Interesting Waterfall. A narrow road to access the waterfall viewing area and then a minor entrance fee amounting to about half the $AUD2 per person. A good viewing area but access to the actual base of the falls is by stairs only and not suitable for those with ambulant difficulties. The usual rag trade stores and very interesting multilingual signs that have to be seen to appreciate some dry humour.

Cooling Dip! Buy Tickets first. We hired a day driver to bring us here. There's a few cafes / convenient stores where you can sit and enjoy the view and waterfall crashing sounds. Buy your tickets at the parking lot area, before you start your descend to the waterfall.Walk about 100 over steps downwards, and you will reach there.You may just bring minimal belongings, and leave the items there whilst you go for a dip in the waterfall. The water is cold, and there are rocks everywhere. If you do not want your feel to hurt, it will be best to wear waterproof sandals to protect the soles.There are paid toilets where you can wash up after the cooling dip!

Stunning. It takes bout 200 steps to walk down to the pool below the waterfall and looks like a snapshot out of a glossy travel brochure. It is definitely worth it. Wear sensible shows as the last part you have to walk across rock and mud which can be slippery. You can enjoy a exhilarating swim. There is also a small village temple near to the river which is frequented by the local villages. After your climb back you can enjoy a drink or browse the tourist shops. This waterfall is missed out of some of the travel books, so a bit of a hidden gem.

Speccy Waterfall but keep it clean!. I have traveled as a tour guide in the USA, and Canada (off seasons abroad) for 6 years and seen many spectacular falls. This one is pretty amazing and had a huge flow as we caught it after 3 days of on and off rain :) A lot of power and pretty cool rock formations. Check it out from the 3 different levels. River, mid way and top. Be very careful as you go up because the rocks are super slippery and you don't want a freefall!We entered from the east side. Huge parking lot with a few smiley ladies selling cold drinks. Be sure to support the locals! You'll need one after the steep and sweaty hike back up!5000IDR suggested "donation" I am cool with paying 50c to be escorted by a local down the steep slippery steps...However, my 1 gripe is all of the TRASH!! Behind a small "fence" in the parking lot is a giant mound (landfill). All along the trail going down, along the river and in the river. Trash, trash and more trash. Do you part when visiting to carry a little trash back up and maybe some of the locals hanging out will start to see white man making a difference little by little. Respect thy nature! Don't destroy your natrual beauties :) Enjoy!

Nice spot for a quick dip, but it gets real crowded. This isn't too far out of Ubud so it's great for a day trip, but the waterfall was chock full of tourists when we went and the ground is full of uneven pebbles that make it hard to walk/stand. Still, nice enough for a short cooling swim :)

Beautiful!. Amazing place,lots of steps to reach the waterfall but definitely worth it,but take care its not safe for children. Don't forget to wear your swimming suit because swimming and taking pic in middle of the water is a must,there is no place for changing cloths thou so be prepared.I recommend a day trip: go first to Tegenungan waterfall,then up north to Kintamani mountain to have lunch there,then back to Tegalalang rice terrace,and u can ask the driver to pass by any luwak coffee farm on the way,this cost me 400k for the car,avoid normal taxi and get car from any tourism booth and keep bargaining.

Simple access waterfall. Tegenungan waterfall is very easy to trek down but abit slippery(slippers are still alright) to the pit from the entrance. Entry fee is 2USD per person. 1USD for a simple clean toilet. we went after it rains, so the water is kinda milky. during normal days, its clear and u can swim in the pit.

Great waterfall for swimming!. The Tegenungan Waterfall is only a very short walk 500m from the village, which has a number of the normal tourist shops and some bathroom facilities. You walk down a short path which is fairly uneven but not too demanding but you are treated to a great 25m waterfall into a pool that is cool and refreshing and great for swimming in and challenging yourself to stand under the torrent of the waterfall getting pummeled by the water. I would say this is a must visit if you are in Bali.

Very Nice Waterfall. I visited this waterfall on 25 June 2016, around 1415. It was pretty busy at this point!COST: The cost to see the waterfall is 10,000 IDR (less than $1US). EXPERIENCE: It's quite a walk down to see the waterfall, as you start quite high up in comparison. The stairs are obviously uneven and may be challenging for kids (and adults really!). Once you go down the stairs, you can go swimming in and around the waterfall, take pictures and enjoy the scenery. It's nice that you're able to go swimming as a lot of waterfalls I've visited in other countries don't allow that. There are some vendors around the area selling souvenirs (make sure to barter!) and there is someone at the bottom who was selling cold water (not sure of the price though).OVERALL: I would recommend going to see this waterfall for those in the area! I really enjoyed this stop as it was a beautiful area, and enjoyable for those who want to swim. This isn't for someone who isn't in shape (you don't have to be in ridiculous shape, just able to do about 200 or so uneven steps) and it's not wheelchair accessible.

Stunning views, detracted by the scores of people.. Read a few reviews about this waterfall and it did not disappoint! It was my first major waterfall trip in my life and it is beautiful.Could not find a nice angle for a picture due to the scores of people taking a dip at the foot of the falls. Would have did it myself if I brought my own swim clothes.Stairs leading down to the fall was steep, but nothing a person of below average fitness couldn't handle.

TEGENUNGAN, DON'T WORRY, BE SEXY. The waterfall is located on the course of Petanu sacred river, in the midst of dense vegetation. This is the easiest waterfall to visit as it is quite close to Ubud and South Bali. The water volume don't change too much but the color becomes dark in the rainy season. Be careful to swim under the falling water because it is quite deep. If you are lucky, sometimes you can see glimpses of the colorful Javan Kingfishers flying from one tree to others around here. The laughs of this bird is so nice. At the bottom of the stairs there are some holy spring with very clean water. Locals used to come for drinking water and for bathing here.

Awesome Waterfall and nice place to cool off. If doing a tour of Ubud this should 100% be on your list. Beautiful waterfall with awesome views as you walk down. You can also take a nice dip to cool off so bring a bathing suit. Not much of a "beach" area so you need to leave your stuff on the rocks and your feet might take a beating trying to walk to the water, but its worth it.

Would not bother. Yes it's a waterfall, but i guess if you have never in your life seen any waterfall then it may interest you. When we got there, there was people everywhere and you could see the waterfall with a whole heap of people swimming below. I guess the swarms of people and the rubbish over the lookout edge detracted from the whole experience.

Worth to visit. 25 minutes from central ubud, and you will have amazing experience. My 12 yo son swam here. Easy enough to acess, stairs available. Don't forget to bring towel. After purchase the ticket, there is paid toilet on the left side which is very clean. You can take shower here.

Incredible waterfall. Myself and my boyfriend hired a moped for the day (50K IDR) and heard this waterfall was a must see. We got a map up on our phone as we were staying in the heart of Ubud, it was 12 kilometres away. The route there was very easy to follow and near the end it is sign posted so difficult to miss. 5000 IDR per person to get in. Misleading reviews on here to say that the waterfall is right next to the car park. It is a good steep walk down through the forest which just adds to the character of the place. Once you reach the bottom it is a beautiful view of the waterfall and the pool is very inviting and surprisingly warm once you get in! Great afternoon spent here, would 100% recommend.

Great waterfall. Kiddos loved the waterfall. It is a hidden gem in gianyar. You have to go down the stairs... try when you go up...hahahhaa... it is worth after you see the scenery. Becareful because it is slippery, you have to bring extra clothes.

Never before. have I ever experienced something as powerful and thrilling as this! The pounding water and unbelievably strong current left this swimmer breathless. This is a great place for a quick visit, as there's not much else to do but gape at the beauty of the crashing water and try your luck against its brute force. There is, however, a walkway up the side of the cliff where pictures will come out beautifully.

Spiritual Cleansing and bonus Cooling. I was grateful that I am steady on my feet and nimble on wet slippery surfaces. Descending down a few flights of stairs into a small pool with an large waterfall. I joined the line (be sure to wear a bathing suit and bring dry clothes to change into after) and placed my hands on the stone wall behind the fall of water. Don't plunge in - gently dip your head under the flowing water. Fantastic.

Very fun and refreshing. We traveled to Bali in June so it was very hot. Swimming in this waterfall was so refreshing! The water wasn't as cold as the other waterfalls so it was very pleasant to swim in! It also isn't a huge waterfall so you are able to swim up to where the water hits the river. It was very fun and relaxing! Not to mention it is a very beautiful place to be, even if you don't go swimming. Highly recommend!

Nice way to beat the heat!. There is a small entrance fee of 10000 IDR to get in. Along the way to the waterfall, harmless young kids will be persuading you to buy souvenirs. Going down the steps to the waterfall is not an issue, its the climbing up that burns energy. A nice dip in the waterfall is a great way to beat the afternoon heat. Advise to wear wet/aqua shoes as small stones are everywhere. There's basic toilet for quick wash up and only simple noodle are being sold for lunch.
Perfect . Certainly worth going.A strong force of mist when your in the water is amazing.Very refreshing a very good place to chill out and enjoy.

Must visit!!!. This waterfall is a must visit if you are in Bali. It comes on the way to ubud, so you can plan accordingly. So green and the showers of the waterfall makes you forget the whole world and you be enjoying the nature there.

Fun experience . The waterfall itself was very nice. Not too big and lake for swimming at the bottom. Large currents and rocky but it's fun. You can get behind the waterfall which is cool as well. Lots of people around which makes it not so chilled. Lots of good picture spots. 10000 idr to get in which is okay. It's clean enough. Some rubbish around unfortunately. A fair few steps to get down and back up again but reasonable fitness is okay but not good for reduced mobility.

Day trip here. This place is awesome and I reckon must come for a visit and photographs. Most importantly a cold dip in the nice waterfall. This place is not really senior citizen or wheel chair friendly. However one still can enjoy the nice clear view of the waterfall from above. Take note of a different path leading directly to the waterfall. Saw lots of people not asking and trying to cross a knee deep to water directly to the waterfall. Enjoy the great view and swim.

Not quite a jungle walk. My daughter and i visited in May 2016 and while the falls were spectacular it was quite close to the carpark-not quite the walk through the jungle we envisioned. The falls could be clearly seen from the carpark and it was a fairly easy walk down and up stairs to the waterfall. The falls were spectacular in quantity of water and power but there was nowhere to change or dry off and relax.

Popular waterfall. This is a very popular waterfall but that doesn't mean it isn't beautiful. For the most part, it is very clean and natural. You can swim under the waterfall if you'd like. There are quite a few steps to get down to the waterfall so it is not a trip someone with limited mobility should make. However, you can take a load off at the beginning of the steps at a cafe to enjoy the view of the waterfall. If you don't mind another little climb, you can go to the mouth of the waterfall at the top.

Vackert vattenfall. Tengayangan is a beautiful waterfall. However, it is not like that giant. You get a nice view of the waterfall from the parking lot. There are also several places where you can buy souvenirs and get something to eat or drink. It's a pretty long walk from the parking lot to the waterfall.

Great views. We had not planned this visit our guide stopped as was pacing told us it was worth a look.As we had not got long didn't walk down to the waterfall but sat with a beer and fully enjoyed the view. Looked great fun to jump in, even though don't think I would be brave enough. Few shops with the usual things for sale .

Popular waterfall. This place is becoming more and more popular for tourists as well as shops.Nice refreshing dive, but quite some steps to get down there (and later up again).Maybe better to go to smaller and not so renowned ones

Pretty ok. We found this on TripAdvisor and went there on an afternoon. It's out of the main city of Ubud. You have to drive for 20 minutes to reach there. Not amazing but an average waterfall. Water was dirty, and the base is rocky. You have to go down the stairs to take a dip. Good experience. It's fun. Give it a try.

Pretty but very crowded. Was only 15,000 IR each to visit. You pay before you can see. Many stairs to get down to the bottom but a bit of exercise on holiday never hurt anyone. Was super crowded and the rubbish made swimming less tempting but very pretty being there.

Too much rubbish. Not worth the steps.. Yes, it's a waterfall. Nothing more. Parkingplace is okay and for free. Entrance fee just 10,000 per person. Seems fair. Many huge steps to go down in order to find a pretty muddy place. Area near water and inside the water is full of pebbles. You will need surf- or swimming-shoes here to move without hurting feet. Sitzing or lying is impossible. In the afternoon, the sunlight shows a little rainbow, which looks nice. Water is just going to your hips, so there is no diving possible. Unfortunately, this place is full of garbage and rubbish. Plastic bottles swimming and lying around. Plastic foil from chocolate bars. "Keep Bali Clean" doesn't work here. (What's the entrance fee for, btw?)Climbing up those huge stairs again made me think to have better skipped this "sight", which isn't really one. Too many tourists, rubbish, mud and garbage. What's missing is the beauty of nature! It's gone... Sad.
Nice place for swim and enjoy nature. Took about 15 mins walk down to the waterfall from the top. Very nice place for swim and sheltered from sun. Definitely worth a visit in Bali

Another beautiful place to visit in Bali. I hadn't been here before... and sooo glad I did. It is truly worth the trip to the bottom to really appreciate the spectacular waterfall. If you are lucky you may see a brave bod jumping from the rocks into the very deep pool. Very picturesque so take your camera. its a good hike to the top again but just take your time and enjoy the view from each "catch you breath" zone.
We jumped by warned its not that deep..... Great waterfall, not many people jumping was very high and scary. be warned its not that deep jump as far out as you can. Very beautiful.

breathtaking. One of the most beautiful places I've seen, we got driven from Legian, it was about an hour and a half drive. There are quite a lot of stairs so I don't reccomend if you have back or leg problems.We arrived at the waterfall which wasn't to crowded when we arrived, there was amazing photo opportunities both in front of and if your willing to walk beside the waterfall. In some spots under the waterfall It was quite deep, I was unable to touch the bottom. The current of the waterfall is very strong definitely watch your littlies swimming anywhere near it.The cost to go to the waterfall is 10,000 rp

Enjoyable waterfall close to south of Bali. It takes only 35 min from Sanur to get there so this waterfall is an accessible stop for many tourists.There is a big parking lot and there were many cars when we arrived there around 11AM. An entrance fee has to be paid before you are allowed to visit the waterfall. The walk to the waterfall takes about 10-15min. Some steps have to be taken and then a small walk along the river. The waterfall itself is not so high but the green surroundings make it a worthwile stop. There were many people swimming under the waterfall which made taking nice pictures a bit more difficult.Not the nicest waterfall in Bali (Sekumpul waterfalls is far more recommended) but good stop as part of a day trip.

Great views. As part of our day tour around Ubud our last visit was the waterfalls. From the top you get a picture of how deep the valley is. In bali they dont have the step to fall ratio OH&s requirements like Aust. so be prepared for a steep descent. Once down at the waterfall you can swim or take pictures in the cool environment and great pictures. The climb back up could be taxing on some so remember if you go down there is only one way back up....
Natural Waterfall with fresh mountain water. Good refresher amongst the natural waterfall! The water was fresh and the was clear. The flight of steps to ascend and descend were tiring, but worth it.

Beautiful . It's near Ubud not a far drive , it is long stairs but then the terrain make u feel you're in an adventure bending and jumping it's beautiful then the water fall is majestic we took some of our best pictures, and we climbed extra to stand right next to it at the top , it was worth it , I got tired climbing the stairs but it was nice

Amazing! but the stairs.. . $1 aud to enter, with an amazing view from the top, or you can venture down the stairs to the waterfall and see it closer/swim in it. Just be aware, it is incredibly slippery and the stairs are very steep and hard to climb back up!
Worth the effort. If one can manage the countless steep steps and the rough and slippery terrain the waterfall is really worth the effort and we found it safe to swim in the water.

Powerful falls you can swim in. A picturesque waterfall tucked in a little valley. You get there walking down a set of pretty steep steps with no handrails or shade. At the foot of the steps is a little temple with holy spring water shooting out from different jets that you can shower under as part of a cleansing ritual. Closer to the falls, the path is rocky and damp. Wished we had brought our swim things to join the other people swimming under the falls. Even though it's about as tall as a 5 storey building, there is a huge volume of water that tumbles powerfully over the cliff edge. The water comes from the mountains I'm told by my guide from Amansuka Tour. The water appears to be about waist deep, and then rushes away down the valley. Many of the shops between the carpark and the top of the steps to the falls advertise clean toilets for use for a fee, including one which offers shower facilities. After the exhausting climb back up from the bottom of the falls, we had a chilled coconut to drink with a good view of the falls. A nice outing for the family, come prepared with your swim things.
Go for a Swim. A very cool place to witness the power of nature and cool off in Ubud. Costs $10Rupiah to get in, and totally worth it.
Lovely spot. Lovely waterfall and great place for a swim to cool off. Steps down and up were not too tough but can get a little slippery close to the bottom.

Beautiful. It was a bit of a climb down but well worth it to stand directly before the waterfall, allowing the spraying must to kiss your face. Some brave souls swam but not necessary. Wear sturdy shoes as it's very rocky!

Nice waterfall but crowds weren't great. I've visited many waterfalls in Bali and Lombok and this was definitely not at the top of the list. It was extremely crowded and it was disappointing to see people jumping off the cliffs, seemingly without regard for their welfare or that of others. I'd spend the time to travel further north to visit the waterfalls at Munduk or Git Git if you want to see and swim at waterfalls in Bali.

Great fun. Great waterfall. Shallow in places and deep enough to swim in others. Waterfall very powerful but lifeguards were there. Suggest going early before the crowds arrive. Pretty dangerous to jump due to water depth and current in places.

Amazing UBUD Waterfall. My guide told me just slightly over two years ago how empty this place was and only visited by locals. Today, the falls is crowded and visited by all tourist. It even has a temporary parking area and a booth that collects entry fees when visiting the falls. Restaurants all over the place and also shops selling souvenirs, t-shirts etc..Today all vantage view of the fall is taken or blocked by a restaurant. So from the top you have to pay buy a drink or buy some food to get a good view. The other way is to descend down to the falls which worth the walk. Not too difficult in my opinion and is worth the effort to get a feel of the majestic falls. When you reach below there are also restaurants as well and also a pool with spring water for you to dip in. i recommend this waterfall as i think it is worth the visit anytime you are in the UBUD area.

beautiful waterfall, but lots of other waterfalls of similar beauty. The waterfall was very pretty to see, but not much different to any other waterfall. The water looked very dirty so didnt encourage us to go for a swim. The steps down were very daunting to my unfit husband, but we enjoyed a bintang at the bottom looking at the scenery.

Go prepared to take a dip. Went on a hot,humid day, the steps down to the falls looked daunting, 168 steps one way (as counted by my little one) but once you see the falls the climb down or the imminent climb up is forgotten, we regret going without preparing to take a bath, there are paid toilets where we can change. and there is a holy bath place too (women should not enter during Mensturation).

Memory of a lifetime!. Enjoyed a Bintang Radler, and then hiked down to the bottom of the waterfall. Luckily, I wore a one-piece swimsuit. Walked over a fallen log to the far side, and hiked a little ways up to a ledge by the fall. Held my nose and jumped off cannonball style. It was long way down, and I got bruises on my butt from the fall. Other than that, everything went well. There are no guides or signs to describe jumping locations or water depth, so be careful and jump into the same spot as others before you. Don't wear nose rings or other jewelry. And make sure someone gets it in camera! Have fun!

Sorry, New Zealand has amazing waterfalls so this was not a huigh light!. The water was dirty, a beautiful scene but not up to the standard we have in new Zealand.....sorry. So, I gather it depends on where you live on level of the attraction..

Nice place to visit . lots of people tried jump of the cliff. Make sure to bring of water or sports drinks as you will need it on your way back to the parking lot. If you are planning to visit make sure you come either morning or in the afternoon as the heat will drive u mad in day time. Unless u want to chill out for more than an hour. Make sure bring spare clothes and towel even your not planning to make a swim.

Lots of tourist but beautiful waterfall. We stopped off at the waterfall after a morning spent in Ubud. There is a small entry fee & then you walk down past a few shops. None of them hassle you which was good. Next there is a bit of a hike down some steps to get to the waterfall. Not really too bad as you can take your time. The only bad thing is the steps are different heights.Once down the steps you walk along a dirt path until you reach the waterfall.The waterfall itself is lovely, some people were jumping off & others just hanging about in the water. It was quite crowded with tourists which was a bit of a pity. It's also quick rocky so if you have some shoes you can wear into the water that would be ideal. Overall a lovely little spot to stop off & cool down.

Natural beauty. It's a very nice place. Big waterfall. There were ppl jumping from the cliff too. A lot of ppl swim there but keep in mind the ground is not sand. It's all rock. There isn't really a place you can sit down and chill. You will get wet even u don't get into the water. You have to walk stairs to reach the waterfall but come back up is a bit exhausted.

Lots of stairs to an ok waterfall filled with tourists. In the Balinese heat, the number of stairs to get to this waterfall is not worth it. Once you get there, the place is overcrowded with young kids in bakinis.

great for a daytrip. The waterfall is quiet impressive and as such is an extremely busy attraction. Went on two different occasions, the first time being an absolute scorcher of a day, the waterfall's icy waters was a refreshing reward but climbing back up all those stairs in the blistering heat was tough (make sure you bring plenty of water/sports drink for the trip back up!). On the plus side though we were completely dry by the time we reached the top again. The second time we visited it was 28 degrees but it actually felt much cooler than that and the water was almost a bit too cold but it did make the stairs back up much more bearable that time around.

Beautiful Waterfall. Good waterfall to visit in the Gianyar region but it is best to visit in the morning as it is becoming a main tourist attraction with the addition of more market stalls and cafes than when we visited 12 months ago. Still a nice walk down to the waterfall and well worth the visit.

Beautiful waterfall. This is my first waterfall I visited where I could actually get into it and swim around! The water was cold yet so refreshing, I didn't want to leave. The current is really strong so make sure to not go in too deep

Go early morning! . So we did a day your around ubud with Wayan tours ( he is definitely worth booking) and one of the places we visited was this beautiful waterfall.I asked him when the best time to visit to avoid the crowds and he said early morning so (9am).When we arrived we had the whole place to ourself! It was beautiful! We spent few hours there taking photos and went for a swim.

Beautiful place for a swim and a beer.. It's not the natural beauty I am sure it once was, but once you get down in the water you forget all that, obviously when jumping and swimming you need to be very aware of what you are doing as it can be very dangerous. You do have to pay to get in, but it's peanuts, lots of vendors at the top, but none at the actual falls.

Absolutely breath taking. Gorgeous scenary! Only a short walk down to the waterfall. Cute little markets as well. Only paid 10000 for entry. The water was nice. Alot of people around so was a great atmosphere. Must see.
Nice short walk down to the falls.. A little crowded with tourist. Good place to take a dip when its hot. The walk down is fairly steep which means its a tough climb going back up.

Tegenungan waterfall. waterfall Tegenungan located in a strategic area gianyar facilitate the tourists find enough to capitalize the GPS we can find it, the way to Tegenungan waterfall we saw with views of rice fields, to get to the waterfall we went down some stairs to see the waterfalls in addition we also can swim there, the roar of the huge and beautiful natural surroundings
Nice Waterfalls. Our last attraction of Bali trip was this falls on the way to Airport. The View was amazing. The Entrance fee was 15K IDR per person.

Nice Visit. If you are in the area I would recommend visiting, there are some shops down to the waterfall where you can buy drinks or tops/bathers etc. There's not a lot of steps considering how far down it is which is a plus, and the waterfall is very beautiful once you get to it. I went in the water and loved it, but even if you just sit on the rocks it's nice.

Can be enjoyed from a distance. 10,000 from memory for parking, buys this view, lovely. I didn't walk down all the stairs to go in the water, though many did. I would go again if I could and have a swim. To be seen.
Just beautiful. Be prepared to walk down stairs to get up close and personal with this waterfall. You don't have to do the walk to see the waterfall but it is definitely worth while.

phenomenal work of nature. Once you park your rented scooter (easiest way to get with google maps) for free at the entrance of the waterfall area you will be asked to pay a small pittance for this wondrous work of nature. It is a somewhat difficult walk for those who have disabilities or impairments, but well worth it. You snake your way down a path with several different views until you reach the bottom. There is nowhere safe nor really dry to put your stuff, so pack light and wet ready. There are four chairs awkwardly placed and charged for by some young guys standing around. Wear water shoes if you can because the rocks are slippery, hard, and sometimes jagged, but the water is refreshing and the sheer power of the waterfall is breathtaking. Definitely a must see in Ubud!
Very impressive. Due to a bad knee, I was unable to negotiate the many steps down and back up to the viewing area. Disappointing, but still a beautiful place.
the image of paradise. the idea of hiking through the jungle to a hidden waterfall and taking a cooling swim is the image of paradise

Worth the walk, refreshing dip.. Its quite a walk down but the views of the waterfall on the way are stunning. The area itself for taking a dip is quite crowded and not the cleanest but the waterfall itself is fine. You can take a small walk up to the top and look down but wouldn't recommend jumping personally as the water isn't that deep. To wade under the waterfall takes some doing as the power of the water is immense but not deep, waist height. Great for Photos and the experience.

Awesome waterfalls. Our driver/guide stopped us here on the way from Sanur to Ubud. We are glad he did. The waterfalls were great. It was quite big and with a lot of water. Since there is a good distance to walk from the road/shops, the view of the waterfalls is unhindered.You can also swim in the pool of water under the falls. We werent aware of this and werent prepared for this. But I would strongly recommend that. There were also guys jumping the falls which is prohibited. It was nice to see them do this crazy stunt though. I hope no one gets injured.
It was ok but not amaazing. It was good to stop here to refresh a little bit, it can get very crowded though. You can skip it if you don't have enough time, it's fine.

Rocky and not ideal for swimming. The waterfall is very beautiful, however I wouldn't consider this an ideal swimming hole. The area is full of 20 something hippies smoking and being very loud. There is nowhere to sit except for 4 lounge chairs that you can rent). Its extremely rocky so it's painful to walk and a bit dangerous. I by no means felt it was a relaxing experience. There is equally not too much available in terms of eating. A few places but all extremely over priced. I came here because my guide took me here. I wouldn't be in a rush to go back.

Good for pictures. Not very large waterfall, surrounded by green palm trees and bushes. Nice attraction for taking pictures and buying souvenirs. We didn't go down for swimming, but there is such option, so do not forget your swim suit if you would like to refresh yourself.

Washing your cares away. My wife and I are waterfall junkies and we couldn't miss the chance to see Tegenungan waterfall during our stay in Ubud. After a short climb (<10 min), we were greeted with the now familiar smell of "waterfall air" as we approached. Though we didn't wade into the pool, we still thoroughly enjoyed the experience.Pros: manageable climb (stairs) to/from waterfall, cool breeze, icy waterCons: smokers, rubbish thrown around the waterfall

Stunning waterfall. The approach to the falls has been developed since my visit last year, with about a dozen touristy shops en route from the parking area to the top of the steps which lead down to the falls. The shops are varied, colourful and worth a quick look, if only to buy an ice cream. If you don't want to do the considerable trek down to the waterfall, you can sit on the balcony in the restaurant or go to the viewing area. Binoculars would help with the view but are not necessary. The English notices are worth a read. :-).Worth a short visit - we stayed 1/2 hour.

GET IN THE WATER!!!. I loved this site! My girlfriend and I stayed in Ubud, and it was a short drive from there. The current is strong, but the falls are beautiful and it feels great to get wet in this heat! Brought along a Kway bag to keep my stuff dry and enjoyed the water! Great mid-day retreat!
amazing. an amazing natural wonder. The place is easy to get to and although there are lots of steps to get there, the end result is worth it.
Nature. A walk and a half down to the waterfall but stunning once you arrive. Well worth a visit and grab an ice cream once you are back at the top to reward yourself!

Dont forget to swim. Easiest waterfall to access 30 minutes from Ubud. The stairs down is a bit too much for old people, I think. The water is not that cold and swimmable. Dont forget to bring extra clothes, you'll get wet.

Breathtaking. The Tegenungan Waterfall was a stop on a day long private tour. Be prepared to walk down many steps, which you have to walk back up. Once you get to the base of the waterfall, it is quite a bit crowded. You can swim in the water if you wish. There are chairs for rent and a few vendors selling stuff, so be prepared to be a little bothered. I understand why they do it, but it makes a breathtaking site more commercialized for sure. The waterfall itself is pretty massive and was flowing at full force when we were there. The surrounding area was lush green and beautiful. It's definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.
very good fall nearby Ubud. i recommend to come to this fall earlier or late to avoid heat. the water look little chocolate when i came there. be ready to step down. nice for swimming too

Nature's power. A beautiful landscape with waterfall that you can attempt to swim under. It's ferocious & I wouldn't recommend it for everyone. If you do plan on going in, I would recommend wearing shoes as the combination of current & rocks make egress tricky. Despite other reviews saying you can jump from the waterfall, you can't & nor should you. The only possible place to jump from would have you land in waist depth water! Kudos to the bloke who carts an esky of drinks to the bottom.
a must see. only 20 minutes out of Ubud, this is an amazing opportunity to see and untouched beauty.. get in and under the waterfall and then climb to the top for even more pictures...
great views and a great jump if you are game. hard walk both up and down, but a equally fine view just from the top. If your game you can jump 15m to the water bellow

Beautiful spot. Hey there. great place to go on the way to ubud! great view on the waterfall and nice spot to cool down. a little restaurant has cool drinks at the bottom as at every tourist attraction. make sure you have a look into the half natural showers next to the restaurant at the bottom of the stairs!!!

Steep hike, but worth it for the pretty waterfall. We visited this waterfall with our two-year-old and five-year-old as part of a day trip out ubud. This was one of our favorite activities of the morning. There was a steep hike down a staircase to get to the river and then a short walk along the river to get to the waterfall. The waterfall itself is beautiful to look at take pictures of, Space although the river itself is too muddy for swimming. There were plenty of places to stop and get a call beverage, including a nice restaurant at the top that had a njce overlook of the waterfall. Our five year old did the hike with no problem, but our two-year-old we had to carry, mostly because the stairs were pretty steep, and we are worried about him falling. This was a great addition to our itinerary of visiting temples, fun to do something a little different and to get a little hike in.
beautiful. very scenic and beautiful waterfall.It was very hot, though, so we did not walk all the way down to the temple.

Very nice. Good experience in the middle of nowhere :-) It is from Ubud a 20min drive by scooter. We really like the waterfall and take a 20min bath and shower there. Is good possibility to escape a while from Ubud. We've been there in Mai what is not main season and it was not so crowded. You should go there is nice visit.
"Excellent experience!!!". "Definitely worth visiting and swimming at the bottom of the waterfall!!!"An experience I'll always remember!!! XXXXX

The nicest 150 steps I have taken. Tegenungan Waterfall Ubud We were taken to the falls on recommendation from our driver Gus,On arrival at the falls around 11;15 am, there were people and cars every were, however it just seemed to work, we were parked with out to much delay and soon found our selves walking past a few shops before heading down the 150 plus steps to the bottom, the steps to the bottom are concrete and easy to manage.Once at the bottom you will find another shop and a toilet that will cost you a small fee for the convenience, the toilet is clean and has paper if needed, another short walk along the river {not concrete} and you arrive at the waterfall, be careful if you have a non water proof camera the is water spray every were an your camera will get wet. The water was a nice temperature should you want to get in I suggest you wear water shoes there are a lot of large pebbles in the water, I did not were water shoes in and found it a little awkward on the footing at times.DO NOT JUMP off the accessible ledge the water below is not deep AND YOU WILL CAUSE YOURSELF AN INJURY .Now after you cool down and are nice and relaxed sorry you have 150 plus stairs to climb up.A very pleasant outing
Beautiful adventure. Beautiful view, long walk but I really enjoy my time. Bathroom are no good. Bring water, confortable show. Bring extra clothes. It was amazing!

Amazing waterfall surrounded by jungle. This waterfall is definitely worth a visit. There are quite a few stairs down (and back up) and at the bottom the floor of the basin is covered with rocks - so you need to be mobile to go here. The bottom of the gorge is spectacular with mist rising from the thunderous waterfall and one whole side is covered in thick jungle. The waterfall and water is not cold and is very powerful at the moment. There is a cave behind the waterfall that you can swim too and then launch yourself out under the edge of the waterfall where you wil get quite a pounding. It is soo worth going. There are a few little shops at the bottom and an awesome,y inexpensive gelato shop at the top reward yourself when you get back up the stairs! There is a small entrance fee that you have to pay - from memory 20,000 Rp. Definitely go.

Great waterfall. Great views from the top! Long walk down. Steep stairs down to the waterfall. Remember you have to walk back up. Several people were swimming, but the water looked brownish. Talking to the locals, this is not always the case. Recent rainfall might have caused this. Don't forget your camera.

Lovely waterfalls near Ubud in Bali. We visited this waterfall on our way back from Mt. Kintamani and Lake Batur trip. The scenery around the waterfalls is so beautiful and refreshing. There are warning signs of not to swim in the water, but visitors do get a kick out of a shower under the falls.If you are visiting with your family don't forget to take some cold drink or water bottle along, you will feel thirsty when climbing back up. A very lovely spot, not to be missed.
Just Great!. Spectacular view. Dipping into the water was wonderful and fun. Very 'zen' and beautiful. Really enjoy myself there. It will be more fun with a big group of friends under the waterfall.
Beautiful!. Went here on the way to Ubud. You can go down some steep stairs to the bottom and have a swim. It's not much else to do here but the scenery is absolutely beautiful. I loved it.

Simply Stunning. The waterfall in itself is spectacular and I am so glad I added this to a must see in Bali. The walk down to the waterfall is steep and even though it only takes a few minutes to walk down the decline is steep and I didn't see anyone not sweating as they walked back up the stairs to return to the main area. There is a minimal admission cost ($1 AUS) which is more than cheap for the view you get and the opportunity to have a swim under this amazing natural wonder. Great views all the way down to the bottom. Take a bottle of water with you as the walk does raise the heart rate.I would go again the next time I was in Bali and tell others to go to.

Wow...Just, Wow. My friend and I visited this waterfall as a part of a 1/2 day tour of the Ubud area of Bali. WOW! This was the best part of our wonderful 4 day Bali trip! Anyone who says this experience is a waste of time and money wasted their opportunity for a great experience. We went into the water and actually got quite a ways behind the waterfall. The water was very nice on our visit. It wasn't cold and although it wasn't very clear, it wasn't dirty either. It was actually very refreshing and the wonder of the beauty of nature made it even more so. The strength and sound of the water coming over the falls is awe inspiring. We actually climbed up to the upper part of the falls as well. The climb back up to the parking lot after we were done wasn't easy but we saw it as a nice chance for some exercise and it really shouldn't be too taxing for most people. In all, we spent a very fast hour and a half at the falls and it was more than worth the 10,000 rupiah/person entry fee. Yes, I would most definitely go again!

Waste of time and money. We took the trip part of our private tour and we found it totally waste of time and money. It's super touristic, be ready to climb and walk a lot and deal with the numerous salesmen who are everywhere. We've been in Iceland and the waterfall was "meh" for us. But, the rum-rasin icecream was quite nice :) A total tourist trap.

a hidden beauty. From atop one can see the cascading waterfall...it was approximately a 10 minute climb down the falls, passing by a temple & a bathing spot. Most of the tourist will go for a dip in the clear cool water even going directly under the waterfall. There is an area that one can go up & on the ledge beside the gushing water. For those who are gutsy enough one can dive into the water from the 15 meter high ledge. This waterfall is surrounded with trees & vegetation making this atmosphere cool.

Go early. Waterfall was larger then expected. Walk down is quite steep, but all concrete steps. We arrived at about 9am, only 6 other tourists down the bottom at the waterfall, which made for better photos. I wouldnt bother with a tour to this waterfall, as it is easy to find on a scooter. Small entrance fee.

Worth the trip . We visited this place on the way back from Ubud to Nusa Dua, and it was worth the trip. There are quite a lot of stairs to climb up/down so be prepared. The waterfall itself is beautiful and you can swim at the bottom so bring some bathers.
Stunning waterfall and bathing area. One of the best waterfalls I have been to but not for the unfit as we saw a few people struggling up the stairs on the way back in the heat.
really fun!. Lots of tourists, but overall worth the trip. Tons of people in the water, but very refreshing. Don't bring alot of stuff if you plan on swimming. Good for pictures as well!

Worth the effort .... Quite a long walk down to the waterfall but well worth the effort. You can swim if you wish but the water was not very clear. The walk back up is not for the faint hearted and the heat adds to the effort needed to climb the steps.
nice. Nice waterfall, but the water is little bit dirty. But I have swimed in it anyway :) Best to visit early before all the turist crowds arrive.

Beautiful, Agressive Waterfall. Maybe aggressive is the wrong word but when you get to the Waterfall you will know what I mean. The sheer force and volume of water which is carried by this waterfall is amazing.
Go on a day you're feeling fit because there are a lot of steps and they are absolutely gigantic. Oh and bring water.

Beautiful waterfall. Beautiful waterfall near Ubud. There is a great lookout above and you can also descend the stairs (lots of them so not easily accessible for anyone with mobility issues) to get closer and also swim in the waterfall which is very refreshing - although the rocks make it difficult to get in and out of the water. It can get busy on warm days, but it's worth it.

Lovely spot in Bali. Take your swimming suits and go dip in there, that will make the difference , it is awesome but would need a bit of a walk and would get you tired going back to your car, so be ready for that.

A nice piece of nature. Situated just a short ride away from Ubud, the Tegenungang waterfall offers a nice experience in the beauty that Nature has to offer. Before descending the stairs you get a nice overview of the waterfall and the surroundings, when you reach the bottom you are able to swim under the fall itself which is a nice Experience.

Stunning!. We went here on a beautiful sunny day, so it was pretty busy. But we still made the best of it and we loved it. Be careful, its very stoney all over and its easy to slip up or fall back into the water (a good laugh though) And the view on the ledge is great.
Nice treat!. Beautiful waterfall and you can have a refreshing swim if you like. It's near Ubud, have a look if you're in the area. Always fun to see natures work

Amazing waterfall at Tegenungan. This waterfall, is one of the easier to see.
I have been here many time from the beginning as untouristic time to be popular tourist destination. I am still enjoying this place very much. Keep the best work, keep the clean the environment !

seriously breathtaking. The walk to the waterfall was not as bad as I thought it would be. Lots of stairs = good cardio.
I'll admit, the walk back up was not so fun. But being down there, viewing and swimming in the waterfall, is such a great experience. So beautiful!

Waterfall in Ubud. Our villa was a few minutes walk from Tegenungan Waterfall. There were uneven steps. Be mindful of the slippery/steep steps!
The water wasn't good for swimming when we went before 9am. There was nobody else then and I got proposed.
It's a memorable place ;)

Cool place!. I went to Tegenungan Waterfall in the rainy season and it didn't had that much water on it, but it was certainly refreshing to swim there, really enjoy the place, great to have a clean up with holy water.

Nice waterfall. We couldn't go swimming as it was too dangerous on the day. I have seen many waterfalls before, and it certainly is a nice one but at the same time didn't blow me away. Didn't mind the stairs though and one of the previous post said it was free, but we had to pay at a little booth at the carpark??? Wasn't much, I think 60,000 for the 8 of us. 5 of us went down, the other 3 stayed at the top and sat down somewhere at a table, but they said it stunk really bad and than they saw the shop owner throwing rubbish over the fence. When they looked, there was a whole pile of rubbish at the bottom. Very normal for Bali, but a shame to have that there. As usual many shops.

Pretty view but thats about it . We went with friends to the village and waterfall. Costs $1 to get in. About a 20 min walk down to the waterfall where you can swim or just have a look. Was too hot that day for me so i stayed up in the village and took in the view but the boys went for a trek. Said the stairs on the way up were killer. So maybe don't head down if you're not all that fit (like me lol).

Still waters run deep. On our way back to Kuta, my driver Jaya brought us to Tegenungan Waterfall, it is free for all that is not common in Bali. From the opposite side of the fall, there is a viewing terrace with several stalls attached so that you can take pictures from afar while enjoying your drinks. Many locals swim under the pouring waterfall, of course it is deep enough. The steps leading to the waterfall are steep. It is extremely difficult to climb up hundreds of steps after swimming, at least you are out of breath.

nice view. it's always nice for walking down with the stairs to reach this beautiful waterfall, but I am not suggest the people who got a problems with their legs, after you enjoy the view of the waterfall, you will need to go back upstairs with dozens (or maybe hundreds) of stairs :)

Short walk down to the falls. Cool and refreshing once you arrive down to the falls. We didn't think The hike back up was that difficult, but maybe for others it would be. Some of the stairs are quite steep and deep though.
OMG !!!. This Is OGM !! Absolutely beautiful !!!! so powerful !!I really miss to swimming in the river .. but next time...

An eventful break in the day. Some things you go to see are more adventurous than others. This is a break that is both beautiful, fun and a bit demanding. The waterfall can be seen from the oppositive side of the rift, so if you are tired or lazy stay there, buy a drink and don't bother straining yourself.BUT, if you do want to go down remember your swimming outfit, because it is both recommendable - and adviseable to take a quick dip in the pond created by the waterfall. The water is fresh and coldish and the coldness is definitely appreciated when walking the hundreds of steps UP again!Very nice break, some children with follow you begging you to buy things, but all in all a very nice break and something that is suitable for kids as well - at least as long as you feel that they are safe in the somewhat unsafe steps!
Beautiful waterfall!. Beautiful waterfall! Very popular watering hole with locals and tourists. Quite a few steep steps down and what goes down must come up, but totally worth the trip!

My first ever waterfall!!. i was quite enthralled with the site of this waterfall ... very nice although i think the water wasnt clean clear water coz my hair was so dry during and right after .. !! but the views and the lush greenery around it was enough to make me forget anything Highly recommended and there werent much steps going up and down to the waterfall It was a little bit crowded though , would have preferred it to be less so. we went right before sunset time and left 2 hrs later right before it got dark .. this place is reachable by scooters (we were staying next to ubud market). it was a 1 hr drive

Go before it gets crowded. This place is a bit of a tourist trap and I think it would have been much better a bit earlier in the morning before it gets too crowded. The waterfall itself is spectacular and definitely worth getting in for a swim. Ask a driver to take you on the way to somewhere, not worth a special trip.

The pictures are not deceptive. The waterfall is every bit as fun as it seems in the photos. It is relatively clean. Small entry fees is chargeable. The water does come down with a extreme force, but around the vortex, its fun to splash around.
Cool experience. There is definitely a correct way to go through the water and I wish that I had looked it up before hand. I tried to follow along but I'm sure that it was nowhere close to correct!

Well worth a visit. We did a day trip of just driving around looking at different thing we wouldn't normally do. The waterfalls were on of them. it is well worth a visit & only costs 10 000 Rupiah. But a warning, there are a large amount of steps to go do to get close to the waterfall, which isn't a problem until you have to go back up......

Beautiful waterfall to swim or just sit and look at. Spontaneously went to this waterfall and was glad we did. We didn't swim below the falls but would go back again to do so. Just sit above and drink a coconut and enjoy, A bit too crowded with tourists but I was one too!

Quick morning visit. Tegenungan waterfall was a nice quick visit from our ubud villa.The 6 of us (ages 4,7,8,35,40,65) went for an hour and a half as seldom do we have a chance to visit a large waterfall with shallow enough (at the time of our visit) water to stand under.Swam over with a 7 and then 8 year old holding my shoulders and was one of the highlights of our whole trip.Worth a visit but quite busy and lots of construction going on at the top of the stairs for touristy things.The stairs are there and steep but the three kids didn't seem to have too much of a problem with them asides from the littlest who needed a carry for some of the higher steps.
A lovely Waterfall. There are a lot of steps to climb down to see the waterfall but it was more than worth the trouble...

Awwwwwwww. This place is a gem, a must visit and absolutely not to be missed.
Prepare your legs for some stairs and take your bathing suit along cause it's the ultimate fun.
Great place with amazing scenery and we've had the best time
Good place nice atmosphere. This place have such a great beauty natural landscape. When I go there is very fresh atmosphere, many people go there to feel the nice relax vibe from this waterfall.

Best attraction in ubud. Best place in ubud , nice and green forest .
You will go down using long stairs , most difficult part when you come back but its worth it.
Entrance charges are minimal like free, 10000 IDR per person.
If you know how to swim then you can swim under waterfall , becarefull from slippery stones.

Sad to see 1 year later. I first visited these falls in Nov 2014 with a friend and loved the experience. Our taxi pulled up at what then was a basic shanty-style shop, we hopped out and stumbled down the rudimentary track. To get over to the falls we had to jump over stepping stones and cling to the side of the rocks, but once at the actual falls we were amazed by how beautiful they were and loved that the area was still quite untouched and were the only ones there. One year later I went back to the falls with my husband and was so shocked at how much had changed in just 12 months. There are several shops and so much construction at the top. So many people selling goods, and there is now a paid carpark cut into the earth. Hundreds of tourists were milling around and the walk down to the falls has been completely paved over so you just walk down concrete stairs to the base. At the actual falls there are people and rubbish everywhere, hawkers selling beer, that of course the tourists just throw where ever it lands. Overall it is dirty and not a nice place to be. It made me sad to see what was once so beautiful become just another exploited tourist trap.

Great waterfall. We went there on a not-so hot day and just after a day of rains. The water was muddy and we were hesitating to jump in or not.. but the temptation overtook our concern for the color.. wow! we had a great time spending the next hour and a half. The force of the water when it hits the ground is so awesome.. we went in and out a few times, but it was tricky as the force was pushing us down.. A must see place..
Water is not natural. We visited water fall tegenungan the view was oke..But the water brown colour and dirty because the water come from river is not natural water from mountain
great visit. Four of us went to this waterfall it is a great walk down a bit hard on the legs coming back up but worth it

Nice waterfall and good place to cool off. First off, yes there is a 10.000IDR entry fee as per most places. Yes there is a 3.000IDR fee to use the bathrooms. Yes there are shops and children trying their hardest to sell you stuff on the way in and out.But this is a nice place to come to on a hot day and cool off.Prepare to work hard on the way out with the couple hundred steps back to the top but any reasonably fit person should be fine.The waterfall itself has nothing on the pristine waterfalls in Tasmania and other areas of Australia but it is beautiful and was reasonably clean when we were there.Worth a visit to take some snaps and rinse off in the heat.

Don't miss it. Just wow, the location is a bit far from Kuta beach but it's worth the time spent on the road, there is a fee of 10,000 RP's for the entrance, before you head to the waterfall there is a small cafe with a great view looking over the valley where they sell everything from drinks to towels so no need to worry about anything, once you are ready you go down a really long stair which is maintained and clean half way through there is a small spring water and they say it's a holy water after that there is a 2 way to choose from, one will lead you to the waterfall and the other will take you to a small Hindu temple, I went straight to the waterfall as the weather was really hot around 39 or 40 C degree, once you reach the waterfall you will see the rainbow and the cold water will hit you in an amazing way, the water is freezing but it was perfect with such heat, the shore is filled with stones so be careful not to fall down, after you walk for a minuet in the water all the big stones are gone and it's only soft sand, the view is amazing and very relaxing , but be prepared for the trip back to the top I would suggest to spend at least an hour to have enough strength to go as it will hit you bad, not recommended for older people as the trip back is really hard.Enjoy

Beautiful waterfall. Beautiful waterfall, cheap entry. Lot of steps to get to it so be prepared! There was a little bit of trash around the rocks. A few kids begging for money at the entrance, but souvenir shops and food.
Beautiful day . This is a beautiful waterfall, mesmerizing watching and so many people jumping from the rock.It wss much deeper than our last trip here

Small waterfall but worth seeing. We visited this waterfall as part of a guided tour. To reach the waterfall, there is about a ten-minute walk down some steep steps, so a reasonable level of fitness is required. At the bottom of the steps is a little pebble beach and a wonderful waterfall. When we were there, the sun was in a place that made a rainbow through the flowing water. People had climbed to the top of the waterfall and were jumping into the pool beneath the waterfall. It is a small waterfall, but worth a visit. Allow around an hour to visit the attraction.
attractions. one of biggest waterfall in bali,is really nice view and dont need to far away to find this waterfall from the main road,we also can swimming is well there.

Amazed? Not really. The entrance fee is IDR10K per person. Its 10 minutes walk down to the waterfall. The water was a bit murky when i was there. Ive seen far more beautiful and serene waterfall compared to this. So nothing great about this waterfall, amazed? Not to us.

An oasis of such beauty!. A short drive from Ubud is this magnificent waterfall.So powerful yet serine, this is a must see if in this region.Be aware, there are about a hundred uneven steps confronting you. Don't let that put you off though. The exercise is a bonus... Take your bathers and enjoy one of life's wonders.
good to visit. Worth a visit if you are in the area but it is definably not one for a hot and humid day and you must be quite fit.
One of the best waterfalls to visit in Bali. One of the best waterfalls to visit in Bali. Nice views. Be prepared to pay an entrance feee of 10000 IR.

It's a waterfall. I don't want to burst anyone's bubbles but I was under-impressed with the waterfall. I've seen waterfalls in many places around the world and this one doesn't even come close to being something I want to remember (yes, I took only one photo after a long ride to get there). The town is using the waterfall as a means to draw tourism to the local village. Get ready for the tourist stalls selling all kinds of knick-knacks. Bring IDRs if you want to use the proper toilets/showers.

Beautiful place. Hired a private driver to drive us to this place. It is amazing place. There are a lot of tourists for sure, but it is worth it. It isn't free, but it is cheap to get in. The nature surrounding and the waterfall. You can go into the water and swim. Going down to the waterfall is easy. Once finished and need to walk up the stairs is tiresome. Just take your time. Also there are part of the trails that can be slippery. Just be careful. If you have little toddlers with you, this might not be a good place. The sun is hot in Feb, so bring sunscreens and liquid to re-hydrate.

Not to miss this Waterfalls in Bali. Not to miss this Waterfalls in Bali. Best one i came across. amazing scenic view. Not advisiable for family with small kids, as you have to get down around 300 hieght steps, So it tough for kids. it is worthy place.

amazing place. this is a very beautifull waterfall and has a beautifull surrounding. make sure you bring your swimming outfit and a towel because you can go swim at the waterfall. also going down there is not a problem, but going back up is awefull. there are a lot of stairs to climb. so if you have an injury on you legs or if you have a very bad condition i wouldnt recommend it.

Stairs and a toddler who demanded to be carried! ARGH!. We recently had this waterfall included in our day trip to Ubud. It was a stinking hot bali day. There were too many stairs to count and this was not a pleasant experience with toddler in tow who demanded to be carried. HOT HOT HOT!!!The waterfall itself is quite impressive but thats about it. If you have young children - give it a miss or maybe just look at the waterfall from the top!

Hidden gem. It may not remain a hidden gem much longer, but we were pleasantly surprised when we made it down to the waterfall! It's not huge, so bring your swimsuits so you can hop in and cool down before climbing the stairs back to the shops :) Really beautiful!

For nature lovers!!. So beautiful landscape! Ideal for nature lovers and great to spend some time there. there is not much to visit but that's good to spend some time there - you could stay and get food there.

Natural beauty being destroyed. A truly magnificent waterfall, although it's incredibly dismaying to see mounds of rubbish in the caves behind and also the whole way down the steep path. This is a problem all over Bali, but we noticed it even more here. The holy water pool near the temple at the bottom is really lovely. Beware getting in to swim at the waterfall, the rocks are difficult to walk on, you need good balance!

What a great time!. Such a nice place to visit!The stairs are really not anywhere near as bad as people are saying, you can make it up in 2minutes (literally).There's a few coffee shops and little market stalls.At the bottom of the falls there is even a guy with a cooler selling cold beers. Life guards on duty just incase.The water was lovely, not too cold. 10,000 entry per person which nobody can complain about. Is recommend arriving around 3pm if you don't o first thing. We were leaving around then and it was getting quiet on the people front. Great pictures and lovely memories!

Nice waterfall, but sweaty workout to get there. Nice place to see a waterfall. There are signs that said to not go in the water I think, but there were still a lot of people in the water. It's a lot of steps down and many steps up! I think the waterfalls in the north are better though.

Beautiful though a bit crowded. There's probably 150 to 200 steps all of varying heights, but even this not-so-fit lady managed them in the heat of the day.Bring water shoes or strap on sandals, the beach is very rocky. There were lots of tourists, but I don't think this is really a place you'd spend a whole day- an hour, tops. But with an entry fee of around $1, it's worth it.
fresh water ,and nice vew. hi gues ,if you have trev to bali. dont forgat come to tegenungan waterpool, so nice vew and a fresh water good if you like for swim.
Nice waterfall. A bit of a walk down It was raining on the morning I went so the water was quite muddy and mirky A nice spot though for taking some photos

Nothing special. We only had an hour time slot to spend here, and right as we got to the bottom and saw the waterfall, we realized it wasn't as great as we expected and turned right around. Unless you plan on spending most of your day there, playing in the water, drinking & relaxing, it isn't worth all the steps up and down.

Crowded yet beautiful!. I was surprised by how crowded this place was, I had pictured a much more remote and untouched kind of feel. But still definitely worth the trip out. Remember to bring a towel and your swimwear if you want to go for a dip. There is an entrance fee of 10,000 Rp. (less than 1$ US / 6,50 NOK). There is also many different warungs selling cold drinks, ice cream and the usual sarongs. There is quite a few steps so it's maybe not a good idea to go all the way down if you're not in the best shape, at least not when it's sunny. But you can still enjoy stunning views from the top in the shade.We spent quite some time trying to find this place. But the locals were very helpful pointing us in the right direction whenever we stopped by the side of the road. The drive from Ubud center was not too bad, just drive at your own speed. As with every attraction in Ubud I would try to go as early in the day as possible, to avoid the crowds usually arriving around noon.

Refreshing waterfall with lots of stairs. I like all natural beauties and waterfalls are on my favorite list. This is a medium sized waterfall but it is pretty nice. I would have preferred to go there when it is not that hot because reaching there and going up in hot weather is not a fun thing to do. I suggest to go there when it is cloudy.

Beautiful. Our driver suggested visiting Tegenungan Waterfall while transferring between resorts. We agreed and soon arrived. While this place is lovely the walk down is long and difficult for little kids and the walk up was pretty much impossible for our 1 and 3 year old. It was awesome to see the power of the waterfall and our 3 year old thought it was amazing. The amount of rubbish around was a bit gross and disappointing though.
