Gorgeous . We've arrived at midday. So it was scorching hot! The step is quite steep, so be careful. And it could be quite hard to back up again.The waterfall was huge. And the pool under waterfall is swimable. But no jumping from the cliff.

Strength of nature!. It's a waterfall! That's what you are going to see, and swim under! What else should you expect? I'm usually not the biggest fan of waterfalls, once you see one, you've seen it .. But swimming under this beauty.. Is something I will never forget!

Beautiful Waterfall!. My friend and i went to waterfall in the morning ! The street to get there was beautiful and green no traffic like Ubud. We walked up and down not so far you can see the beautiful view from the balcony in coffee shop near by.

Nice view. Tegenungan water fall is located in kemenuh, gianyar regency.With Nice panorama is a good place to visit, also for swimming. Around 30 minutes drive from Ubud. And 10 minutes walking down and 10 minutes walking up.

Nice swim to cool off. We made the trip to the waterfall on a rented motorbike, a nice ride through the country side from Ubud. After paying the entrance fee, we walked the 160 or so steps down to the bottom of the waterfall, being quite conscious that we would have to walk them UP again. I did not bring swimming trunks, but managed to pass my black underwear off as one, as I was determined not to pass up the opportunity to get into the cool pool at the bottom of the falls. Ah, the water was wonderful clean and oh so cool, a refreshing experience on a typical hot Bali day.
Well worth the effort!. Yes, it's a long way down, but so worth it when you get there to see this spectacular waterfall. There is a lifeguard on duty so if you want to swim you will feel safe.
amazing scenary view. Amazing scenary view and best waterfall in bali , been here few times and is a great landscape , suggest everyones to keep a day in bali tour here.

Great experience. I see a lot of people talk about the steps and hard work coming back up but it is well worth it. My partner and I are very unfit and managed it fine with just a stop or two. Swimming in the summer heat was a lovely treat.

Must see in Bali. Our tour taxi dropped us off at the village at the top of the waterfall where there were a few small shops. Could see the spectacular view from the top. We walked all the way down to the bottom of the huge waterfall down steep stairs. Very tiring but a refreshing swim and drink at the bottom is possible. We also went over a rickety bridge to the far side- be careful! On the way back up are some refreshing pools. Beautiful site, definite must see and entry is only about $1 AUD!

Rare experience. A good place to relax and soak in the fresh water. Do not that area is natural thus when walking rocks may dislodge. Rental of benches are available at IDR 20,000 however are limited with a complimentary towel(to return after use). If not sitting or placing yr items on the rocks will do.
waterfall ?. Nice to view from the hill, but a big effort needed to walk all the way down and back.You will need a beer by the time you get back to the carpark.
short trek to see a nice waterfall. like all Bali attractions, you have to pay upon entrance. But definitely worth the visit, as it is just s short trek away and the waterfall is quite majestic!
Best waterfall see in bali. is absolutely the best and great waterfall see in bali. The scenary is amzing and kids in the river make full happiness

Beautiful Falls and relaxation from the ehat. I visited here on a hot afternoon and it was a nice refreshing trip especially after wandering through the rice fields all day. The falls themselve were beautiful bigger thasn I expected but tha tmay have soemthing to do with recent rains. I expect it dries up at other times of the year. The pool below the falls offer a nice place to take a dip but on the way down there is a nice natural spring where locals bath. The water here is cool, refreshing and clean. A great place to cool down and refresh.

"Refreshing side attraction". On a trip to Ubud our tour guide decided it would be worth our while to see the Tegenungan Village Waterfall. It is found deep down in a valley--probably a couple of hundred steep and at times, narrow steps. The day we went it was raining off and on and so the steps and path were quite slippery so caution was definitely needed. However, in spite of this the view was very nice. The waterfall, while not large when compared to Niagara Falls, for example, was non the less very beautiful. The spray felt amazing and the coolness of the water below the falls was so refreshing. Many peple were swimming around and a few een under the falls. The entrance cost was only 10,000rupiah. Many little shops and cafes at the top of the valley to explore local crafts. Two hours is more than enough time to allow for a visit here.

Amazing. Beautiful Waterfall in beautiful valley.If your fit you can walk to the bottom of Valley and experience the Falls close up..even swim... Or you can sit in a Cafe area and just relax looking at the amazing view.

Wow, what a swimming hole!. This waterfall requires a small admission fee (as do the bathrooms at the top, so keep some smaller bills!) and lots of stairs down the cliff, but at the bottom the waterfall is spectacular! It's impossible to really swim directly into it, but so much fun trying! We had a group and would pull each other in as far as we could. I went first with a Balinese friend and another friend who lives in Jakarta, and we had the place almost to ourselves. We'd had a hard day's work, and found refreshment and renewal just standing by the falls and feeling the spray. It's a great way to spend an hour or two.

Nice view and splash around. We really enjoyed the waterfall; it was good for a few snaps, and quite exciting to feel the rush of the water in the plunge pool. The walk down can be pretty steep and slippery, so caution is advised. Apart from the waterfall, there's nothing much else there except for a few shops, cafes, toilets and showers. It makes for a nice stop, but nothing to stay too long for.

Beautiful cascade in Gianyar. Tegenungan also known as Kemenuh waterfall is a beautiful cascade in Gianyar, Ubud, Bali, Indonesia. To visit this place, we should pay entrance fee / park (relatively cheap). We can see the beautiful of Tegenungan waterfall from the top generally, but if we wanna see closer and more beautiful, we have to go down hundreds of stairs and pass several hurdles. After seeing Tegenungan waterfall closer, we need to go back, so we have to climb up hundreds of stairs, and climb up more difficult and more require energy than go down. All of this requires effort, but worth it!Tips : Best time to visit this place is dry (wet) season or on sunny day. Rainy day is not a recommended time to visit, it'll be slippery and more difficult.p.s. Check my Flickr to see photos of Bali and many more! I wrote my Flickr link on my TripAdvisor profile, just check it out if you interested :)
loved it. Great waterfall. Water was warm and fresh. There is space to just hang out or you can climb up for other views.

Refreshing stop. Good for a refreshing stop during your Bali tour. After a short walk from the parking space you reach a nice terrace from where you can admire the waterfall. However, to reach it, you have to go down into the walley. You can swim, or just admire the place. Climbing back up on the stairs might be tiring. Shops are available upstairs.

Beautiful pics not sure I'd swim here. This was our last stop on a day long tour of rice paddies and volcanoes. We really wanted to see a waterfall and this one is right next to town down an easy walk. 10.000idr donation. Long stair climb to the bottom. There is a muddy, rocky beach and a big pool one could swim in. The water was very brown and there was rubbish. Maybe it was BC of the recent rains but I did not feel water was clean to swim. There were 3 guys who were supposedly life guards watching over the beach. Lots of people climbed to the middle of the waterfall. No guard rails so be careful as it's slippery.

The countryside waterfall. While travelling to tegenungan waterfall, you can see the countryside farms, local people etc. At the waterfall you can have a bath, swim, and thrill under the forceful waterfall. The greenery surrounds everywhere and its a ultimate place to visit in Bali.
Great view, beautiful falls. Really nice waterfall, loved that you could hike up the side and get some pictures from the top as the water rushed down beside you.

Great for an hour or two. Maybe not one to take too much time travelling to but as we did it as part of a long day out we were happy to have been.Not the biggest waterfall in Bali but impressive non the less, entrance fee was very small but the cafes there were a little pricey

Great for a short visit. I thoroughly enjoyed the waterfall. There were plenty of services (and touts) at the top of the stairs, then the long stairs down, then the beautiful waterfall and river at the bottom. The local friend who took me also showed me the sacred holy water site, and we walked right up next to the waterfall.Unless you want to swim, it's probably a short visit, but quite enjoyable.

Out of the way, and off the tourist mainline. Took ourselves here on scooters, was a good day out in Ubud. Swam in the falls - bit of rubbish in the water. Changing rooms adequate but primitive - but I'm good with that. Something a bit different.
Definitely a waterfall to stop and admire. Definitely a waterfall to stop and admire. Redevelopments have made this space easily accessible. A beautiful experience.

Nice and cool. This is a very nice place with a quite large waterfall coming down from 20m. It's a walk(10min) but steep steps, so it's warm to go up all stairs.... Bring swimsuit if you have the time, it is nice.

FUN !. was really fun, cause i do really love nature, quite nice, just play there. with my friends.
bisa mandi, berenang dan main air !

Breathtaking Waterfall. Super crowded but this waterfall is worth the visit.
So many tourists (including us!) but it's a picturesque place. You can climb to the top and enjoy looking down if you're game.
A great day out for all ages! Would recommend.
Nice place to stay for the day, just bring lunch and you're set!

Much more powerful than the pictures.. We went to the falls today in the rain. Rain had been falling most of the night and all morning before we arrived. The volume of water was probably 4 times that in most pictures I have seen. The water was very muddy instead of clear as in the pictures. I would say even with the brown water the falls was very beautiful and powerful. Certainly worth the trip and the 10,000 rupiah per person admission. Like I said it was raining so there were not very many people at the venue. That made it easy to move around and get different vantage points on the falls and the river.

Refreshing in Bali heat. The Tegenungan waterfall is 16 km or 30 minutes drive away from Ubud. Interestingly it is not on a highland like other waterfalls in Bali. It rescued us from the scorching Sun. We went around 1pm and it was heavily crowded mostly by local youngsters. Go early in the morning or late in the afternoon to beat the crowd. The steps while going back could be exhausting for unfit ot elderly. You can rest after few intervals. The water is not clean as I read in reviews before I went bit it's you can swim. Entry fee is 10000pp.

Nice scenery. Went there with friends..we had orepared because one of our friends mentioned there are steps to go down to see the waterfall from up close...if steps going down means it will be going up all the way when we are return.Too bad the water not as clear as we expected..but the water is so nice to soak our feet in humid weather..

Picturesque. A magnificent view from the top, then a steep 3-5 minute walk to the falls. Careful if you are elderly. This short drop fall pumps out an incredible volume of water. Bring you togs and towel if you want to swim. You can walk to the top of the falls but it is slippery and only has a rickety bamboo rail in a couple of places.
Touristy but attractive. We didn't go down to the waterfall as the water looked dirty but enjoyed the view from the restaurant above it.
Beautiful location. Beautiful location, stunning waterfall. There are a lot of steps so, be sure you are fit enough for climbing.
Wonderful, hot and humid. Stop by, admire the views, go down to the waterfall. Be careful about the way up - save some energy :-)

A cool day out. The walk down to the waterfall was a bit of a hike, as is the trip back, I would not suggest this visit for people who have a bit of trouble with walking up and down uneven ground.
For everyone else you will enjoy the experience of sitting under a waterfall.

Morning starts . As we were staying in Seminyak we booked a tour through a company called Bali golden tours. It was an hour drive out to the waterfall however we arrived about 9.30am and the sun was already quiet warm. However there probably was only 4 other people at the waterfall. We were able to get some pictures and a swim. We left about 10.30 and it was already getting very busy! From what I've heard the waterfall is best to visit during the other half of the year due to the season. I'd recommend bringing a spare set of clothes if your swimming, bringing some towels and some lunch and enjoying it down there. You can walk up and look from halfway down the waterfall and you can walk down further along the stream. There are quiet a few steps and it would be very difficult for elderly to get up or down. The water is considered sacred and as its fresh water your skin becomes very smooth and soft the next day.
Beautiful waterfall very close to Ubud. This is a very pretty waterfall with lots of steps of course. Was so close to Ubud only ten minutes on a scooter.

Visit around 3pm-4pm to avoid the crowd. This place is amazing to just chill out and relax. There are a lot more locals than tourists here which makes this place more interesting. No jumping down the waterfall, but I've seen locals doing that!
Waterfalls terenungan. Easy walk and great pay off . It is suitable even for the lazy types but great for pictures . The accces is by public bus o scooter and 30 minutes walk , no entrance fee .

Beautiful waterfall and scenery. Hired a scooter and drove from Ubud to the waterfall. Well worth it! quite a climb down (and then up again!!) so only suitable to those reasonably fit and able bodied. but breath taking views even if you don't go all the way down to the bottom of the water fall.I was alone but it was safe enough to leave my things at the edge of the water and have a swim. Little bar area at the top to have a drink and admire the amazing surroundings.

A must visit if you nearby. Very easy to access. Just had to pay the entrance fee. The steps wasn't that bad as mentioned in other reviews. Just walk down and up slowly its no problem at all. The lifeguards were friendly too. Great visit especially during hot weather.

OMG THIS IS HEAVEN'S SHOWER!. My friends who are studying in Bali took me here.One hour's drive. 10k entrance fee.Quite a walk downhill. My friends said the first time she came, they didn't have cement roads and stairs. They had to trek through the river and coz of that, her friend refused to continue and didn't reach the waterfall (although not a long way though)This waterfall has rainbow when the sun is up, don't have to adjust your camera angle to get the rainbow, it is always there. Sometimes a double rainbow!The water falls so hard. We tried to go into the falls but the current was too strong. My friend's boyfriend had to drag me into it. And we endured the water falls and tried to come out from the water veil but it was too strong and I got pushed downwards.Damn, most dangerous adventure ever!The waterfall is famous because it is nearest to Denpasar and it has rainbows and breathtaking greenery. Thus, expect a crowd.I uploaded a photo of the beautiful girl taken by my friend. We were sitting on rocks and then this lady was in front of us so we took pictures of her, and voila, an unsuspected masterpiece is produced. It was as though she posed for us. My friends asked me if we stole it from google hahaha! She makes no effort in being beautiful. A true natural beauty.(P.S : See the rainbow in the pic, it is always there, my friend says by 4pm, it will move to the middle of the waterfall)

Pretty but packed . The stairs are basically vertical and there was limited space for you to swim because there's so many people cramped in like sardines, got here and left almost straight away. It would be a nice spot if there weren't so many people.

Go swim in the waterfall. Place is abit dirty, and the stairs are steep to climb (especially ascending back to the beginning). Was quite tiring for the family to climb even though we're all young and fit (except my mum). The waterfall is quite fun to swim in, but it's really very crowded, and it littered with rubbish. Entrance fee is 10,000 rupiah.

So good . This place was cool, so much water companies no over the top, you try to swim under it and keep getting pushed away. Dunno when the flow recedes or gets heavy though. Seasons etc. Really fun though. Can be crowded
Nice, but not as spectacular as expected. It was nice! However, the stairs are difficult to take, especially in the heat. Don't forget your swimming gear.

Visit if staying in or going near Ubud. We had just done the white water rafting and was expecting another torture of stairs, this waterfall isn't far away from the carpark and the stairs were very good. Went for a swim and found that very refreshing, would've been great to have some privacy, but we were there around lunch so if you prefer less crowded go early or late.

The hidden waterfall near Ubud. Tegenungan waterfall lies at Tegenungan Village, approx. 5 kilometers, south east Ubud. Bali has a selection of waterfalls that are fun to visit. I come to this place 3 times, first time few years ago when there was no toilets, not many peoples knows this place and still not many seller, I mean still origin. But that's was beautiful. Now, there already have tickets, and build some facilities near waterfall. I hope peoples there can keep the place nature and no rubbish, please for visitor keep clean that beautiful place and don't let your mineral bottle thereThis place also good for hiking through the jungle to a hidden waterfall and taking a cooling swim is the image of paradise.

Powerful Waterfall !. Very nice moment shared with kids ! You need to be in good health because of the stairs but it is a very good experience.Nice path behind trees leads to the spot and tiny bridges. The waterfall is very powerful and it is amazing when you are next to it. My advice is to have water shoes (like surfers use for reef beaches) because of stones.

cool waterfall but dirty. great views and very pretty but the location is kind of dirty. it is also fairly busy. If it is close to your location then it is worth the trip and 10k ruppia but only really spent an hour there

Nice waterfall. I came here with a group of 7 all fit and healthy the stairs on the way up are very steep and hard I would recommend this to people with good fitness/health otherwise you will be in for stair hell. The waterfall is lovely but it isn't the cleanest I would not drink the water if you go for a swim! Lots of bits and pieces floating around. Also be careful with belongings we saw some balinise kids 4 in total lingering near our bags blocking them so we couldn't see our stuff. Who knows it may have been innocent but I would be safe just in case.

Beautiful Waterfall!. We enjoyed a little walk through the nature towards the waterfall. Great place to visit either as a couple or with the family. There is lots of Warungs around too for you to enjoy food and refreshing drinks.

Beautiful. Beautiful waterfall, the scenery before going down is spectacular. Teenagers loved swimming here.Coming back up is a bit of a hike especially in hot humid weather, husband counted around 219 steps leading up and out, elderly would have to take their time.Plenty of places for a cold drink when you get to the top and the gelato is excellent.

So beautiful!!!!. This was absolutely amazing. We went at around 5 PM, where there were hardly any tourists and many locals. There was even a rainbow above the waterfall as we were leaving. I think this is the most beautiful experience i've had in my whole life, just magical

Underwhelming. A steep walk to get down and back up, so elderly and less able people beware! The waterfall itself is somewhat underwhelming. It seems a popular spot with the locals, who come here with a packed lunch and make a day of it.

Nice place to visit if you live somewhere near. This place is nice, you could swim in this waterfall but I would not recommend this place if you you are going to spend few hours on a way to it. If you live in Ubud it will be very easy to visit it.
Beautiful waterfall. I got there early to avoid the heat as there are a lot of stairs back up to the car park. The temple there is nothing to look at but the waterfall was really nice

Waterfall is very scenic, and you can swim at the bottom of it.. Impressive Waterfall is very scenic, viewed from distance you can sit at shops and look at the vista. Be warned that the steps to get down to it are very steep, with a huge drop of up to 1 1/2 feet on some steps.. these are very dangerous steps and take some navigating.. once done however, they reward of the cool waterfall is well worth the trouble.
Nice waterfall.. We went to swim for a bit. Long walk down and up so need to be fine with mobility. Nice water to swim. Pretty scene and good way to cool off.

Too crowded. Too crowded and that's it. We had to ran away from the crowd and walked a bit higher but still too many people at a small spot. It was okay but I've seen better and more beautiful waterfalls here in Bali.

Beautiful waterfall. Be prepared for a short adventure trip. Carry a change of clothes and towels if you wish to splash in the waterfall. Towels and lounge chairs are available for rent. You can also buy some clothes at the waterfall itself. There are ~200 steps and slippery steps also so exercise caution.
happening spot!. the places is very beautiful but too much people and couldn't enjoy more. nice place to hangout.brng your swimsuit and towel otherwise you will regret.

Crowded and hot walk!. Probably a good idea to get here early! don't forget your bathing suit because you will want to swim just so you can be cool for the long walk back up! And DO NOT swallow the water.Tip - go to the Holy Spring for a dip as well, instead of heading up the stairs, go a little further along past the restaurant and there they are. We were able to swim in here all on our own.

Waterfall. We visited this waterfall in December. We were four (two adults and two kids). We all liked the place. Don't forget your swim clothes as it is a good place for refreshing!!!!. There are some steps to reach the place but it is worthy.

A little busy but great waterfall. We visited in January (wet season) and was fantastic but obviously not sure if this is as good other times of year. Don't forget your swim stuff as there is plenty of space to enjoy the water. It is quite a lot of steps down which is not a problem until you want to leave so take water!!
amazing with big water. I am very happy with the wonders of waterfalls, really great divine creation. extremely well there visiting with family. cool and very natural.

Waterfall!. Tegenungan waterfall is very beautiful and not far from Ubud. It's about a 15 minutes motor bike ride. With it being so close to the city though it does get crowded there. Especially about midday. It's still worth a trip to go see though with it being so close by the city.

many people there. I ended up just going to the top taking a photo and leaving. The crowds were too much. We paid a small fee which is ok but it felt like a restricted tourist destination rather than a beautiful place to enjoy.
Quiet good. A very hot day so not so easy to walk up and down to it.A typical waterfall and gave some cool soothing vapours from it.Good to see it had a life guard????
scenic waterfall. One of the nicest waterfall in Bali is Tegenungan waterfall. Big parking , nice staff, and good for bathing , the way to get close to the waterfall is quite narrow so becarefull

Just wonderful!. This waterfall is one of the most popular destination and are fun to visit in Ubud. about 30 minutes drive from Tegallalang rice terraces. It is located at Tegenungan village and is surrounded by lush green and nature plantation. There are many steps go down to the river if you would like to see the waterfall closer. It is perfect for swimming and enjoying the fresh water under the sun.

Beautiful views. Lovely waterfall. The small cafe at the bottom had amazing $1 lunches that were just what we wanted for lunch, not too big and very tasty. We didn't swim as we didn't have our swim suits, but the water looked reasonably clean.

Simple pleasures. Small and located at a comfortable corner where you can spend a quiet time meditating behind the waterfalls. Come early in the morning before the crowds and if you can, take a scooter here. loved the view on the way to the waterfall as well as the villages.
close from ubud center. very beautiful close to Ubud center,, cheap admission rainy season the water is brown,, stairs were very much but fun

Not impressed. Me and my boyfriend went here in december 2015. We were not impressed.. It was dirty everywhere of trash lying around, even the water was dirty. It was also crowded with people and salesmen who were very annoing.
Stunning. Don't forget you swimmers, icy cold water but really lovely swimming in this lovely environment. There are markets and places to eat close by
Bit filthy and muddy. This was my least favourite thing we've done in Bali. The drive through the villages made the trip worthwhile.

Forceful currents yet stunning. We visited the Tegenungan waterfall on Dec 2015. Prior to my husband's ankle injury, we couldn't go down the stairs to go for a dip. The currents seemed powerful at that time, yet enticing. We might go again in the future, if we had the opportunity.

A refreshing dip amongst the sanitary pads.... The waterfall itself is impressive, but the river is full of rubbish - a situation which desperately needs to be addressed in Bali. This place is great if you want to go swimming amongst the sanitary pads (yep, I saw them washed around the riverbed). I don't think it's worth the many many steps down to see it close up and if you don't intend to swim, stay at the top and see it from there.

Beautiful waterfall . Went there 2 days ago, it was raining season, therefore the water color is yellowish Once reach the bottom of the river, there is a small pond of holly water on right side. Don't miss this beautiful place. It was so nice soaking inside small pool, the water is so refreshing Ticket for local is 5,000; domestic is 10,000: foreigner is 20,000

Lovely and refreshing. My partner and I went here after a long day of travelling around Ubud and it was a delight to immerse into that refreshing water. There are lots of steps to get down to the waterfall but it was worth it. There are lots of stones and rocks, however, so it would have been a good idea to take sea shoes to protect your feet, even though we didn't have any problems. There isn't anywhere to get changed once you get down to the waterfall, although my partner and I managed with strategic towel holding haha. There are toilets on the way down there in cafes but they charge approx. 3k, if you did want somewhere to get changed. I remember seeing somewhere offer showers for a price too but I can't remember how much. We walked back up in our swimwear with towels wrapped around us and hopped onto our moped to dry off on the ride back.There are plenty of vendors/cafes selling food/clothes etc around there and it cost us 10k each to get in, if I remember correctly.

Small but beautiful. we visited this water fall as part of our tour itinerary. We get there at 3 pm and there were not many tourists around, so we can take many good photos without people hanging around. You can see the beautiful view of this waterfall from the distance and walk down few stairs to get to it. There is also a path you can climb to reach the top and make good photos. I forgot to bring my bathing suit.

Refreshing waterfalls. For those who wish to see a waterfall up close and feel the thundering water down your body, this waterfall is great for that. Be prepared for the walking up the stairs once you are done with the waterfall as it can get quite tiring. The views are amazing and the water was rather fresh.
Small Waterfall. Small waterfall about 500 feets from the top to get button, nice area but now many shop offer traditional product.
great place to swim when it's hot. Half an hour from ubud with the bike, great swimming under the waterfal if you dare :) have been visiting a few times

Nice waterfall. First of all we didn't expect to visit this waterfall. But when we check by Google Maps, we decided to go for this waterfall. Overall it's very standard tourism object. There is no handrail for steps down below. Walking path not yet working on it. There is lifeguard on duty but only 1 person. We choose not to take a bath in here.

Great place, if you know you can swim there!. Great place to visit but only if you're prepared to swim. Our driver didn't tell us this so it was a long walk for a pretty view but not worth it without a dip. If you were prepared to swim, pretty darn cool. There are drink & snack vendors, as well as ones selling normal Bali stuff. Take a towel and jump in.

Perfect . Highlight of our trip was our visit to this beautiful waterfall. Unlike the more popular Gitgit waterfall the walk to the waterfall is very short, yet still feels quite secluded. Highly recommended

Come for a splish. Come for a splash.. An absolutely exquisite Waterfall hidden away to the south of Ubud city. This tranquil location will not only calm the senses but also refresh you for the climb back up. Not to be missed while you are here in Ubud!Don't swallow the water (even by accident) - two of our friends got Cholera from it.

Favorite destination . Im here twice, both of them give as much satisfaction as the other, equally. The place good, facilities good, clean, the water clean, so fresh!You can swim or you can just soak yourself into the water and relax

Worth a visit. It's touristic, there is quite a lot of trash in and around the water, but it's still worth to visit. It's a beautiful place to look at from a distance and also good for swimming. you can stand under the waterfall. Feels like a very strong neck and shoulder massage haha

Magical scenery. One of the many waterfalls in Bali,we wanted to go to Gitgit initially but considering the distance from Kuta the place where we stayed we skipped it and chose Tegenungan instead.The view is amazing even from uphill.There are a few cafes and shops where you can sip a drink and enjoy the view.We climbed down around 200 steps to reach the waterfall but the experience is fantastic.Its a steep climb uphill but if you really need some good pics I would recommed going to the foot of the fall.The ticket price is cheap around 10000 IDR.There is a good gelato shop nearby perfect to cleanse you after your climb uphill.

Nice swim in the waterfall . Rent a scooter and drive there by yourself, there is a small entrance fee to get to the waterfall. It was a lot bigger then I thought it would be. To get to the waterfall you have to walk down the stairs but it's worth it so you can swim in the waterfall. It's so powerful and you can really feel the current in the water when you are swimming.

Worth the visit. Other reviews cover the same points I do, yes there are a number of stairs to deal with. There are plenty of people around. There is construction but it is still a good place to visit.

Very pleasant to view from a distance. About 2.5km from the main market (Pasar Seni) in Sukawati, in a north easterly direction.Entrance fee is IDR10,000 if I recall correctly.We actually didnt go down to the water fall itself. Rather we just admired it from one of the restaurants at the top, along with a cool beer! The view is very pleasant.Lots of people did go down to have a splash around in the pool under the falls.

Beautiful waterfall but really busy. This waterfall is absolutely beautiful and the water is nice and refreshing. There are lots of tourists here as it is quite easy to get to either by scooter or hired driver. If you are short on time in Ubud then this is a great place to go, but if you have some time spare Nung Nung Waterfall is much more impressive!

Could be a beautiful spot. We visited Tegenungan Falls for a short walk and swim. This location could be beautiful but walkway is currently under construction. There is a steep set of stairs leading you down to falls, steps are steep at times and uneven. There is alot of garbage on the ground around this area, and the river is used as a bathing ground for the locals. Water levels were quite low as the rainy seasons hasn't started yet making the swimming area quite shallow, small and crowded, sharp rocks underfoot in the swimming area made swimming undesirable.

Great to visit for an experience and a soaking:). We had a driver from the hotel who took us to see the Tegenunan Waterfall, a temple and a rice field. The waterfall was great - it is a basic attraction - there are a couple of stalls and some drinks/food is available. It is popular and there are a significant number of steps down and .... back up again!. It was great to soak in the waterfall as it cascaded down. Worth the trip for a different experience.

Excellent Water fall. Tegenungan Water Fall is a must visit place if you go to Ubud, Bali. The Volume of the water is high and the view point of the fall is accurate from where you can see the water fall clearly. Even if you walk a kilometer from the view point, you can take bath also into the fall, but that is quite risky specially if you are with your family. Good place to visit with Goa Gajah & Holy Spring Water spot.
Amazing . We had so much fun here it was absolutely stunning! You can go swimming at the bottom of the fall which was very refreshing. It's not too far away either :)

Good Waterfall. Its a small but beautiful waterfall , the sound is soothing and gives a music to ears.You can either walk close to waterfall to take a shower or stay far and view it from a shop sipping a coconut water.

Good place to enjoy water on your own. We were surprised with the view and had lots of fun on our own with being worried about mishaps. The water is about 5-6 ft deep and one can stand right under the falls if you can take the pressure. Had a wonderful day. The only hitch would be that one has to climb down about 100 + steps to reach the falls and climb up after all the fun. It can be a little tiring.

my first rafting. just loved the experience...it was amazing. to get down there to the ayung river was pretty tuff, but it was totally worth it. the rafting was totally for beginners and i could see a lot of family with small kids. along the way you can admire the beauties of bali, see monkeys and feel the peace that only nature can provide, its also lots of fun...they have some small places where u can buy drinks along the way, and it felt amazing to have a cold bitang beer chilling out beside the river.

Panoramic View. Tegenungan Waterfall nestled in the beauty nature of Gianyar Regency, very close to Ubud and quite easy to reach. I suggest you to go there at around 4pm where the you can experience the rainbow as the result from the sunlight which is broke by the droplets.

wonderful place. easy to get to. plenty signage. 30 mins south of ubud. steep stairs but safe. remember you have to go back upstairs to get back to carpark. spectacular falls and you can swim there or climb the track to the top of falls.

Nothing I've ever seen before. We (about 18 people) visited the waterfall. It was a bit crowded when we went, but there weren't that many people in the water. Sitting under the dropping water was a great experience. You can also go upstairs and admire the scenery, however, the path can be slightly slippery in some ares. It's important that I let you know, before getting to the waterfall, you have to go down a lot of stairs and it is the only way back as well.

Power of nature!. One afternoon in August, we (a couple) visited Tegenungan Waterfall. At first, there was no one, so we could enjoy the place while being alone. Later, more and more people came, so we needed to move up the stairs to the top of the waterfall to get some private moments.On the top, the view to the dropping water combined with plants around was amazing. At some point, we could feel being lost in nature. Even that it was a bit dangerous to stand on the edge of the cliff to observe surroundings, it was definately worth it in order to feel how powerful nature is in contrast to those little tourists down there!

The Wow Place in Gianyar ! . As with other natural attractions, it also requires us to exercise unconsciously (running enough to burn 100 calories) in addition to the road to tourist objects. We also have to pass a little bamboo bridge swaying and certainly a little spur adrenali. But it's not just if you want to enjoy the natural scenery from a height, you have to climb a path which sometimes can be slippery so be careful and hold onto the bamboo that has been installed alongside a road. Having tired and spur adrenali then we can feel the paradise of heaven. Bali has always had a beautiful place. I'm very grateful to be born on the island of God
Sunrise at the waterfall. They were putting in new bridges and stairs so a bit of construction work but a beautiful place to watch the sunrise

Dangerous Waterfall. there coming dead dogs and sticks from the top. Really No JOKE. Dangerous Waterfall. there coming dead dogs and sticks from the top. Really No JOKE. the view was amazing, but dont go directly under the waterfall you can die from it. and you have to pay for it . its not free!!!!
Cool View. On a really hot day, it is nice to look at a cool waterfall. I chose to view it from an outlook rather than hike up the trail in the heat. The area is beautiful and the people so friendly.

Rented a bike a drove there. We rented a motorbike and drove from central ubud to the waterfall. Easy drive traffic is a bit bad compared to most western countries. Cost an additional 5000 to park there. I would advise not buying things there as its quite the tourist trap and things will be 2-3 times more expensive. The waterfall is quite amazing going back up the steps will take some effort but we'll worth it. There are quite a few tourists there so if you want to get some nice photos you should probably get there in the early morning.

Very nice waterfall.. Very nice waterfall. Not a long walk down to it but it has some serious steps.not for the frail.
Has a little shop at the bottom.
The water is very clean for bali
Our private driver was from blue horizon tours. It cost 500,000 rp for the car for the hole day. We did 4 stops that day.
Beautiful, magical place. Worth the trip here must take your bathers for a waterfall massage. It's a bit of a walk so take your shoes

Fantastic Trip. From Ubud we just took a driver to get to the waterfall. Car drive took us round about 30 min. The waterfall was absolutely nice. You pay a little money to get there but already the view to the waterfall was worth it. Swimming was possible and made much fun
Beautiful place!. Great place to see and enjoy on the water. Excellent to water massage your back. Spent at least 2 hours and take swimwear with you.

Early Rise. We managed to get to the waterfall early in the morning, while the sun was just coming up from behind the palm trees and there were no other tourists just yet. This is such a peaceful spot and definitely worth the early trip. The waterfall is so powerful, you need to swim in to feel its strength, so no matter what bring something to swim in! After about an hour or so alone soaking up the quiet, the crowds started coming in and it was happy snappers all around. Get there early is my best advise to fully enjoy the splendor.

Went and it was pretty boring.. It was not a great thing to see and it was not really that great. If you did go, it is a bit of the beaten track so not really that many people around and it allows you time to sit and relax.

Must-do in Ubud!. One of the highlights of my trip was visiting this waterfall and swimming underneath it. Was sooo good, I will recommend to all going to Bali. Lots of steps though, so take it slow, and not well suited if you have mobility issues. Perfect for couples and families, I used the private bathrooms at the top, very cool but you will have to pay 3k-5k to use. All in all, definitely worth your precious time.

Nice waterfall. Tegenungan waterfall is quite nice. Steep walk down the bottom but definitely worth the view. The water is a bit dirty at the moment as they're doing some construction work. The current is quite strong so it makes it hard to swim for a long time.
Nice to visit. This is reached by quite a steep walk down but once there very pretty. Try to go early or later in the day as it is very hot midday.

Very nice!. The waterfall was bigger than expected, however was worth the walk. The most unpleasant part were the stairs to get to it, which were very uneven in size and height and on the way up can be a little too much for a morning walk.

Amazing waterfall . This waterfall is amazing! You can stand right underneath it and swim in it.
Approx 100 steps down to the waterfall but definitely worth it!!
Some snack type food available at waterfall also.
Nice falls, too many people . This is definitely on the tourist trail so was really busy meaning you cannot fully enjoy the beauty of the falls. Still nice though

Perfect Waterfall. We love how the waterfall drops. Beautiful! Wide waterfall. Some advice before going dwn better enter restroom located on top. Be it to change to ur swimwear. As dwn there has no toilet. Getting dwn there takes u few minutes but getting up back Woahh can be tiring for some. Not encourage for bringing kids along as the steps can be really tiring for them or perhaps tiring for some as to carry them up back. Went to the upper level to get a closer look at e waterfall, again its tiring and can be slippery. Just beware. Enjoyed being there just making myself calm.

Another nice waterfall. The waterfall looks nice but there are many people and souvenier sellers around.Efore you walk down there are some restaurants with a good view on the waterfall. So if you don't like or can walk down and up many stairs just enjoy the view from teraces of the small restaurants.

Beautiful place. Very beautiful place located not far from Ubud city, easy to get there by car. There's some stairs to get up and down if you want to get a good look at the waterfall; not recommended for those with bad legs, but no problem at all if you're just normal fit! It's very mezmerizing and I would recommend a trip to this waterfall if you are near by!

Peace of paradise. although I have been to so many waterfalls, this one was quite uniqe to me. mainly because you can easily and safely swim under the waterfall and take a natural shower dropping from a 30 meters ( more or less) height. It was a pity that we hot there Quite late and when sun was going down. so I didn't get to swim there . remember to take your swimming stuff with you when you take the ubud tour and ask the driver to take you to the waterfall before 4 o'clock. bear in mind that you have to take around 200 sharp stairs , if don't gave issues with that don't miss this place

Stunning fall!. I love the waterfall! It was breath taking. My hubby and I really enjoyed the walk down to the water. Walking back up is a little tiring. If you have kids you need to make sure they have the energy to walk!
Beautiful Spot. Was busy being the public holiday but got there early so wasn't an issue and weather was great. View was just beautiful

Great Landscapes. Just driving through the outer areas of Ubud, Kintamani, and near by areas provides a great diversity of ecology - rivers, deep gorges, hillside building, agriculture (rice, Soya, gardens, greens, etc).
Awesome Waterfall. We went to the waterfall on a tour. The waterfall is amazing. It is a great place to swim and is very relaxing. It is also quite shallow in some spots for little kids.

Felt blessed below your falls. Just back from Tegenungan waterfall yesterday. Tegenungan is a part of Kemenuh village, Sukawati the region of Gianyar. Its a natur waterfall with great scenery surrounding. This waterfall really easy to reach. If you ride from kuta, After big baby statue of Sukawati area, take the right then straight till found intersection. Take a right side again with sign "Tegenungan waterfall". At this time, this place also improve the facilities. So, no doubt to come here!
Great place. Been here many time,closest waterfall from Legian or Seminyak. Located at KemenuhGianyar on the way to Ubud. Most recommended, ask your guide to visit Tegenungan waterfall

Stunning view!. The drive from cangu (where we stay at) is quite long because of the traffic. But once u get there, the view is just stunning! The water is nice and warm. Behind the waterfall are little caves that are littered with trash though...

Lovely tranquil place to visit. My husband and I visited Tegenungan waterfall in the late afternoon, and it was the last stop on a private day tour that we took. It is a lovely spot and we enjoyed the view and vibe of the place. Because it was late in the day it was a little chilly to take a dip so if we visited again we would probably visit earlier and take a change of clothes. There are a few steps down (5-10 minutes duration) to the waterfall however it is worth the hike... It's just the climb back up that is the challenging bit (although we were passed by a fit 90+ Balinese man who didn't seem to mind it). Enjoyed this spot alot
Great place to get wet. Nearest waterfall from Denpasar city which have a great white water and exotic angle to get a nice photo. The ticket only idr 10.000 and parking idr 5.000
Must go. Be prepared for the stairs, i recommend you to go in the morning othervise will be very hot to walk.Bring your gopro :)

Superb waterfall. The waterfall is amazing and have stunning views all along the way from top till you reach there. It's flowing almost all the year round and contains lot of water. It might be very tiring to climb back up in day time , so one should find either early morning or evening to visit here. You will fond lot of people taking a swim / bath under the waterfall and it's worth it.
Lovely waterfall. Lovely waterfall, lovely quick dip. But watch out with the cafes at the top. Make sure you ask about the price before picking anything up.

Great view. The view is breathtaking, you can see the waterfall from above surrounded by the trees, we highly recommend that you take the stairs and go all the way down next to the waterfall where you can actually swim. One of the best experiences in my life...

Lovely afternoon swimming. Our driver took us to this waterfall at our request, entrance was around 10 thousand rupiah per person, but our driver got us a discount. We walked down to the falls, yes there are a few steps, but our 4 and 5 year old did it ok. The waterfall itself is very impressive, absolutely huge! The water for some reason is quite shallow, so our girls enjoyed splashing around and my husband took them as close to the falls as he could get.I would recommend this waterfall to anyone going to Bali, it's a sight to see, and a lovely place for a swim and some picture taking.

Amazing waterfall. Entrance is 10K per person, parking is 5K. There are several souvenir shops at the parking lot. You then head down a long flight of high stone steps to the waterfall. The waterfall is spectacular I saw many tourists taking a dip in the pool. You can also rent deckchairs.

Great waterfall. My wife and I went to this waterfall and we loved it. You can even have a swim if you like. The waterfall itself is a site to see. You can get really close to it which realky make the experience.

Beautiful hidden waterfall!. If you are staying in ubud, this is a must see. About half an hours drive from ubud town, this place is easily found with the help of gps, as there are no signs on the road to help you with directions. We visited the waterfall in the afternoon, to find quite a few people there. Its beautiful and we were lucky to see a rainbow right across the waterfall. Its fairly shallow so many get into the water to play. There are 170 steps down to reach, but climbing back up will sweat you out, as the steps are quite high. However once up there are toilets and a shower room for a small charge if required. There was some construction happening at a lower level near the fall which looked like toilets, so maybe by Nov'15, one wouldnt have to climb all the way back up to change after a swim. Overall its a lovely place to relax, sit on the rocks with feet in the water and enjoy the view. Worth a trip if staying or passing by Ubud.

not that near from Ubud. i like this place for a cup of coffee on the waroengs on top. They serve local coffee, not the best coffee but has its distinct over burnt taste. The stairs to the waterfall is rather long and after that long and steep stairs, we need to do some acrobatic moves to get there

Tegenungan Waterfall . Amazing view and experience! Definitely worth the trip! Going down the stairs is exciting to get to the waterfall, but going back up is a little bit rough, but still worth it for that view and dip in the fresh waterfall water. I also anticipated being able to stay there a bit longer but the water is shallow so it's more of a stop on the way to a few destinations!

Pretty spot to rest and meditate.. Lovely, but steep and slippery to get to. Worth the climb, if you are physically fit. Take off your shoes at the waterfall and relax while wading or dipping in the water..

Spectacular nature close to Ubud!. We went to the waterfall with our scooters and even though the place was kind of hard to find it was totally worth it when we arrived! You have to pay 10 000 for entering and a extra 5 000 for parking but you get a lot for the money! The nature around the waterfall was amazing and as soon as we arrived to the waterfall all of us jumped into the water so don't forget your swimwear! And just so you know, when we were there we were not allowed to jump into the water from the top rocks because the water was to shallow.

Amazing and very romantic scenery. Extremely beautiful and nice to swim under the fall. At the entrance there are guides who will sell you a guided trip to the falls - but we found out that it actually wouldn't have been necessary since the path to the fall was easily followed without guide. However, we anyway enjoyed the guide we bought since he had a lot of knowledge and happily took our pics when in the water. So although rather expensive for the guide we were happy.
Beautiful & Serene. I love this waterfall, not too many people know about this hidden gem :) it's so beautiful & serene. The lifeguard was very helpful and friendly as well.Will be back soon!

Honest review. This was beautiful, and we even saw a rainbow end to end across the waterfall. Well worth visiting. Only annoying thing is the extra cost they want to get changed and the long long long walk down and then back up (which was the worst).

Worth the stop. Such a beautiful waterfall and the hike wasn't strenuous. Taking the stairs on your way back might be make you break a sweat but overall, worth it. It gets a little crowded in the afternoon so go early. You can either stay at the bottom of the waterfall or hike up a little more (5-10 minutes) to get to the halfway point.

Gorgeous waterfall best seen during the dry season.. This waterfall is absolutely huge and beautiful. It's gorgeous anytime but especially in the dry season when the water is white. During the rainy season it's yellow due to all the mud picked up by the swollen river above. Lots of steps down to see it but it's well worth the effort. And you can cool off with a swim in the large pool at the base.
Nice waterfall for great pictures!. Very nice! Go there around 9 am. You'll be alone to swim and take great pictures! You can even climb a little bit on the right side of the waterfall!

Very pretty for a cooling swim, loved by our 5-year old. Minimal entry fee, well-made if tall concrete steps and a very pretty valley with an impressive waterfall at the bottom. A beautiful place to cool off for an hour or so, and despite what people have said, the walk up is nothing much: our 5 year old did it without falling off or an unusual level of complaints, which an ice cream at the top fixed quickly.Recommended.

A refreshing splash. Despite the distance from denpasar, the trip itself was worth it.A hotspot for tourists, you'll see plenty of people around.Note that you have to pay 10,000 IDR and take a flight of stairs which is exhausting to climb back up.

A gorgeous waterfall, although a bit overrun by tourtists. My wife and I had only four days in Bali, so we were anxious to pack in as much sight-seeing as possible in a relatively short amount of time. There are quite a few famous and very beautiful waterfalls on Bali, and we had time to see only one. The Tegenungan Waterfall is utterly beautiful, even spectacular, and is located in a magnificent location. I recommend it highly as a natural sight worth visiting during a sojourn on Bali. There are only two drawbacks to Tegenungan. First, it is located in the far more populated, heavily touristed southern corner of the island. It is therefore visited by many more foreign tourists than some of the more remote (and more spectacular) waterfalls on the island. It was very crowded at and around the falls –– which unfortunately detracted from my enjoyment of this undeniably beautiful sight.Second, the trek from the parking lot down to the falls themselves is pretty arduous. The many, many high, steep steps down can be tough on the knees, especially if you're over 50 or 60 years of age. And the trek back –– well, let's just say it was twice as difficult for this 66-year old! I don't regret it, however.
Cool site. Good spot if u are doing an ubud day trip. Not too much of a mission to get to, a few stairs. But amazing view and you can swim.

What a magnificent hidden waterfall . Have heard about this waterfall for a few years now, so this time in Bali it was on our must visit list. This waterfall is located approx 20 minutes or so from Ubud. Entrance fees apply 10,000 rupiah per person & $5000 for parking. There are a number of steep steps that lead down to the waterfall in a majestical valley, then the beauty of this location the takes hold of you. Many tourist also bring their swim gear and go into the pool below the waterfall - my son did and he loved it being refreshed by the cool mountain waters. Looking forward to my next visit to Bali and next time around i will bring my board shorts/ swim trunks. Hope you like my photos of this truly majestical location.

Stunning Hidden Waterfall. This waterfall is absolutely stunning, hard to find, and a little scary to cross but so, so worth it. When we got into the main area underneath the waterfall we realized that along the rocks to our left someone had affixed a rope to use to help get across the rocks into the pool. So we got back across Indiana Jones style. =)

Lots of steps, but definitely worth it. It is majestic.There are quite a few steps to go down to the falls.And you have to climb them back ...But it is so worth it.There is some construction on the site to offer more services.

Worth it . We arrived there around 11 in the morning, paid 10.000 IDR each + 5.000 for our driver and his car (I read that people found it expensive, but doesn't bother me at all to pay less than 2€ for this experience knowing that it helps a few locals). First you'll enjoy the view from the top terrace in front of the waterfall and quickly you'll just wanna run downstairs (around 5min) to see it closer. Everything is pretty raw there, the little bridges in bamboo just make the place a lil bit more authentic. You'll cross the river, trek 2 minutes and you'll finally be at the feet of the waterfall. Around 35 meters high (no it's not the Niagara Falls, if you were expecting that you're just in the wrong continent) but so powerful, you'll first be in awe and then in a hurry to take off your clothes to take a bath ... Water is not hot but not cold neither, you can easily go inside (would be a mistake not to) and enjoy the noisy water flow. As it is constantly moving it's obviously not crystal clear but it's not muddy at all (stones and sand at the bottom). Place is small, so as the afternoon begins it started to get crowded, I would recommend to go in the morning to fully enjoy the place (and take pictures without anyone in the frame) and take your time. As every place where Man has landed, there can be some trash around but there is a bin where you can put your cigarette butt or empty bottles to preserve Mother Nature (just sayin..), but it wasn't the rubbish dump some have describe where we were there and you definitely can't blame nature for that. The way up is a little bit rough as steps are high but totally doable if you're healthy (I did it, yet I'm a heavy smoker and far from being an athlete). There is toilet upstairs and downstairs if you really need to, it will cost you around 3.000 IDR. You'll also find someone to sell you cold drinks every 10 meters, and there are a few shops upstairs with snacks or young coconuts. If you're staying in Ubud or simply passing by, it really worth to take a couple hours to see it.
Lovely view& easy access. Easy walk to the falls or just view from near the car park, safe swimming, sit for a cool drink or light lunch
Awesome. A little crowded with tourists, as well as locals. But a beautiful location to be, can't blame them! Very powerful waterfall, a beautiful place to spend an hour or so! Easy to find

Nice breeze and naturally lovely.. My wife and I did a quick stop (1 hour) to see the waterfalls, I highly recommend you bring your bathing suit to take a refreshing shower. Water is clean. Fee 10,000 ruphias per person. Very nice experience!

Real Cool. Very beautiful and majestic waterfall in Tegenungan village in Gianyar Bali. Entry fee is Rp 10k/p + 5k/car. Our only regret is that we were tired and couldn't go till the bottom to feel the falling water! Don't forget to bring your beachwear if you wish to jump-in. There are joints at high-land which offered drinks, coconut etc plus few souvenir shops too

Laborous Steps. This is a rather scenic waterfall. However, there are more than 100 steps down to get to the waterfall. If you are not feeling fit, be careful on your way up.My wife who ran her last marathon 3 years ago felt dizzy after climbing the stairs back up to the parking lot.

A cooling surprise! :). Wade into the shallow river for a quick, refreshing stroll or take off your clothes for a therapeutic soak under the roaring waters. Pretty and scenic -- I saw a couple taking their wedding portrait, perched on an adjacent rock with the waterfall as the backdrop. Perhaps you might even want to have a picnic here! A lovely, pleasant and serene morning stay <3

beautiful still not very touristic place. Not easy to find but worthy to try.you can get close enough to the fall to completely soak yourself with the water splashing in the rocks. Very cool picture if you have a GoPro style camera waterproof

Bring Your Beachwear for This Visit. I heard from my driver that this is the only waterfall in Ubud. Despite being the only one, it is already very beautiful and majestic! My only regret is I did not bring any beachwear to join in the fun of so many adults acting like children in a play pool. Do not worry there is no changing area for you. They have some changing areas with an open concept and you can rinse yourselves there too. There are proper and seemingly well-furnished toilets far from the waterfall and next to a pit stop at where you will walk down to the waterfall. It costs you some money. I can't remember the amount because I did not use it. The adventurous ones can find your way to climb up to see the waterfall even closer. The route is not very accessible so be careful when walking up. And do wear shoes as the path up can be rocky and very slippery. Also, walking down to the waterfall is fine but climbing up needs some stamina. The steps can be quite high. Even my fit local driver has to pause to catch his breath. Stay there longer and enjoy the fun at the waterfall.

Stunning. Really lovely place to visit. Clearly popular with the local youngsters as a fun place to hang out with your friends as well. But golly you need to be fit! We headed off down the steps to see the waterfall closer up and I became more and more aware of people coming back up the steps in varying degrees of breathlessness. It was, as ever, very hot, so I decided to wait part way down in the shade, and leave the closer inspection to my fitter husband!

Worth a visit. Our driver took us here on our way to Ubud. Very pretty area. Take your swimmers as everyone else there was swimming but unfortunately we didn't have ours on. Worth the short walk down to the falls and nice photo opportunity.
Great photo-location. Wonderful scenic location with a spectacular waterfall, visible from the local warung. Absolutely great for photographers
Best waterfall at Bali. Perfect nature trip to the best waterfalls at Bali. It's absolutely worth driving to and walking the long way down (approx. 350 steps). Stunning view.

Cooling & big splash water. Short walk towards the waterfall. Is very cooling. Many locals & foreigner come and visit. Nearby got stalls selling souvenirs and hats. Stall selling coconut drinks and food is there also. Sit there sipping coconut drinks looking over the waterfall and the trees nearby.
Definitely worth a visit by scooter. Nice place to swim. And you can even go behind the waterfall into a cave. 10,000rp entry. You don't need any guides just follow the steps!
Beautiful. Worth the visit. Bring swimmers as it is a great swimming spot. The best way to get here would be to hire a scooter and drive yourself.

That hike doe.. Great on the way place and pretty secluded in the mornings. Like most attractions in Bali you have to pay to use the bathroom which sucks. The water really isn't deep enough to be able to seem in but the waterfall was very beautiful and we saw really interesting insects and birds. It was actually cleaner than I expected after reading reviews on here about there being rubbish everywhere. Hiking back up made my legs go weak and my friend had to give me a pep talk two thirds up, no joke. But yes nice waterfall

Pretty fun stop. We rented a driver and wanted to see a waterfall, so we stopped here for less than an hour to take a look at this famous waterfall. People brought bathing suits and waded since it was shallow, but it looked pretty powerful. I'd definitely not recommend getting hit by that water. There's a walk up to the side of the waterfall which looks pretty photogenic as well. I'd recommend not diving since it is very shallow and would probably cause injuries. It's a good 1 hour stop along the way and could be paired with the rice terrace walks in the morning.

Easy to reach. The waterfall just only 10 minutes from Pasar Seni Sukowati and it's easy to reach this place. We going there around 10AM and little bit crowded about 30-40 visitor. But it is okay, severals are swimming or only taking picture. Just because I forgot my swim wear so I decide to not swim, but there are shop for short. Entrance fee only for 10K or 5K for locals, very cheap. Including facilities such parking area, toilet, and shop. The cafe above the falls having a beautiful view to the falls, but they sell over price young coconuts. 20K :) Will be come back

The Falls!!. I love this waterfall. Its so majestic! I suggest to just rent a scooter and go there on your own. The journey to the waterfall has amazing rice terraces view. Good trip to have a cold nice breeze of the falls. Will definitely want to go again,
great swim!. Really nice waterfalls to visit. Loved that you can take a swim in them! The walk there is a bit hard, there's a lot of stairs.

Go early to avoid the crowds. I arrived at the waterfall at 6am before all the crowds and sellers. It is a great waterfall and great place just to come and relax. It's not the nicest one for swimming in as the water is a brown colour most of the time but beautiful none the less.

Small waterfall, visit only if you have lots of time. We were in Bali for almost a week and more than 4 days in Ubud. After covering the famous places it was easier for us to visit the waterfall on the way to more famous destinations. There is a steep steps to get to the waterfall. We had reached here early in the morning. There were not many people on the spot. It is in the middle of jungle and takes about 5-7 mins walk to get to it from the parking place. There are couple of shops selling refreshments and local fruits along the way. The water was not so clean on the day we visited the falls. Our driver was suggesting that the water is usually cleaner on other days. After spending 15-20 mins around the place we continued our journey. There are not many activities which can be done around this place. Best thing you can do is to get bit adventurous and climb the rocks to the top of fall. Some people were taking bath while their friends were busy taking photos. For us it was a means of showing our little daughters the natural beauty and give them a real life experience of waterfall. If you are in crunch of time it is better to give this place a miss.

Bring Your Swimsuit!. We only had two nights in Ubud, so we asked our driver to show us the highlights of the area. During our Ubud stay we saw: Monkey Sanctuary, Tirta Empul temple, rice paddies, wood carvers, jewelry makers, mask makers, coffee plantations, elephant parks, and two cultural performance. My favorite site was Tegenungan Waterfall. I could have stayed here for half of the day, but unfortunately my travel companions had other ideas.Upon entering the area you get a nice view of the falls from a seating area at the top. We (four of us) had a Bingtang at this location. I then traveled to the bottom of the falls via a well maintain trail of wooden steps, paved sections and dirt. I am guessing five minutes down and ten to fifteen minutes up if you are in decent shape. If I was traveling with just my wife, we would have played in the water pools at the bottom of the falls and cross the river to the other side. It would have been a great way to spend a few hours. Bring your swimsuit, rubber booties or some type of foot protection would be helpful.There is a cafeteria, and restrooms (charge for use) near the bottom of the falls. There are stalls near the top of the trail where local vendors are attempting to sell their wares, but they are not as aggressive as those at many of the temples.

Nice excursion. This was a nice excursion for 10k IDR. It's about a 10min walk from the car park down steep steps. There's no where to really change into togs at the waterfall so best to change at the top although they were building toilets while we were there. Highlight was walking in behind the waterfall and getting soaked

Beautiful waterfall! . This is a beautiful natural lava rock formation waterfall. Nice views from the top and if you want to go down and swim you can. Nothing like Yellowstone Park or Niagra but for a small island pretty impressive. Quite a hike down to the water which we did not do but a lot of others did. A little cafe and the usual tourist things to buy. Pay the minimal entrance fee to support the village, enjoy a great view and go on your way. Another quick stop but really neat to see.
Wonderful place. First time when i saw that place , i just told myself ;"vow what an amazing waterfall". That place is one of the place should be visited. Never miss it if you are in Bali.

Amazing Energy and Peace. Cost is 2000Rp ($2)What an amazing experience. You must walk down the stairs to experience the true beauty of this place and feel the energy of the waterfall. Such a beautiful place to visit. The moment I walked down the stairs and felt the air from the waterfall I felt at peace. An amazing must see site.

Wandering into the Waterfalls. . I wandered into the Tegenungan waterfalls to chill out when on a day when my long wanderlust journey was getting a bit incense. It' a short motor bike ride through the from the monkey forest area through serene landscapes and rice fields. The fee is merely 15,000 IR. You can stay up top at the view point restaurant and just take it the scenery or make your way down the long stone stairway into the sacred waters. Once there it's a lovely place to meditate or beat the heat by diving in. You can also make your was up closer to the top of the waterfalls. Up top there are stalls selling saris, dresses and snacks. There are many waterfalls in Bali but if you're staying in Monkey Forest, it's one of the closer ones. You can also arrange for a driver to take you on a day tour of the falls, coffee plantation and traditional Indonesian dance performance. This trip will cost about $150 IR.

Beautiful. We were quite early at the waterfall and were almost alone, so recommend that you go in the morning. The waterfall is beautiful, swimming is allowed but the current is very strong so would maybe not recommend it. Climbing up to the ledge on the right of the waterfall is quite hard work but worth it. We loved it!

Poor attraction. They say foreigners are the worst for polluting but the amount of trash we saw from the immense amount of construction was disgusting, local shops, locals sitting at the side of the trails hassle you to buy anything and traditional offerings too produced a lot of litter. However the rubbish from tourists wasn't much better just not the major offenders. The trails are being concreted boarded by unatural gardens and potted plants ruins the whole "natural awe". The water was dirty and smoking tourist meant we counldn't even enjoy the fresh air. You pay to get in, to park, and to use the bathroom but as mentioned no effort to keep the area clean or protect the 'natural attraction'.
Trek your way down. If you're visiting the waterfall, make sure you trek your way down to get your money worth. We didn't cos it's quite inconvenient for us with a pregnant woman.
short water fall. water fall is good but the water i so durty and also lots of step to going down think better just see from the up

Loud and pretty. Worth the long drive from Seminyak to see this. We didn't, but there were many people enjoying themselves, swimming in the water there. The waterfall is beautiful, great place for photos.

I wish it was cleaner.... beautiful waterfall but.. very dirty and busy. views are amazing, water is warm and lovely.. but you have to pay for entry (tourists more than locals) so why isn't kept clean???

Full of rubbish . The waterfall is attractive but unfortunately the area has a lot of built up rubbish which really spoils what could be lovely. You can swim in the river at the bottom of the fall and walk up to the top. Be prepared for a good leg workout, there are a lot of steps!
Beautiful.. Excellent waterfall to see but a long walk down and back up again. Lots of people go down and have a swim or a paddle.

Good in between stop. Went here with our driver. we saw the waterfall from a far at first (like the other review) which was pretty. But then the boys (5 And 7 years) wanted to go down And See the waterfall up close. Quite a Climb down... Long, high steps down. But worth it. When we got to the waterfall the boys climbed up to get closer. They loved it! There were people swimming, but we did not. Nice place to go maybe if you're not that Well on foot, You can wait upstairs whilst the rest Go down And Still have a good view! Not a main destination, but about An hour And a half visit.

Be prepared for Steps. Thank God we did not go here In the mid day heat. We arrived at the waterfall around 5.30 which was a perfect time. The views are fantastic. We then decided to walk down to the waterfall. There is quiet a lot of steps down to the waterfall and they are quiet steep so take your time going down. When you have got down to the waterfall it is a amazing view experience. You can swim in the waterfall and it is lovely.There is a little cafe down by the waterfall so I would suggest getting a bottle of water for your trek back up the steps as it is very tiring and you could end up out of breath like myself .Entry into the waterfall was 25k for two and that included parking so it is excellent value for money. Just be prepared for a trek up big steps should you decide to go down to the waterfall.

Cheap thrills. I'm staying in Seminyak with a group of 5 and we decided to get a driver or the day and go to Ubud. At the end of the day we got the driver to take us to Tegenungan Waterfall. The drive was awesome in itself; Who puts lush rice patties intertwined with rain-forsest, swaying ever so gently in a nurturing breeze with the soothing sound of bubbling brooks and relaxing wooden win-chimes clapping lazily in the distance?There's a few places to have a beer and a snack at the top. Walk down and get as close as you want to the falls. I waded through the currents to the other side of the river to climb up dodgey steps and get right right up to the edge of the fall. It's a kinda of do at your own risk/whatever your comfortable with so you can go and enjoy an adventure swimming and climbing or just relax and enjoy the scenery.5/5 - it was 10,000 IDR ($1 AUD) to get in....... can't beat that!

Amazing falls, surrounded by lush greenery . A beautiful view from the viewing platform. But to experience the place completely, it is a must to walk down a few stairs to reach the waterfall. Playing around in the little area, the experience of standing right under the Falls gives a totally enjoyable experience.

Travelling around Bali with 4 Couples. If your looking for a bit of sightseeing outside the Main Street of Ubud, you can't go past a visit to Tegenungan Waterfall about a 30 minute drive from Ubud. Nominal entry fee (I just can't remember how much) As you get out of your car, a very short walk (100 metres) takes you to a viewing platform with shops where you can see the falls without walking any further.For the more adventurous a walk down concrete stairs takes you to the base of the falls. You can swim in the pool at the bottom of the falls, take a few photos. Then head back up to have a well deserved Bintang before heading to lunch in the rice paddies at teba Sari ( highly recommend this restaurant)

The closest waterfall from Dempasar. What an amazing experience...not that difficult to reach the waterfall and the water was Amazing once in it...there are little cafes to grab water and snacks and you dont need to be an athlete to enjoy it, Highlight of my trip!

Nice waterfall and good swim. Not far from Ubud, you can find this nice waterfall. it's easy to reach the waterfall and entering the water is a piece of cake.Entrance fee is Rp. 10.000 per person and parking costs Rp. 5.000 per car or scooter.
Dumping of geh waterfall is a great experiance. Nice Waterfall and you can jump of it !!! totally woth it!It is quite a way to get there but especially for hot days it is a nice trip

Awesome time at the waterfall. After a hot few hours at the Ubud market our guide Mr Putu (check out his trip advisor page) took us to this waterfall. What a blast! We (hubby and kids aged 17 & 11) headed into the waterfall. What a thrill! Such a great treat. This would never be allowed in Australia. We loved it. Well worth a visit but take your bathers and a towel.

Impressive. It's not Niagara, but it's pretty and sizeable AND you can swim under it! The pathway is fine for most people but a bit narrow and muddy at points. But almost anyone can get to it. You don't have to get wet feet because they now have a little bamboo bridge to bring you across the rivulet to the edge.Worth the trip. Some stair climbing is needed down and up though.
Great place. Lovely place to be visited. Hidden treasure with stairs. After enjoy the waterfall, quite hard work to climb up. Great!!

Cool experience. Swimming in the waterfall after a hot day was ideal. Steps are steep so access is tricky if you're not able. It's just as dirty as the rest of the streets in Bali which was disappointing as its a natural wonder but nevertheless we still had a great time. Definitely worth it. Very small entrance fee at the top of the steps that I'm pretty sure just goes to the locals.

Beautiful waterfall. You get a beautiful view of the waterfall from the top where the shops are - great photo opportunities ! There are a lot of stairs down to the waterfall but it's work doing, especially if you are going to swim in the water ! It's very beautiful and refreshing !

Not worth it. You drive long way to get there..you pay for what !!!! You don't know because you just walk few steps inside and you watch the waterfall from far...you cant easily go down tobe close to it as its not safe...

Beautiful.. If you are not adventurous, don't go. There's flights of stairs to climb and it can be tiring. You'll need to balance yourself on rocks to get from one place to another. But I love it. The end results was just splendid. The cold water splashed is all you need after going through all the trouble to get there. Be sure to wear something comfortable and shoes/slippers should not be slippery.

Quiet nice waterfall. Located in Kemenuh, Gianyar district. Actually there's nothing amazing with this waterfall, you walk down the stairs and cross the little bridge then you can see the waterfall as near as you want. Maybe the view from the top better.You paid Rp 12.500,- for the entrance fee, they have parking area for car and motorbike........like many tourist object in Indonesia, you can easily find a garbage everywhere, looks dirty and lacks of maintenance....

Nothing fantastic. We were there with the recommendation of our driver. You have to pay for it before entering the premise and note that it is not paying over a 'proper' counter but to someone locally who must be the villagers! Even visit to the toilet have to pay! Nothing special if you do not want to walk down to the waterfall (about 15-20mins). Family with kids and/or elderly might not enjoy it; walking down might be okay, but coming up will be tiring as it is quite sloppy.

Amazing!. Nothing to dislike (unless you dislike stairs as there are a few) - but so much to love! The views, the water, the open air... beautiful. Great for photos. Careful if you are jumping off the "cliffs" into the waterfall as my friend hurt his foot a lot as he pin-dropped.

Breathtaking view.... Superb. This spot was advised by my driver. Haven't heard of it but that why we hired driver to take us all the spots... Few metres of breathtaking steps.
