Not suitable for oldies( No offence) after reaching near to fall i was speechless. me n my wife wanted to stay there for while we stayed there for 2 hrs which is worth. Natural beauty at its best... pure water and so close to fall... Should experience this... Recommended.

Splashtastic!. The waterfall itself isn't enormous but the water flow is fast and furious. The river at the bottom is deep enough to swim in and the locals certainly do this with delight! It's free to enter and a bit of a hike to get down to the water level - this is ok - but getting back up is quite exhausting in the Bali heat. The toilets at the bottom of the stairs are interesting (just water flowing out of pipes into a pool) don't use them if you're shy!

Little and Wonderful!. The waterfall is not that tall but the flow of water is heavy and one can jump into the water from the cliff.We saw the waterfall from the stalls selling drinks and food. One can sit there and see the wonderful view of the waterfall from the distance.We stayed there for 25-30 minutes and then left for the next destination.

Amazing. I didn't program to go there for time reasons but the local guide highly recommended to visit the waterfalls.BEST CHOICE EVER. AmazingPretty hard to arrive but absolutely worthed.If you spend time in Ubud you should go there.It's about 20000 rph, (around 2 Australian dollars). Cheap and beautiful

Breathtaking view. What a magnificent view. Well, only when you are willing to take the steps down and go close to the waterfall. Its worth the walk down to the waterfall I assure you. And for those that wants to take a dip there, remember to bring extra clothes! The only con? Humans and their litter which is very sad to see.

Worth to Visit!. Spending about two hours from Kuta to get here. The waterfall itself was really nice from the top and you need to do some extra exercise (to get down the stairs and up again) to see it closely from below. But what I got was more than the energy that I spent, because the view and the ambience was amazing. Unfortunately, I forgot to bring another clothes so I couldn't really stay close to the waterfall (because it can drenched you).

Our driver Ardana ..... took us to Tegenungan Village where my husband was delighted to have the monkey climb all over him, whilst I filmed from a safe distance. We were able to buy snacks from the shop & sit & eat them by the waterfall, which was just a short walk away. Although the waterfall was in the distance the view was breathtaking & it was so peaceful. Cost just 25,000 or about £1.30 for 2 of us & included parking.

Nice Swin. Very close to Ubud and easy to get to. Easy enough walk down to it and lovely for a swim, this allowed us to get under and behind the waterfall which was nice. Guy there with a inner tube to help you get across if needed. All in all a very enjoyable trip.

Worth a look. I didn't walk down to the bottom of the falls because there seemed to be a lot of stairs. My friend did go down to take photo's and said she just took her time and managed the stairs quite well. It is a pretty waterfall and I sat in the café at the top watching a group of people enjoying jumping off a ledge near the top of the falls into the water. Looked like great fun.

Pretty But Badly Maintained. probably one of the easiest waterfall spot to visit in Bali. If you were on a bike, you can park near to the stairs going to the waterfall. very minimal parking fee for motorbikes!the waterfall itself is gorgeous. you can see it from the food stall where you park your bike before walking down to the waterfall. sadly, there are some rubbish that were left by visitors and that kinda left some sore sight.but overall, I'd give this place a try. at least one time.

Waterfall trip. A place to visit if only you are willing to walk up and down the flight of stairs and boulders. Could be slightly slippery due to the water and moss growing around. Great place for a snap though =)

visit only if you plan to go down to the waterfall. we only stop at the warung which was like 100-200M away from the waterfall to have a "view". the tourguide told us to stop there take some pic and have some drinks at the warung. we took 2 pics, admire the view for 3-5min and left.not recommended unless you plan to go down (we are unsure the way to get down though) to reach the waterfall. the local even collect entrance fee! although the fee is minimal but i'm pretty sure it is illegal as the local only collect fee from foreigner/tourist. she tried to collect fee from 2 foreigners (accompanied by a local) but then the local told her they were his friends then no fee collected. not sure how clean is the water as we only view from a far.

Really nice, and close to Ubud. This waterfall definitely deserve a visit . It's about 20minutes driving from Ubud . When you reach the parking lot you need to pay a cheap entrance fee. From above you can admire the waterfall sourranded by by the jungle and have a drink at the warung. If you want to get closer you need to go down for almost 100steps and walk to the waterfall. Your feet will get wet for sure so go prepared.

Very dirty, very difficult access to swimming. Worth a 10-minute look from the cafe terrace at the car park level. Don't bother going down to the river.Access to the falls is down a hundred steep steps and then across 200m of slippery boulders. People half my age were giving up and turning back. The whole area is dirty with plastic bottles everywhere. The kindest way of describing the shower/spring and changing facilities is basic.The men's was clean and the spring water refreshing. The ladies was full of rubbish with a large poo in the only dry place to stand. Mmmm, nice!

Great view and great waterfall. Reading through some of the other reviews about the water being dirty etc was a bit of a turn off but I'm glad we went to this waterfall. Its a little bit of a walk down to the fall and then a bit iffy traversing rocks and edging your way to the waterfall but it was fantastic up close. We didn't swim as we didn't bring towels but just amazing to stand in the water. This was a great addition to our day trip to Ubud.

Beautiful, accessible waterfall. We really wanted to see a waterfall in Bali and this one matched up to the location we was looking in. Staying in Sanur and deciding to see this amongst the bat cave temple and snorkling in bloo lagoon we managed a cool day out costing us IR500000 with private taxi all day who kindly showed is around, gave us an insight to their culture and told us true prices to barter on. The waterfall itself is down a few steps and a short walk along the bank. Getting really close can done using a small rope attached to the bank but still takes some balance on the rocks. Once at the foot there is ample space for pictures and a rest but the water is quite rough so swimming wasn't advised and we are good swimmers. The older as a whole was very beautiful and picturesque so a good place to stop if on a larger day out.

Beautiful!. Experiencing the Tegenungan Waterfall was amazing!! Image view was breathtaking. I think you pay $1 to get in and you have to walk down about 300 steps before trekking across a ton of slippery and sharp rocks. At one point we had to scale a wall while holding onto a rope. There was a man that was leading people up a cliff so we could jump into the waterfall! It was exhilarating! I would recommend wearing some sort of water shoes if you decide to go here.
Lovely place. Great spot to enjoy Mother Nature , not too bad a walk , and the water looks very inviting , a very peaceful spot, and you can go in the water

Love the view. Visited the waterfall on a stop during our day out to Ubud with a driver. Loved the view and got some great photos even one which has a "face"...My only concern was been forced to pay to view & pay to park by the local women then followed our entire time by a unruly brunch of childern sticking badly made fans in our faces and up our noses. Which led us to spending less than 10 mins there as we needed to return to the vehicle to get away from the rabble.I can understand the money going back into the local community but feel it could be handled in a better way.

JUST SIT BACK AND ENJOY THE VIE. It was unplanned & it was recommended by our driver so we go ahead with it and we didn't know what to expect from it. It is just about 5 minutes walk from the main road and not many tourist around therefore you'll have it on your own. It is a big beautiful waterfall surrounded with many coconut tree and greens around. There is a stall selling drinks and snack and as it was an unplanned we didn't go down the steps to enjoy the cooling water however we bought coconut drink and some snack and we just sit on the bench and enjoy the view.From where we sit we saw two girls were swimming at the waterfall and some locals taking a bath.It is a nice place to visit either to just sit and enjoy the view or you may also go down the steps and take a deep in the pool below the waterfall.
Don't miss this!! . A beautiful waterfall. Great views from the top and even better if you swim in the waterfall and underneath it! Not many people seem to know about it but it's so worth a trip!

a long trek down to the waterfall. This waterfall is off the main tourist route and quite impressive. There is a small cafe at the top of the gorge and it's quite a trek to get down to the river bed so we just stayed at the top and enjoyed the view.Lots of people were swimming in the pool under the falls.

Great day plenty of water coming over the falls at the time of our list. A Rp.10000 entry well worth it 300 steps down to the river then a 200 meter walk over rocks and black sand spectacular from my point of view

Not far from Ubud. You can go right beneath the waterfall, even jump from the side, but check the depth first or follow the locals. The access has one rough point where you have to hold the ropes otherwise you end in the river. It could be difficult for elderly, but its just a few meters. The rest of the path is stepping on stones.It is nice waterfall considering it is not in the mountains. There are many steps down that you have to climb on the way back, pretty easy.
What a shower. After a hot and dusty motorcycle ride, it was great to have one cold beer and a shower under waterfall.

Beautiful! With minimal tourist trap. This is one of the better stops on most Ubud tours.
It's cheap, very beautiful, and has minimal tourist trap aspects to it.
I recommend it!
Bring your camera!

Beautiful. The waterfall was beautiful. We swam in the water and it was awesome. Wouldn't recommend going down to the waterfall if you are fragile or injured as there are lots of steep steps to walk down and the rocks are a bit of an obstacle to get over. Personally it was a great adventure including the walk and would recommend it to others!

Awesome!. They say "You gotta go through the rough patches before enjoying a magnificent view." & it did serves the quote well. The way down to the base of the fall was pretty much rough and slippery. Went all the way down with my 5 year old niece. It was quite a challenge but its all worth it! Managed to witness some of the local kids doing the cliff jumping. (Though its not recommended due to safety purposes) but i guess the local kids knew it better. Some of the tourist later followed suit & they say it was quite awesome.
Scenic waterfall. To be blunt, it's a waterfall and it's pretty. The fact that it's in Bali and surrounded by lush vegetation makes it worth a visit.

Worth a stop. Guide recommend this for the view and wasn't wrong. River was unfortunately low and brown on the day we visited but still beautiful, so must be amazing when its higher and clear so you can swim

Worth a stop if on the way. It is a pretty average waterfall. If it's not he way it is worth a stop but certainly not worth a trip just for that. The water is quite deep and not suitable for swimming.

Very beautiful!. Worth a stop if it is along your way. To access the base of the waterfall, you have to walk down a fair amount of steps (and take into consideration walking BACK up!). There's a little restaurant and snack shop as well.

Surprisingly stunning. This is definitely a beautiful waterfall and worth the drive to get there. There are a lot of steps to access it so be mindful of the climb back to the top. With this in mind, avoid going in the height of the heat but definitely take plenty of water to keep hydrated. There are quite a few rocks to cross when you get to the bottom but it is achievable for many. But even if you stop at the bottom of the steps, the view is worth the climb. My only criticism is there is just too much litter when you get down there. This put us off going for a swim and it would be great if the authorities used some of the entrance money to clear the place. Sadly there was also a monkey chained by its neck to a fence for 'tourist photo's'. It can be a pretty upsetting sight for those of us who love our wildlife.
Nice big Waterfall. Did not expect it would be so huge. This place has nice view.but that what's her looks dirty, so I didn't swim there. Awesome place to shoot pictures.

Out of the way but worth making time for. A small entry fee allows access to this beautiful waterfall. Be prepared for the steps down (and back up after) and the difficult walking over the rocks to reach the base of the falls. It's possible to swim here; so take a towel. A small café is available for drinks after the climb back up.

Ubud Waterfall to visit. Tegenungan Waterfall which is hidden away in Ubud, Bali is a great site to visit if you love waterfalls as much as I do. We went on a day where all the locals were hanging out checking out the view themselves. It is an easy 5 minute walk down on the stairs it only gets tricky if you want to go and swim under the falls. As you can see in the photos I have posted the local boys having troubles walking along the edge. The place is just surrounded by magnificent palm trees and there is a restaurant at the top if you just want to witness the falls from a far.We did not have anytime at all to spend here which was disappointing as we were so hot and all we wanted to do was jump in the cool water to relax after a long day of shopping in Ubud. Just before we were leaving I noticed someone on top of the waterfalls photographing it (not jumping) though I have seen some a photo of man jumping off it on here. More on Ubud and Bali on my blog www.he11okiki.comHow to get here is easy if you hire a driver for the day which cost $50AUD as we were staying in Nusa Dua. Just ask him to take you here and show him a photo or he might have some brochures himself. Thanks for reading my review :)

Pretty waterfall.. This was on our way to do other stuff. It was a nice stop over, it wasn't busy so we weren't harassed by vendors. We walked down to the waterfall but didn't go much further as it looked a bit dirty with trash around. I don't get the poor reviews, it's literally a waterfall so you know exactly what to expect when you see it...

Stunningly Beautiful. Nature and beauty at its best!!A beautifully big waterfall set amongst palm trees and rice paddies, a short walk descending down large concrete steps, My mums not that fit and managed to do it but just took her time. There are two small shops at the beginning selling refreshments but surprisingly they were not in your face about buying anything which made the experience so much better.People were swimming at the bottom of the waterfall - Unfortunately I didn’t bring my bathers but plan to go back on my next trip to Ubud.
So Niiice . The waterfall is so nice and looks strong.. the surrounding views of the rocks , forest and river so unforgettable for the nature lovers..So beautiful and worth to visit

Amazing!. Headed to Tenenungan at the end of a day exploring areas around Ubud and we were completely thrilled. There was a lot of water,band it was pristine (surprised to hear others found it dirty!). The waterfall is definitely more impressive than it looks in photos - the sheer mass of it is incredible when you stand at the base. Went for a swim, even directly underneath the waterfall, but it was totally safe and completely thrilling! Perhaps a little difficult for some to reach the falls as it takes a bit of wading through rapids and climbing over rocks but this experience was a highlight of my trip! Nice to find places in Bali that are still the water nature intended :)

Beautiful place. I don't understand people who said it's not worth seeing :) it was really pretty place, with loads of greenery and quite big waterfall. We walked all the way down and it was pretty easy going though water as well. Really lovely place and only 20 min drive from Ubud

Worth a quick look. Our driver took us there. We just viewed the falls from the viewing platform. I would have liked tohave gone down the stairs but for some reason our driver suggested against it. After reading previous reviews and I can see why- apparently there is garbarge down there and is not clean.Our driver seemed to be really proud of the falls, I just thought that they were a dirty brown- which I now read is from the rice.. If I go back to Bali I think I would like to see some of the other falls now. They seem to be much nicer. Still glad I saw this one though. Our poor diriver was running out of places to take us.

Not really worth it for us. Its a beautiful waterfall, but I wish we had not gone down the steps as it was quite dirty at the bottom and there were pools of dirty water. Maybe this is because it is the rainy season and the rivers are dirty. Still, there were a few people trying to get in and under the falling water to take pictures, I guess if you are brave enough you can get some awesome shots.

Worth a visit if passing. Stopped off here on the way to Ubud. Very lovely spot. A small village with a pretty scenic waterfall. Not large but worth taking a look if you are passing this way. There is a small charge of Rp 10,000 per person (just over 50 pence).
Nice view. This place offers a good walk in a relaxing environment. It does have a nice view but nothing special. If you are not nearby in the area, theres no need to go there on purpose.
Nice view from a far. Very hot when the time I visit here. But, worth visiting. A lot of people came here and there's also farmers that live nearby that can pose for pictures.

Worth a visit if in area. Not a major attraction but if you are in the area, it is worth a visit. When we arrived hardly anyone was there and we had plenty if time to take photos etc. we didn't walk to the falls themselves but instead stayed at the viewing platform. Best time to visit is in late afternoon when he sun is shining and shows the area in beautiful golden colours..

Nice view if in the area. This was a nice stop for a cool drink and a look at the view and not busy with tourists. Easy access from carpark, we didn't walk to the bottom. Waterfall was brown due to rice season.

Worth a stop if you are around the area. Nice waterfall in the middle of the jungle.You have a nice view from the top, but you can also walk to the river.As far as they told me, amount of water can vary from season and water color use to be brown.You can easily visit the place in 20-30 minutes.

Worth a look if in the area. We stopped and visited Tegenungan Waterfall on our travels to Ubud. We paid 30,000.00IDR/$3aud for our car load to enter; and 2,000.00IDR to use the toilet(remember you are in Bali and the have to make money any way they can and 2,000IDR is like 90c AUD)Whilst we were unable to venture down to the bottom for a closer look(due to having small children) we were able to get a beautiful view from the top lookout; which also has a shop to purchase snacks and drinks.Please note that the waterfall itself is not a clear aqua blue like many expect; but rather a muddy water flow-which is still beautiful in picturesque settings.Overall if you are travelling through this region we would recommend you stop even if only for 10min; please also note that the iris no wheel chair access and it would be very difficult for the elderly and very young.

Brown waterfall?. Went here upon recommendation of our driver. It was pretty nice, some punk local kids took pictures of my wife until they freaked out when I took pictures of them but yeah. The view is decent, steps are quite steep and there's a lot of them. So if you want to go I the bottom but have any physical issues I would skip this one out. You can sit at the top and look down on it with a drink. Please note there's an entry fee, it's really to get past a barrier on the road, tourist based. The water was brown. I don't mean murky or dirty, no it was brown, like literally not one drop of clear, green, blue water. Apparently something must have happened downstream but the water look like chocolate. Which was weird. Would recommend one of the larger more spectacular waterfalls on the island but depends on where you're based I guess.

So pretty and a lovely picnic spot.. A friend told us the falls were worth a look and I thought they were too. Really pretty and next year I plan on taking the family down for a swim and picnic lunch. Captured some lovely photos and appreciated it for being a little quieter the day we were there. My travelling companion was ripped off at the toilets though, its the only time she was seperated from me and the only place she was scammed.... On the up side she is still laughing that she handed over $20 au approx to use a toilet that was charging 20 cents au approx and she wasnt game enough to sit on the seat! Moral of the story is have some smaller notes for these places, because they wont be going for change if they take your larger notes!Truely though a pretty spot.

Average waterfall. An average waterfall with tropical surroundings in the middle of Bali island. The view from the viewing point shed is really great. Walk down the stairs and walk for 5 to 10 minutes along the stream if you want to get close to the waterfall. Though water is generally clean, there are litters and rubbish in the stream. It is a spectacular fall but not worth a destination. Entry fee applies.

Not an essential visit. as others have suggested, this spot shouldn't sit high on your "must-do" list. to be honest i'd not heard of them but our driver suggested them after we'd been to see Jatiluwih and Pura Ulun Danu Bratan in Tabanan. we had time to spare and his suggestion was to see this waterfall. now i don't know about you, but when someone says "waterfall" to me my mind conjures up all kinds of majestic visions. the tegenungan waterfall didn't quite live up to my over-inflated expectation.it's an easy five to ten minute walk down, but a much harder thigh-burning walk back up as you navigate the steeeeep stairs to the top. but it's worth the walk down. niagra or victoria falls it ain't, but it's still pretty nature.
Okay - but not a destination. Okay to stop off at if going that way - but not a destination in itself. Brown muddy water - may be more spectacular in rainy season - but cool breeze and cold drinks.
it is great view. i really enjoyed waterfall. it is very nice view, you can take great pictures, doesn't take too long walk. i definetly advise to do it!

Nice view but no have to. Nice view from the top. We didn't walk down to the river, since it is a long walk, we were traveling with a 5year old and didn't have the right footwear. I don't think the water was dirty but brown of mud.

Nothing Special. This waterfall looks like any other waterfall. The view is good, but waterfall was far from our viewing area. We saw people bathing in the waterfall, but it was not maintained by the authorities. So, I would not suggest it to be a tourist spot. Our driver took us over there, but we did not stay there much. It just wasted our time.

Beautiful View/Dirt Surroundings. Our driver took my wife and I to the falls while taking us from Ubud to Seminyak. Upon getting to the falls you will see a great view with the falls, tropical surroundings, and even some monkeys. We decided to make the walk down the stairs to see the falls up close. Climbing back up could be difficult for people with limited mobility or those who are not in shape. Getting to the falls once you are at the bottom of the stairs is spoiled by all the garbage that has been left by tourists and locals swimming. It's really too bad this can't be cleaned up as you do pay a small fee to get into the waterfall.

Beautiful view. The view of the waterfall is worth going to have a look. You do have to pay a small fee to enter. The water us a bit dirty and I would not swim in it and there is some rubbish but that is often the case in Bali. There are a lot of steps to get down to the bottom though. We are glad though that we went.
Dirty. So many plastics on river bank.. The government has to be more care of their tourism assets and the villagers too..

Good to pass by and take photos. The view is nice and it is good to pass if you are nearby to have a drink and enjoy the view and take photos. Entrance is only 10000 RP For adult and 5000 for child.The steps are high and steep with minimal safety, therefore we didn't go down since we had our kids (2, 3 and 5 years old) with us.
paying view. nice view not far from ubud, you can go by bike, the only negative point is that you have to pay for parking

Pass on this one. And if you don't pass, don't bother going all the way down. You really don't want to swim here.It's a pretty enough waterfall, but it's contaminated with sewage. You can smell it if you decide to ignore me and go down. The approach is very easy with well maintained stairs. There's one tricky section where you'll have to go into the water, but there's a rope to cling to.I went to Sekumpul Waterfalls the day before, so this one really pales in comparison.

Huge steps down towards, but not so bad at top. I had back pain so didn't make it down towards the bottom, the view from top looks niceRP,10,000 Don't forget the arrival US35, & Departure fee RP200,000.
great views, dirty area. the views are great, but this place needs to be cleaned up. lots of trash at the bottom of the steps leading to the falls. it's nice to see if you're in the area.
Nice view. We were pressed for time so we didn't make the trek down to the bottom. Nice look out area on top which was great for taking pics. Was 10k rupiah to get in.

Impressive waterfall which could be better. After a day in Ubud we looked forward to a splash under the falls. Swimming under the waterfall was exhilarating but the environs are very dirty and a little more infrastructure could make this beautiful site accessible to more.
stunning. lots of steps to get down to the waterfall but an easy walk, stunning when you arrive at the bottom & look up to see this amazing huge waterfall. water was so refreshing for a swim.

Nature's finest refreshment !. Having a swim at this waterfall never get's boring ! It is a nice walk down and you need to do a little effort to reach it , but then the reward is all worth it . I mean , swimming at a waterfall . . . does it get any better than this ? Just one thing , don't go there when it has been raining , because the water will be dirty ( brownish ) . When beautiful weather , the perfect way of freshening up and cooling down !

Very dirty. We went on a day trip which included a visit to Tegenungan Waterfall. I was dissapointed with the condition of the facilities and when we reached the bottom of the very steap steps, there was loads of rubbish and pollution everywhere and there was no way I would be getting into the water. It made me feel sad that what could be a very lovely place was once again in a terrible state. We had to pay an entrance fee, but this obviously was not being used to maintain the area. Very Very dirty and not worth the trip.

Prepare to be soaked. We visited waterfall afternoon as one stop of tour and we had only 30mins for it so we didnt go in water. From the parking lot to waterfall spot you must go down stars which are little steep. If you wanna go closest or totally under it you must cross the river which is not that deep and we regret that we didnt go. There are kind of "showers" after you are done. Recommended for everyone who wanna see something different than temples ;) entrance is 10k Rp.

Nice to see if you have time!. The trip is nice to see if you have time and want to take a short walk. The swimming is nice and you can look up at the waterfall. The place is however littered that is typical for SE Asia.

Nothing you can't see at any waterfall but if you like the outdoors it's a cool place to go. A good trek down a flight of stairs that my 4.5 month Prego wife did so not too hard, the walk up is even better:) at the bottom they have running water from a different stream that is clean to cool off under. I wanted to hike all the way to the waterfall and get in but we were with other people that didn't come down so I didn't want to make them wait for that. That would have made the trip a lot better.

Ok.... Looking at it from the top, you can't wait to get there and go for a swim. Once you're down there, you find extremelly hard to go through the rocks and get to the water. The place is also very dirty, plastic bags, bottles, nappies and all sorts of garbage are between the rocks... we stayed there for maybe 15 minutes as you can't really swim. Oh, and hold your bikinis!

Good view!. Keen to see the waterfall one a diversion was offered by our guide. A small per person fee was charged before the car could proceed. If you have to go out of your way to see the waterfall, my advice would be don't bother, but if it's a quick diversion, why not.Think carefully about where to park if the car park is full, we very nearly ended up down the bank!
Very nice view. Nice waterfall. Magnificent views. Great photo opportunities. Had a long path to go down close to the water but the view from up the hill was just as nice as we were pressed for time.

Wonderful, only if you get to reach near the waterfall. I liked the view of the waterfall..but sadly I couldn't find a way to get close to the waterfall, the path towards the waterfall was filled with muddy water. WIsh I could get close to the waterfall, then it would have been a 10 on 10 experience.The fee is minimal, 10,000 IDR per pax (around 1 SGD)

Don't do the tourist thing. The normal tourist entrance to the waterfall is very easy to get to and you get charged on entry.What a fellow backpacker and I did was to ride bikes to the opposite side of the river. There was no-one to charge us and we had access to the top, bottom and a km of river either way.There were some amazing sights and we met some locals who were very nice.
Just ok. Nothing great about this falls. We thought it to be more of a water stream than a fall. Not worth going to. Not to forget the expensive tender coconut at this place

Small Waterwall, Nothing Good. It was an easy to get to waterfall by car. But, upon reaching there, we had to pay high entrance fees and were greeted with a small and not that pretty waterfall. Its just an ordinary waterfall. There are nicer waterfalls outside bali. Dont bother wasting time coming up here unless you are really on the way visitng the cultural sights in ubud

Nice view with good surrounding. There is a small pavilion at the base of the waterfall where you can sit there to enjoy the view of the surrounding. Be careful of stairs to the waterfall, they are very steep and huge steps in between. I spent about 5 min at the base of the waterfall, as my tour guide was rushing us to another location. Overall it is a huge waterfall with great view and nothing else there. If you have another much interesting place to visit, I will recommend to skip this or put it in your last priority. If I remember correctly, the entrance fee is Rp10,000 per person.

Nice place to ride a bike to from Ubud. Since Tegenungan Waterfall is about 6.5 miles outside Ubud, it is a nice place to ride a bike. Once you are out of all the crazy traffic of town, most of the roads are fairly quite. You will pass through 2 small villages andsee many rice fields along the way. Note - It is a gradual downhill hide to the waterfall, so coming back is tougher than getting there.

Worth the 2 hours taxi ride from our ship. This was a 2 hour taxi ride one way but well worth the ride. Lots of stairs to navigate down and then back up but worth the exercise. Saw a lot of the countryside on the ride out and back.
Stunning. There's not a lot to say about a waterfall other than that it is stunning. I saw from a distance and was so happy my driver made the stop.

Bagus Waterfall !. Went to Tegenungan Waterfall this morning and it was better than expected, based upon the reviews we had read about it. Very easy to find whilst riding the scooter, using the trip advisor map, it took us around 20mins to ride there from Cocos Supermarket. It costs $1 AUD to enter which is nothing, there is also a little "warung" selling snacks and drinks. I also crossed the river to get a closer look at the waterfall, which was a lot easier than the flight of steps ! Definitely worth trip out there if your staying in Ubud or surrounding areas.

Small but superb.. Small but excellent view amidst green forest.We walked down all the way through the steep stairs to the waterfall. While going down we found another small waterfall. Worth to visit.

Beautiful Waterfall. Really enjoyed our visit to Tegenungan Waterfall. Wonderful for taking photos of and you can walk down to the river and nearer the waterfall if you wish. It only costs 10 000 rph each and well worth the drive through the Gianyar area to see it.

Small but cheap. For 10,000 RP gets you into the viewing platform, or you can walk down the trail to the base of the river and then up to the falls. It is not spectacular, but a pretty little falls with a veiwing area in restaurants. It is a nice place to stretch your legs and sit with a bit of scenery. Worth the cheap cost of admission, not much more.

Small but pretty. Our driver took us to this waterfall we looked at it from a viewing point, it was small but still a great view. Local children were selling things but weren't pushy and very cute I just had to buy something. Worth a visit if you can fit it in.
Not bad. Well, i have seen better waterfalls, however, this one is small, however, if you are sweating while you are on the day tour this would be a good spot to wash up.
A lovely little stop to incorporate with other attractions.. A lovely relaxed little stop off, we combined it with a trip to the elephant cave and bali fun world.

Just a small waterfall. Our driver recommended Tegenungan Waterfall which according to him is “beautiful”.The entrance fee costs 10,000 rupiah per person. We were quite disappointed that the waterfall is actually very small and the water is brownish. We walked down the long steep flight of stairs to the waterfall. We thought we could swim in the water, but it is too brownish to swim. The walk up the steep stairs is really exhausting. Perhaps the water will be much clearer on other months.

nice view - but no swim with small kids. we went here today. the entrance fee is 10k rp per person,... so that is fine.The view from the platform is nice. As it is rainy time there was plenty of water,.. but it was rather brown. I promised my son to go for a swim, but the water was too much for a 4 year old. The walk is rather much especially when it slippery. But even if you go for the view, have a fresh coconut on the viewer platform it is well worth the money. TIP - combine it with your shopping trips in Mas.

A must go!. The place was beautiful and the water was so refreshin to swim! No scammers or harrasing kids were there and the walk down to the waterfall was much less of a hike than we thought from other reviews!The entrance fee was 10,000idr for an adult. There are two booths where you can buy ice cold drinks. If you go there, bring swimsuit with u and get to the water or you'll regret it! :)

Good stop ! . We went there today with my girlfriend and the entrance fee was 10.000 rupiah per person.The top view is really not impressive at all, but take the stair down and go close to the waterfall. Don't forget your swimming suit also.Tip: it's actually a very special place for balinese people. They take their wedding pictures on the main rock in front of the fall. In our case we assist to the "show". Very nice people and welcoming to explain their culture :)

Stunning. The Tegenungan Waterfall was on my list of places to visit during my stay in Bali. My expectations were met upon arrival and witnessing this beautiful sight of nature. The viewing point is phenomenal and offers food an refreshments to visitors. Getting down to the waterfall requires a hike down a steep flight of stairs. Once at the base, there is a natural showering area separated for genders in which the water is so fresh you can drink. I was able to swim near the base of the falls and hear the roar of the falling water. Being that it was the rainy season, there was a fast current which made the swim slightly dangerous.

Good stop. This stop was part of our day tour and it was a good stop after spending a long while in the bus. Not a tourist trap although there are kids trying to sell you stuff. The waterfall is nothing spectacular but the atmosphere of the place is serene compared to downtown Kuta. Worth the stop.

Not worth the stop. The waterfall is far away from the viewing spot, and the entire thing was a terrible brown colour when we visited. Our tour guide said it was because they were cutting rock out to make houses, which makes it very dirty. Not nice to look at, and the children target you when you step out of the car, and will not stop harassing you until you are back in the car, even once you refuse. They will guilt trip you saying they need money for food to survive, which is hard to believe when the girl pulled out her mobile phone to answer it, and I saw the other boy texting someone on his own mobile.

Just exhale. We stopped to view this waterfall, after a long drive, and just exhaled. The view was to die for, so very much Bali.The drive down to the viewing area was through Balinese homes, no tourist traps.There were children trying to sell bits and pieces, and we bought some things to help[ them out.The rest from noisy Bali was worth it, and this is where I would like to stay next time.

Take your swimsuit and go for a bath. I agree with other reviewers: the scenery from the top of the hill is not exactly overwhelming, so this is most likely not the perfect destination for a bus tour. But for the more adventurous: you can get really close to the waterfall and take a "shower" or a swim, which is really great fun. The path that goes down requires you to take some big steps. On the foothill there is a nice bathing place, with separated male and female baths where the water comes down the hill. But you can get much closer than that: you can actually approach the waterfall itself by taking a narrow path on the left side of the river. If you go closer, you will see that there are some ropes attached to the rock. Leave your shoes at the big stones, hold on tight to the ropes and make sure that you don't slip on the wet stones. You can get as close to the waterfall as you wish since the water on the left-hand-side is pretty shallow. I stopped maybe five meters beforehand because the water came down with quite a force. Perfect for a "shower" even from this distance. Alternatively, you can also take a bath as the farther side of the river has some not-so-shallow parts. I went in August, I realise though that the depth of the river might vary depending on the rainy/non-rainy season.

Only costs 5,000 Rupiah. At least the ticket is cheap. Might be impressive in the Autumn after the rains. I was there in July and there wasn't a lot of water. Didn't bother climbing down the steps. Stayed about 10 minutes. Basically a waste of time. Recommend you do something else instead.
Nice Quiet Place. This is a quiet place to just chill and enjoy the breeze. The steps down are steep so the elderly may wanna just sit at the warung nearby and have a drink.

Disappointed Is Not The Word. I can't believe that this is even a part of a tour. The waterfall is on the other side of Indonesia. The driver pays someone to park, you walk to an area like a patio, where at least 5 kids are begging you to buy a fan. There's a store there to buy a few snacks and unnecessary trinkets and souvenirs. A few logs to sit on and you watch the waterfall from this far distance. What's so great about that? I thought you would actually be able to go into the water as the water is falling. Not even close. It was nice for background photos though.

Nothing special.. dont bother visiting. This was quite a waste of time simply visiting, seemed a bit out of the way but the tour guide insisted that its worth a see. Once we reached the place we were amused to see just how lame a waterfall could get and on top of that the place actually gets hyped a bit as a tourist attraction. Not surprisingly hardly any tourists at the place either. Try to skip this unless your trying to meditate.

Great to Contemplate while Relaxing from Your Trip. A small entrance fee is asked at the entrance. No swimming possible. It's not the biggest waterfall, but it's still an impressive and wild-looking waterfall. The good point is there are almost no tourist, so a great place to relax. There are one or two shops where you can grab a coffee or a snack.You can contemplate the waterfall from far or take the stairs down to get closer to it, but after the stairs, there is no clearly defined way to get closer, which means you'll have to improvise with your own path. The day I visited, the water looked dirty, probably due to some rain showers.

Do not waste your time. I personally feel there is nothing much. Water fall is not big and you can't play at the waterfall. Entrance fee is needed. You just take photo and see the waterfall from far. Within 10 minutes, you can leave.

natural waterfall in Ubud. Tegenungan waterfall is worth place to drive if you're taking any trip to east Bali specially on the way to Kintamani - Tampak siring area. Located in south east Ubud, This waterfall promise natural green atmosphere, silent, free from industrial activity before taking trip to this waterfall expected some condition bellow:1. even it is one of the tourist attraction in Ubud, Tegenungan is still lack of tourism facilities, so be sure to bring your personal requirements before your trip 2. Perfect for visitor who likes green environment, where they can climb down to the hidden waterfall and fells it's freshness. But visitors with disability still can view the waterfall form the small cafe" warung" little bit far from waterfal area Wish my info can help anybody

Wow. I wanted to see waterfalls. My hotel was in Sanur so this was quite near. Only couple of tourist! Waterfalls was beauty! It cost 5000 rupias so only 50 cents.There is also a small cafetearia, where you an see the waterfalls if you dont want to go down to the steps

Beauty and in short distance ,. The waterfall of Tegenungan is a beuatiful one.Not overloaded by tourists like GitGit.From above (small warung) panoramic view.Not too difficult to go down to the bottom.Easy steps.There is a (very) small fee for intrance/parking.Not too far from Sanur.Don't take the main road.Find your way through villages and ricefields !

Very good stop if you're traveling around by car.. Very nice stop on the way from Denpasar to Ubud.Since you have to walk only 100 m from the parking, you'll need only 15 min to see the waterfall but the view is really great. We had to pay 15 000 IDR to enter here.I think there is a way to walk around the waterfall but traveling with young children we didn't want that.

Tegenungan waterfall. there is a waterfall on the way from Ubud to Kuta, its a small village, very quiet but the infrastructure is not quiet good to reach the waterfall. actually its a very nice place to stay because the water so fresh and like many other Balinese river they always clean as water is a symbol of purification in their tradition also. there are small warung offering water and snack and soda drink as well as cold bintang beer after your long walking to the waterfall. the stairs is made from cement and its slippery when wet so take a good care since Bali is topical and very humid so many moss in the step of the stairs also.
